original: ldog pa med na zhes bya ba bdag med pa med na gdon mi za bar bdag yod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ldog pa med na zhes bya ba bdag med pa med na gdon mi za bar bdag yod par 'gyur ro //
translated: If the absence of self is not refuted, then without a doubt the self would exist.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: phung po gzhan zhes bya ba'o //üîΩdper na bdag med ldog pa dngos po yin pa'i phyir gson po'i lus la bdag 'grub pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: phung po gzhan zhes bya ba'o // dper na bdag med ldog pa dngos po yin pa'i phyir gson po'i lus la bdag 'grub pa de bzhin du /
translated: Because the aggregates are different.üîΩFor example, just as the self is established in the living body because the absence of self is refuted, so too the absence of the self would exist in the similar class because the absence of the absence of the self is a positive object.

original: mthun pa'i phyogs las ldog pa med pa yang dngos po yin pa'i phyir mthun pa'i phyogs la yang ldog pa la sogs pa yod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mthun pa'i phyogs las ldog pa med pa yang dngos po yin pa'i phyir mthun pa'i phyogs la yang ldog pa la sogs pa yod par 'gyur ro //
translated: But if the absence of the absence of the self does not exist in the similar class, then the absence of the absence of the self would exist in the dissimilar class.

original: 'on te mthun pa'i phyogs la ldog pa med kyang yod par khas mi len na /
analyzed: 'on te mthun pa'i phyogs la ldog pa med kyang yod par khas mi len na /
translated: But if you do not accept that the absence of the absence of the self exists in the similar class,

original: de lta na bdag med pa ldog kyang bdag khas blang bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: de lta na bdag med pa ldog kyang bdag khas blang bar mi bya'o //
translated: then you should not accept that the self exists in the dissimilar class, even though the absence of the absence of the self is refuted.

original: des na mtshungs pa kho na'o zhes lan brjod pa ni /
analyzed: des na mtshungs pa kho na'o zhes lan brjod pa ni /
translated: Therefore, the response that it is exactly the same

original: mi mthun pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mi mthun pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: is not correct.

original: ci ltar 'dod pa 'grub pa ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci ltar 'dod pa 'grub pa ma yin zhe na /
translated: How is it not established as desired?üîΩIf the absence of the absence of the self is a positive object,

original: gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: then the self would exist.üîΩBut if the self does not exist like a non-existent horn of a rabbit,

original: 'on te med pa bzhin du yod pa yang med do zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te med pa bzhin du yod pa yang med do zhe na /
translated: then the absence of the absence of the self does not exist.

original: med pa log na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: med pa log na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe negation of nonexistence‚Äù is the negation of the nonexistence of the negation.

original: gnyi ga 'gog pa'i rgyu @214b mtshan dogs par byed pa ni mthun pa'i phyogs zhes bya ba'o //üîΩde lta ma yin no zhes bya ba ni med pa ldog pa nyid yod pa yin no zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gnyi ga 'gog pa'i rgyu @214b mtshan dogs par byed pa ni mthun pa'i phyogs zhes bya ba'o // de lta ma yin no zhes bya ba ni med pa ldog pa nyid yod pa yin no zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The reason for the negation of both is stated in the words ‚Äúbecause of the presence of the similar instance.‚ÄùüîΩThe words ‚Äúit is not so‚Äù mean that the negation of nonexistence is existence.

original: 'gog pa ni ma yin te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'gog pa ni ma yin te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The words ‚Äúit is not a negation‚Äù mean that it is not a negation.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is it not a negation?

original: mthun pa'i phyogs med pa nyid du mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mthun pa'i phyogs med pa nyid du mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the presence of the similar instance is not tenable as nonexistence.

original: 'di nyid brjod pa ni /
analyzed: 'di nyid brjod pa ni /
translated: This is stated in the words

original: srog la sogs pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: srog la sogs pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚Äúlife, etc.‚Äù

original: de'i phyir gson po'i lus bzhin du mthun pa'i phyogs la ldog pa med na yod pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir gson po'i lus bzhin du mthun pa'i phyogs la ldog pa med na yod pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, just as in the case of a living body, if there is no negation of the similar instance, there is existence.

original: 'on te mi 'dod na de lta na'o 'o na mthun pa'i phyogs bzhin du gson po'i lus la yang ldog pa med na yod par mi 'gyur ro zhes brjod pa ni /
analyzed: 'on te mi 'dod na de lta na'o 'o na mthun pa'i phyogs bzhin du gson po'i lus la yang ldog pa med na yod par mi 'gyur ro zhes brjod pa ni /
translated: But if you do not accept this, then just as in the case of the similar instance, if there is no negation of the living body, it would not be existent.

original: ci ltar zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ci ltar zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is stated in the words ‚ÄúHow then can it be said that . . .üîΩ. . . the living body is existent?‚Äù

original: slar yang mi mthun par dogs pa ni 'on te zhes bya ba nas zhe na'i bar ro //
analyzed: slar yang mi mthun par dogs pa ni 'on te zhes bya ba nas zhe na'i bar ro //
translated: Again, fearing that it is not so, he says, ‚ÄúBut if the body is present, etc.‚Äù

original: gson po'i lus 'di yod pa yin te des na de la ni bzlog pa bdag med par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: gson po'i lus 'di yod pa yin te des na de la ni bzlog pa bdag med par 'gyur gyi /
translated: The body of a living person is present, and therefore, the reversal of that would be the nonexistence of the self.

original: mthun pa'i phyogs la ni bzlog par 'gyur ba ma yin te mthun pa'i phyogs la ni med pa'i phyogs phyir ro zhes 'brel to //
analyzed: mthun pa'i phyogs la ni bzlog par 'gyur ba ma yin te mthun pa'i phyogs la ni med pa'i phyogs phyir ro zhes 'brel to //
translated: But it is not the case that there is a reversal with respect to the similar class, because there is no similar class.

original: 'o na zhes bya ba ni grub pa'i mtha'o //
analyzed: 'o na zhes bya ba ni grub pa'i mtha'o //
translated: ‚Äú But if, etc.‚Äù is the conclusion.

original: mthun pa'i phyogs ni med pa yin te /
analyzed: mthun pa'i phyogs ni med pa yin te /
translated: The similar class is nonexistent.

original: des na de ni med pa las mi ldog go //
analyzed: des na de ni med pa las mi ldog go //
translated: Therefore, it is not the case that there is a reversal from the nonexistent.

original: 'di nyid brjod pa ni med pa ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di nyid brjod pa ni med pa ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is what is being said: ‚ÄúThe nonexistent, etc.‚Äù

original: de zhes bya ba ni yod pa'o //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni yod pa'o //
translated: ‚Äú That‚Äù refers to the existent.

original: de ni zhes bya ba ni med pa'o //
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba ni med pa'o //
translated: ‚Äú That‚Äù refers to the nonexistent.

original: gal te mthun pa'i phyogs med pa yin yang de la srog la sogs pa med par ci ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gal te mthun pa'i phyogs med pa yin yang de la srog la sogs pa med par ci ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: But if the similar class is nonexistent, how can there be the nonexistence of life, etc. in that?

original: ci ltar zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ci ltar zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚Äú How?‚Äù

original: de la mthun pa'i phyogs la'o //
analyzed: de la mthun pa'i phyogs la'o //
translated: In that, with respect to the similar class.

original: ci ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ci ltar zhe na /
translated: How?

original: med pa la ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: med pa la ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚Äú In the nonexistent, etc.‚Äù

original: de yang zhes bya ba ni srog la sogs pa med pa nyid do //
analyzed: de yang zhes bya ba ni srog la sogs pa med pa nyid do //
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù refers to the absence of life, etc.

original: de la ni mthun pa'i phyogs la'o //
analyzed: de la ni mthun pa'i phyogs la'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIn that case‚Äù means in the case of the similar instance.

original: de lta yin na zhes bya ba ni lan no //
analyzed: de lta yin na zhes bya ba ni lan no //
translated: ‚ÄúIf that were so‚Äù is the response.

original: dogs pa ni de zhes bya ba ste gson po'i lus ni yod pa'i phyir bdag med pa ldog pa nyid du 'gyur ba nyid do zhe na /
analyzed: dogs pa ni de zhes bya ba ste gson po'i lus ni yod pa'i phyir bdag med pa ldog pa nyid du 'gyur ba nyid do zhe na /
translated: The doubt is ‚Äúthat‚Äù . If the body of the living person exists, then the absence of self would be negated.

original: gzhan yod pa'i sa zhes bya ba ni gson po'i lus yod pas so //üîΩ'khrul can zhes bya ba ni dngos po med pa la 'khrul pa can nam /
analyzed: gzhan yod pa'i sa zhes bya ba ni gson po'i lus yod pas so // 'khrul can zhes bya ba ni dngos po med pa la 'khrul pa can nam /
translated: ‚ÄúIn the case of the existence of another‚Äù means in the case of the existence of the body of the living person.

original: dngos po la 'khrul pa can te /
analyzed: dngos po la 'khrul pa can te /
translated: ‚ÄúErroneous‚Äù means erroneous with regard to nonexistence, or erroneous with regard to existence.

original: dngos po med pa'am ldog pa med pa'o //üîΩmthun pa'i phyogs la mthong bar dngos po med nges pa'am /
analyzed: dngos po med pa'am ldog pa med pa'o // mthun pa'i phyogs la mthong bar dngos po med nges pa'am /
translated: It is not nonexistence or negation.

original: dngos po la nges pa nyid du byed pa zhes bya bar ci ltar 'gyur te mi 'gyur ba kho na'o //
analyzed: dngos po la nges pa nyid du byed pa zhes bya bar ci ltar 'gyur te mi 'gyur ba kho na'o //
translated: How could one determine the nonexistence of an entity in the similar instance, or the existence of an entity in the dissimilar instance? It could not be done.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gang gis phyir rang gi nyes pas dngos po'i dngos po med pa la sogs pa la 'khrul pa can ni /
analyzed: gang gis phyir rang gi nyes pas dngos po'i dngos po med pa la sogs pa la 'khrul pa can ni /
translated: Because the erroneous person, by his own fault, is mistaken about the existence or nonexistence of an entity, etc.

original: gson po'i lus gzhan gyis ci ltar @215a * //
analyzed: gson po'i lus gzhan gyis ci ltar @215a * //
translated: How could the body of a living person be the other?

original: gzhan du dngos po med pa la sogs pa la 'khrul pa med par 'gyur te mi 'gyur ba kho na'o //
analyzed: gzhan du dngos po med pa la sogs pa la 'khrul pa med par 'gyur te mi 'gyur ba kho na'o //
translated: And how could there be non-error with respect to the non-existence of a thing, etc.? There could not be!

original: 'chad pa ni rang nyid ces bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'chad pa ni rang nyid ces bya ba ste /
translated: The explanation is as follows:

original: ldog pa med pa'am dngos po med pa'o //
analyzed: ldog pa med pa'am dngos po med pa'o //
translated: ‚Äúnot ceasing‚Äù means not being a non-thing.

original: gzhan yod pas zhes bya ba ni gson po'i lus yod pas so //
analyzed: gzhan yod pas zhes bya ba ni gson po'i lus yod pas so //
translated: ‚ÄúBecause of the existence of the other‚Äù means because of the existence of the body of a living person.

original: de lta ma yin pas zhes bya ba ni med pas so //
analyzed: de lta ma yin pas zhes bya ba ni med pas so //
translated: ‚ÄúOtherwise‚Äù means if it did not exist.

original: de la zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba ni /
translated: ‚ÄúIn that case‚Äù means

original: dngos po dang dngos po med pa la'o //
analyzed: dngos po dang dngos po med pa la'o //
translated: with respect to a thing and a non-thing.

original: med pa la zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: med pa la zhes bya ba ni /
translated: ‚ÄúWith respect to the non-existent‚Äù means

original: mthun pa'i phyogs la'o //
analyzed: mthun pa'i phyogs la'o //
translated: with respect to the similar instance.

original: yod pa 'ga' zhig ces bya ba ni srog la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: yod pa 'ga' zhig ces bya ba ni srog la sogs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúSome existent‚Äù means life, etc.

original: de'i tshe med pa yang zhes bya ba srog la sogs pa yang yod pa la zhes bya ba mi mthun pa'i phyogs bum pa la'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe med pa yang zhes bya ba srog la sogs pa yang yod pa la zhes bya ba mi mthun pa'i phyogs bum pa la'o //
translated: ‚ÄúAt that time, the non-existent‚Äù means life, etc. ‚ÄúWith respect to the existent‚Äù means with respect to the dissimilar instance, the pot.

original: 'di ni zhes bya ba ni de ni yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni zhes bya ba ni de ni yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThis‚Äù means ‚Äúbecause of the existence of that,‚Äù etc.

original: don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: don ni 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning is as follows:

original: ci ltar med pa gzhi nyid du mi 'dod pa de bzhin du ston pa nyid du yang mi 'gyur te khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ci ltar med pa gzhi nyid du mi 'dod pa de bzhin du ston pa nyid du yang mi 'gyur te khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Just as nonexistence is not accepted as a basis, in the same way, it would not be a teacher, because there is no difference.

original: des na ci ltar mthun pa'i phyogs srog la sogs pa yod par mi 'dod pa de bzhin du mi mthun pa'i phyogs la yang yod par 'dod par mi bya ste /
analyzed: des na ci ltar mthun pa'i phyogs srog la sogs pa yod par mi 'dod pa de bzhin du mi mthun pa'i phyogs la yang yod par 'dod par mi bya ste /
translated: Therefore, just as one does not accept the existence of life, etc., in the case of a similar class, in the same way, one should not accept the existence of life, etc., in the case of a dissimilar class.

original: des na srog la sogs pa ldog pa can du ci ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: des na srog la sogs pa ldog pa can du ci ltar 'gyur /
translated: So how could life, etc., be negated?

original: 'di yang zhes bya ba ni med pa yang rtogs pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di yang zhes bya ba ni med pa yang rtogs pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This also means that nonexistence is not a cognition.

original: sngar zhes bya ba ni yod pa rnams la dgag pa med ces bya ba der ro //
analyzed: sngar zhes bya ba ni yod pa rnams la dgag pa med ces bya ba der ro //
translated: Previously means in the passage that states, ‚ÄúThere is no negation of existents.‚Äù

original: bdag med na ldog kyang gson po'i lus la bdag mi 'grub po zhes brjod pa ni /
analyzed: bdag med na ldog kyang gson po'i lus la bdag mi 'grub po zhes brjod pa ni /
translated: If there is no self, even if one negates it, the self is not established in the living body.

original: gzhan yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is stated in the passage that begins with ‚ÄúMoreover.‚Äù

original: de las bzlog pa zhes bya ba ni sngon por nges pa'i rang bzhin gyis bdag las bzlog pa bdag med pa'o //
analyzed: de las bzlog pa zhes bya ba ni sngon por nges pa'i rang bzhin gyis bdag las bzlog pa bdag med pa'o //
translated: The opposite of that means the selflessness that is the opposite of the self that has the nature of being ascertained as blue.

original: de med na gson po'i lus la bdag med pa de yod par 'grub pa'o //
analyzed: de med na gson po'i lus la bdag med pa de yod par 'grub pa'o //
translated: If that is not so, then the non-existence of the self in the living body is established.

original: bdag med na srog la sogs pa ldog pa yang ma yin no zhes brjod pa ni /
analyzed: bdag med na srog la sogs pa ldog pa yang ma yin no zhes brjod pa ni /
translated: And it is not the case that when the self does not exist, life, etc., are refuted.

original: gzhan yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is what is said in the words ‚ÄúMoreover, . . . ‚Äù

original: 'jug pa ni yang zhes bya ba ni du ba la sogs pa ni me nyid 'jug bar byed pa ni yin gyi /
analyzed: 'jug pa ni yang zhes bya ba ni du ba la sogs pa ni me nyid 'jug bar byed pa ni yin gyi /
translated: ‚Äú Engagement‚Äù means that smoke, etc., are the engagement of fire itself, not of anything else.

original: gzhan ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan ni ma yin no //
translated: ‚Äú Non-existence‚Äù means that the non-existence of the effect is not the engagement of the non-existence of the cause.

original: brjod ma thag pa'i med na mi 'byung ba de yang rang nyid nges par byed pa la ltos pa yin no //
analyzed: brjod ma thag pa'i med na mi 'byung ba de yang rang nyid nges par byed pa la ltos pa yin no //
translated: And that invariable concomitance just mentioned is itself dependent on the ascertainment of the proof.

original: sgrub par byed pa de gang zhe na /
analyzed: sgrub par byed pa de gang zhe na /
translated: What is the proof?

original: 'bras bu mthong dang ma mthong ba'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu mthong dang ma mthong ba'o //
translated: It is the seen and unseen effect.

original: gal te de'i sgrub par byed pa rgyu dang 'bras bu nyid yin gyi /
analyzed: gal te de'i sgrub par byed pa rgyu dang 'bras bu nyid yin gyi /
translated: If the proof of that is the relation of cause and effect, and not the seen and unseen,

original: mthong ba dang ma mthong ba ni ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: mthong ba dang ma mthong ba ni ma yin zhe na /
translated: then why did you say that the seen and unseen are the proof?

original: de dag ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: de dag ces bya ba'o //
translated: This is what is said in the words ‚ÄúThose . . . ‚Äù

original: mthong ba dang ma mthong ba nyid rgyu dang 'bras bu yin te /
analyzed: mthong ba dang ma mthong ba nyid rgyu dang 'bras bu yin te /
translated: The seen and unseen are the relation of cause and effect.

original: des na med na mi 'byung ba nyid rgyu dang 'bras bu'i @215b sgrub byed can yin na /
analyzed: des na med na mi 'byung ba nyid rgyu dang 'bras bu'i @215b sgrub byed can yin na /
translated: Therefore, if non-arising in the absence of something were the proof of cause and effect,

original: mthong ba dang mthong ba nyid kyi sgrub byed can du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mthong ba dang mthong ba nyid kyi sgrub byed can du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: then seeing and seeing itself would be the proof. This is the meaning.

original: med na mi 'byung ba nyid ni 'grub pa ma yin no zhes 'brel to //
analyzed: med na mi 'byung ba nyid ni 'grub pa ma yin no zhes 'brel to //
translated: It is connected that non-arising in the absence of something is not established.

original: ci ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ci ltar zhe na /
translated: How is it so?

original: sgrub par byed pa mthong ba dang ma mthong ba'i mtshan nyid can med par ci lta bur gyur pa zhig ces na rjes su 'gro ldog dag gi sgrub byed du gyur pa'o //
analyzed: sgrub par byed pa mthong ba dang ma mthong ba'i mtshan nyid can med par ci lta bur gyur pa zhig ces na rjes su 'gro ldog dag gi sgrub byed du gyur pa'o //
translated: If the proof has the characteristic of seeing and not seeing, then how could it be without something? It is the proof of positive and negative concomitance.

original: 'o na rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa ni rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos pos sgrub pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa ni rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos pos sgrub pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that positive and negative concomitance is established by the nature of cause and effect,

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: then the nature of cause and effect is...

original: me med na mi 'byung ba nyid kyi sgrub byed med pa las don gzhan te tha dad pa'i gong bu la sogs gang yin pa'i /
analyzed: me med na mi 'byung ba nyid kyi sgrub byed med pa las don gzhan te tha dad pa'i gong bu la sogs gang yin pa'i /
translated: The proof of non-arising in the absence of fire is something different, separate from the absence, such as a lump.

original: gong bu la sogs pa de ni yod kyang gzhan me yod par ro //
analyzed: gong bu la sogs pa de ni yod kyang gzhan me yod par ro //
translated: That mass, etc. exists, but fire exists as other than that.

original: de med na ni med med na /
analyzed: de med na ni med med na /
translated: If that does not exist, it does not exist.

original: med par zhes bya ba'i gong bu med par ro //
analyzed: med par zhes bya ba'i gong bu med par ro //
translated: If it does not exist, the mass does not exist.

original: ci ltar na de med na med par mi rtogs she na /
analyzed: ci ltar na de med na med par mi rtogs she na /
translated: How is it that if that does not exist, it is not understood that it does not exist?

original: me de ni gong bu'i bya ba bar byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: me de ni gong bu'i bya ba bar byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that fire does not perform the function of the mass.

original: khyab byed ma yin la log pas kyang ci ste mi ldog ce na /
analyzed: khyab byed ma yin la log pas kyang ci ste mi ldog ce na /
translated: If it is not a pervader, why is it not reversed by the reversal of that?

original: khyab par byed pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba ste me la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: khyab par byed pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba ste me la sogs pa'o //
translated: It is not a pervader, that is, fire, etc.

original: gzhan ni gong bu'o //
analyzed: gzhan ni gong bu'o //
translated: The other is the mass.

original: 'on te bdag ni khyab par byed pa kho na ma yin nam /
analyzed: 'on te bdag ni khyab par byed pa kho na ma yin nam /
translated: But isn't the self a pervader?

original: ci ltar na de log pas srog la sogs pa ldog par byed pa ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci ltar na de log pas srog la sogs pa ldog par byed pa ma yin zhe na /
translated: How is it that by the reversal of that, life, etc. are not reversed?

original: bdag kyang zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: bdag kyang zhes gsungs so //
translated: The self also, it is said.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Thus, it is said.

original: bdag tu yod pa med pa na srog la sogs pa de dag med pa ni mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag tu yod pa med pa na srog la sogs pa de dag med pa ni mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: When the existence of the self does not exist, the non-existence of those life, etc. is not possible.

original: dogs pa ni 'on te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dogs pa ni 'on te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The doubt is: But if that is so, etc.

original: ci ltar na de tsam kho nas 'di rgyu yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci ltar na de tsam kho nas 'di rgyu yin zhe na /
translated: Why is it that only that much is a cause?

original: rgyu dang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rgyu dang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúCause‚Äù and so on.

original: thams cad du zhes bya ba ni bdag dang srog la sogs pa las yang ngo //
analyzed: thams cad du zhes bya ba ni bdag dang srog la sogs pa las yang ngo //
translated: ‚ÄúEverywhere‚Äù means from self, life force, and so on.

original: 'bras bu'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'bras bu'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba ni /
translated: ‚ÄúThe nature of the effect‚Äù means

original: rjes su 'gro ba tsam gyi 'bras bu'i rang bzhin tha dad pa rnams rgyu'i rjes las byung bar khas blangs pa'i phyir rgyu tha dad pa de dag 'bras bu 'byung zhes 'dod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba tsam gyi 'bras bu'i rang bzhin tha dad pa rnams rgyu'i rjes las byung bar khas blangs pa'i phyir rgyu tha dad pa de dag 'bras bu 'byung zhes 'dod par 'gyur ro //
translated: that because it is accepted that those that are different in nature as mere concomitants arise after the cause, it would be asserted that ‚Äúthose different causes give rise to the effect.‚Äù

original: de lta ma yin na de med pas med pa yin na /üîΩldog pa yang yod par thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na de med pas med pa yin na / ldog pa yang yod par thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If that were not so, then if it does not exist when that does not exist,üîΩthen it would follow that it would also not exist when it does not exist.

original: de dag med par gzhan las 'byung na /
analyzed: de dag med par gzhan las 'byung na /
translated: If it arises from another that does not exist,

original: ci ltar des bskyed par bya ba'i rang bzhin du 'gyur ba yin /
analyzed: ci ltar des bskyed par bya ba'i rang bzhin du 'gyur ba yin /
translated: how could it be the nature of what is generated by that?

original: 'chad pa ni gal te zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'chad pa ni gal te zhes bya'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIf‚Äù is the explanation.

original: dogs pa ni gzhan las kyang des bskyed pa'i rang bzhin 'byung ngo zhe na /
analyzed: dogs pa ni gzhan las kyang des bskyed pa'i rang bzhin 'byung ngo zhe na /
translated: ‚ÄúIf it is suspected that the nature of what is generated by that arises from another,

original: lan ni ma yin te zhes bya'o //
analyzed: lan ni ma yin te zhes bya'o //
translated: the response is ‚ÄúNo.‚Äù

original: 'on te des bskyed pa'i rang bzhin ma yin pa kho na gzhan las 'byung ngo zhe @216a * //
analyzed: 'on te des bskyed pa'i rang bzhin ma yin pa kho na gzhan las 'byung ngo zhe @216a * //
translated: But if it is not produced by that, then it arises from another.

original: na ; gzhan las skyes pa'i 'bras bu /üîΩde'i rang bzhin nyid ma yin na ni des bskyed pa gang yin pa'i rang bzhin de nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: na ; gzhan las skyes pa'i 'bras bu / de'i rang bzhin nyid ma yin na ni des bskyed pa gang yin pa'i rang bzhin de nyid ma yin te /
translated: The effect produced from anotherüîΩis not of the nature of that.

original: 'on kyang gzhan gyi bskyed ba kho na'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang gzhan gyi bskyed ba kho na'o //
translated: If the effect produced from another is not of the nature of that, then it is not of the nature of that which produces it, but rather it is produced from another.

original: ci'i phyir gzhan las des bskyed pa'i rang bzhin mi 'byung zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir gzhan las des bskyed pa'i rang bzhin mi 'byung zhe na /
translated: Why does the nature of that which is produced from another not arise?

original: 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is like this.

original: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rtsod pa la don 'di yin te /
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rtsod pa la don 'di yin te /
translated: In the argument beginning with ‚ÄúIf the effect is different from the cause,‚Äù the meaning is this.

original: 'bras bu tha dad pa mthong ba ni bsnyon rtol gyi yul ma yin te /üîΩdes na 'di rgyu tha dad pa las sam /
analyzed: 'bras bu tha dad pa mthong ba ni bsnyon rtol gyi yul ma yin te / des na 'di rgyu tha dad pa las sam /
translated: The perception of a different effect is not a matter of dispute.

original: gzhan du yin zhes dpyad pas ci bya zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan du yin zhes dpyad pas ci bya zhes bya ba'o //
translated: So what is the point of analyzing whether it is from a different cause or from another?

original: 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs par yang don 'di yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs par yang don 'di yin te /
translated: In the argument beginning with ‚ÄúIt is like this,‚Äù the meaning is this.

original: 'bras bu tha dad pa ni tshogs pa tha dad pa kho na las yin par brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: 'bras bu tha dad pa ni tshogs pa tha dad pa kho na las yin par brjod par bya ste /
translated: The perception of a different effect must be said to be from a different assemblage.

original: de lta ma yin na nges pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na nges pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If it were not so, there would be no certainty.

original: ci ltar srog la sogs pa las bdag 'grub par 'gyur /
analyzed: ci ltar srog la sogs pa las bdag 'grub par 'gyur /
translated: How could the self be established from life and so on?

original: khyod kyi ni bdag ma mthong ba yin /
analyzed: khyod kyi ni bdag ma mthong ba yin /
translated: You have not seen the self.

original: yang srog la sogs pa de dang 'brel pa las rtogs pa yin na srog la sogs pa'i 'brel pa de yang tshogs pa tha dad pa kho na las 'bras bu tha dad pa yin no zhes bya ba de lta bu'i rang bzhin gyi nges pa med par miüîΩ'grub po zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: yang srog la sogs pa de dang 'brel pa las rtogs pa yin na srog la sogs pa'i 'brel pa de yang tshogs pa tha dad pa kho na las 'bras bu tha dad pa yin no zhes bya ba de lta bu'i rang bzhin gyi nges pa med par mi 'grub po zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Moreover, if it is understood from the connection with that, life and so on, then that connection with life and so on is not established as a certainty of the nature that the effect is different only from the different collection.

original: ci ltar bdag la nges pa ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci ltar bdag la nges pa ma yin zhe na /
translated: How is there no certainty regarding the self?

original: ci ltar zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ci ltar zhes bya ba'o //
translated: How?

original: don mi 'grub bo zhes bya ba ni bdag gi mtshan nyid kyi don mi nges pa'o //üîΩda ni rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag las srog la sogs pa skul bar byed pa'i rang bzhin gyi /
analyzed: don mi 'grub bo zhes bya ba ni bdag gi mtshan nyid kyi don mi nges pa'o // da ni rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag las srog la sogs pa skul bar byed pa'i rang bzhin gyi /
translated: The meaning is not established means that the meaning of the characteristic of the self is not ascertained.

original: bdag gi sgrub par byed pa dogs pa ni /
analyzed: bdag gi sgrub par byed pa dogs pa ni /
translated: Now, the doubt regarding the proof of the self, which is the nature that motivates life and so on from the perspective of following and reversing, isüîΩstated in the line, ‚ÄúOr, if it is the nature of the self that motivates life and so on.

original: 'on te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'on te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Or?üîΩ

original: srog la sogs pa 'gyur ba ma yin te zhes bya ba ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs la'o //
analyzed: srog la sogs pa 'gyur ba ma yin te zhes bya ba ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs la'o //
translated: Life and so on are not the self, because they are impermanent.

original: sogs pa smos pas ni /
analyzed: sogs pa smos pas ni /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúand so on‚Äù includes

original: 'byung ba dang rdub pa dang byed pa dang mthong ba rnam bsdu'o //
analyzed: 'byung ba dang rdub pa dang byed pa dang mthong ba rnam bsdu'o //
translated: exhalation and inhalation, and seeing.

original: 'byung ba dang rngub pa dag kyang rlung 'byin ba dang 'dren pa'i rang bzhin yin no //
analyzed: 'byung ba dang rngub pa dag kyang rlung 'byin ba dang 'dren pa'i rang bzhin yin no //
translated: Exhalation and inhalation are of the nature of the wind element.

original: des na ldog pa srid pas srog la sogs pas bdag rtogs so //
analyzed: des na ldog pa srid pas srog la sogs pas bdag rtogs so //
translated: Therefore, since it is possible to conceive of them as ceasing, life and so on are not the self.

original: rjes su 'gro ba ston pa ni /
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba ston pa ni /
translated: The following verse demonstrates the concomitance of the reason with the property to be proven.

original: des na sbud pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: des na sbud pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called ‚Äúexhalation.‚Äù

original: don 'di yin te /
analyzed: don 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning of this verse is as follows.

original: gang 'ga' zhig la 'byin pa dang 'dren pa yod pa de ni skul bar byed pa dang 'brel pa yin te /
analyzed: gang 'ga' zhig la 'byin pa dang 'dren pa yod pa de ni skul bar byed pa dang 'brel pa yin te /
translated: Whatever exists in relation to exhalation and inhalation is related to the instigator.

original: dper na sbud pa'i rlung dang pho long bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na sbud pa'i rlung dang pho long bzhin no //
translated: For example, the wind element is related to the bellows and the wind bag.

original: dbugs dbyung rngub dag kyang rlung 'byin pa dang 'dren pa'i rang bzhin yin no zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dbugs dbyung rngub dag kyang rlung 'byin pa dang 'dren pa'i rang bzhin yin no zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Exhalation and inhalation are of the nature of the wind element.

original: gang zhig byed par mthong ba de ni lta ba po dang 'brel ba yin @216b te ;
analyzed: gang zhig byed par mthong ba de ni lta ba po dang 'brel ba yin @216b te ;
translated: Whatever is seen to be an agent is related to the seer.

original: dper na skar khung na yod pa'i lta ba po'i skar khung nas mthong ba bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na skar khung na yod pa'i lta ba po'i skar khung nas mthong ba bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like the one who sees through a window seeing from the window.

original: gzugs la sogs pa mthong ba yang byed pas mthong ba yin no zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa mthong ba yang byed pas mthong ba yin no zhes bya ba'o //
translated: And it is seeing because it causes the seeing of form, etc.

original: lan ni de skul bar byed pa'i rang bzhin gyi bdag gi sgrub par byed pa de yang mi rigs so //üîΩci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: lan ni de skul bar byed pa'i rang bzhin gyi bdag gi sgrub par byed pa de yang mi rigs so // ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: The reply: That proof of the self which has the nature of instigating is also not correct.üîΩWhy?

original: 'di ltar zhes bya ba ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes bya ba ba'o //
translated: Because, as it is said,

original: bya ba med pa dang khyab pa 'di ni skul bar byed pa nyid du mi 'thad de srog la sogs pa la skul bar byed pa nyid kyis khyab na /
analyzed: bya ba med pa dang khyab pa 'di ni skul bar byed pa nyid du mi 'thad de srog la sogs pa la skul bar byed pa nyid kyis khyab na /
translated: this absence of activity and pervasion is not tenable as instigation. If it were pervaded by instigation of life, etc.,

original: 'dod pa la gnod par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'dod pa la gnod par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: it would be contrary to what is accepted.

original: byed pa med na gzugs la sogs pa mi mthong ba'i phyir zhes bya ba tsam gyis kyang bdag ni 'grub pa ma yin te /
analyzed: byed pa med na gzugs la sogs pa mi mthong ba'i phyir zhes bya ba tsam gyis kyang bdag ni 'grub pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not that the self is established merely by the statement, ‚ÄúBecause one does not see form, etc., without activity.‚Äù

original: 'on kyang byed pa med par gzugs la sogs pa mthong ba med na /
analyzed: 'on kyang byed pa med par gzugs la sogs pa mthong ba med na /
translated: However, if one does not see form, etc., without activity,

original: de nyid kyi sgrub bar byed par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: de nyid kyi sgrub bar byed par 'gyur gyi /
translated: that itself would be the proof.

original: lta bar byed pa po'i bdag ni ma yin no //
analyzed: lta bar byed pa po'i bdag ni ma yin no //
translated: The self is not the agent of seeing.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba ni byed pa dang bcas pa dang ma khyab pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba ni byed pa dang bcas pa dang ma khyab pa'o //
translated: ‚Äú Thus‚Äù means that it is not the case that it is both an agent and not all-pervasive.

original: lan ni de la yang zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: lan ni de la yang zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The response to that is ‚ÄúIn that case, . . .‚Äù

original: skul bar byed pa la'o //
analyzed: skul bar byed pa la'o //
translated: ‚Äú In that case‚Äù means in regard to the instigator.

original: gang zhig skul bar byed bde ni skul byed gzhan la ltos pa yin te /
analyzed: gang zhig skul bar byed bde ni skul byed gzhan la ltos pa yin te /
translated: The instigator is dependent on another instigator,

original: dper na sbud pa sbud mkhan bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na sbud pa sbud mkhan bzhin no //
translated: just as a bellows is dependent on a pumper.

original: bdag kyang skul bar byed pa yin no zhes de ltar skul bar byed pa gzhan la ltos bas na thug pa med do //
analyzed: bdag kyang skul bar byed pa yin no zhes de ltar skul bar byed pa gzhan la ltos bas na thug pa med do //
translated: Since the self is also an instigator, it is dependent on another instigator, and so there is an infinite regress.

original: gzhan gyi lta bas de skad brjod ba'i phyir gzhi la grub pa la sogs pa'i nyes pa ni med do //
analyzed: gzhan gyi lta bas de skad brjod ba'i phyir gzhi la grub pa la sogs pa'i nyes pa ni med do //
translated: Since this is stated from the perspective of another philosophical school, there is no fault of the basis being unestablished, and so on.

original: sgrub par byed pa gnyis po sun 'byin pa ni /
analyzed: sgrub par byed pa gnyis po sun 'byin pa ni /
translated: The second proof is refuted:

original: skar khung gi nang na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: skar khung gi nang na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIn the case of a window . . .‚Äù

original: de ltar gyur pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de ltar gyur pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: ‚Äú In that case‚Äù means

original: mig la sogs pa dang ldan pa'o //üîΩde la yang ni bdag la'o //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa dang ldan pa'o // de la yang ni bdag la'o //
translated: in the case of one who possesses eyes and so on.üîΩ‚Äú In that case‚Äù means in the case of the self.

original: bdag la yang byed pa yod mod //
analyzed: bdag la yang byed pa yod mod //
translated: ‚Äú In that case‚Äù means that the self does have activity.

original: 'on kyang de skad brjod de /
analyzed: 'on kyang de skad brjod de /
translated: Nevertheless, this is stated.

original: dper na skar khung gi nang nas lta pa'i dpes bdag dang po 'grub pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: dper na skar khung gi nang nas lta pa'i dpes bdag dang po 'grub pa de bzhin du /
translated: For example, just as the first self is established by the example of looking through a window,

original: dpe nyid kyis bdag nyid la yang bdag gnyis pa brtag dgos so //
analyzed: dpe nyid kyis bdag nyid la yang bdag gnyis pa brtag dgos so //
translated: in the same way, one must investigate the second self by means of the example itself.

original: de bzhin du gsum ba la sogs thug pa med bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du gsum ba la sogs thug pa med bar 'gyur ro //
translated: In the same way, there would be an infinite regress of a third, etc.

original: 'on te bdag gcig kho nas dgos pa grub pa'i phyir na /
analyzed: 'on te bdag gcig kho nas dgos pa grub pa'i phyir na /
translated: But if the first self alone is established because the purpose is accomplished,

original: gnyis pa la sogs par rtogs pa don med na /
analyzed: gnyis pa la sogs par rtogs pa don med na /
translated: then the realization of a second, etc. would be pointless.

original: de lta na 'on bdag dang po rtogs pa yang don med de /
analyzed: de lta na 'on bdag dang po rtogs pa yang don med de /
translated: If that is so, then the realization of the first self would also be pointless,

original: dgos ba ni phung po rgyu yin pa kho nas grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dgos ba ni phung po rgyu yin pa kho nas grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the purpose is accomplished just by the cause of the aggregates.

original: de zhes bya ba ni rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po'o //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po'o //
translated: That is the nature of cause and effect.

original: gzhan la zhes bya ba ni srog la sogs pa la'o //
analyzed: gzhan la zhes bya ba ni srog la sogs pa la'o //
translated: In other cases, such as life force, etc.

original: gzhan du zhes bya ba ni rjes su 'gro ba tsam gyis yin par ro //üîΩder yang zhes bya ba ni me @217a * //
analyzed: gzhan du zhes bya ba ni rjes su 'gro ba tsam gyis yin par ro // der yang zhes bya ba ni me @217a * //
translated: In other words, it is by mere concomitance.

original: dang du ba la sogs pa la'o //
analyzed: dang du ba la sogs pa la'o //
translated: In that case, such as fire and smoke, etc.

original: de lta yin na zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de lta yin na zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If that is so,

original: ldog pa med na'o //
analyzed: ldog pa med na'o //
translated: if there is no counterexample.

original: de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Otherwise,

original: gzhan las mi 'byung na'o //
analyzed: gzhan las mi 'byung na'o //
translated: if it does not arise from another,

original: dogs pa ni gnyi gas zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dogs pa ni gnyi gas zhes bya ba'o //
translated: there is doubt,

original: gnyi gas bskyed pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: gnyi gas bskyed pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: that it is not produced by both.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /üîΩde las zhes bya ba'o /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na / de las zhes bya ba'o /
translated: Why is that?üîΩFrom that,

original: 'di nyid brjod pa ni de las zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di nyid brjod pa ni de las zhes bya ba'o //
translated: this is what is being said: from that.üîΩIf it were to be like that,

original: de ltar gyur dang zhes bya ba ni gzhan las 'byung ba yin na'o //
analyzed: de ltar gyur dang zhes bya ba ni gzhan las 'byung ba yin na'o //
translated: it would arise from another.üîΩBecause that does not exist,

original: de med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the state of cause and effect does not exist.

original: mthong bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rtsod ba don 'di yin te /
analyzed: mthong bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rtsod ba don 'di yin te /
translated: The dispute beginning with ‚Äúwhile seeing‚Äù has this meaning:

original: tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa med par yang 'bras bu tha dad pa dang mi dad par 'gyur te /
analyzed: tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa med par yang 'bras bu tha dad pa dang mi dad par 'gyur te /
translated: Even without difference and non-difference, the effect would be different and non-different,

original: de dag mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because those are seen.

original: mthong ba ni mi 'thad pa zhes bya ba ma yin no zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mthong ba ni mi 'thad pa zhes bya ba ma yin no zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Seeing is not untenable.

original: rgyu dang zhes bya ba la sogs par yang don 'di yin te /
analyzed: rgyu dang zhes bya ba la sogs par yang don 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúcause‚Äù and so on is this:

original: tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa dag tu mthong ba nges pa yin na de dag rnam par 'jog par byed par 'gyur la /
analyzed: tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa dag tu mthong ba nges pa yin na de dag rnam par 'jog par byed par 'gyur la /
translated: If it were certain that they were seen as different or non-different, then they would be posited as such.

original: nges pa yang rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po med par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: nges pa yang rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po med par mi 'gyur te /
translated: And if it were certain, then the state of being cause and effect would not be nonexistent.

original: des na mthong ba rnam par 'jog par byed pa nyid du ci ltar 'gyur zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: des na mthong ba rnam par 'jog par byed pa nyid du ci ltar 'gyur zhes bya ba'o //
translated: So how could it be that seeing posits them?

original: 'di nyid brjod pa ni rtogs pa des na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di nyid brjod pa ni rtogs pa des na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is what is being said: ‚ÄúBecause of that understanding.‚Äù

original: sngon po'i 'bras bu yin pas sngon po'i rtogs pa nges pa yin na /
analyzed: sngon po'i 'bras bu yin pas sngon po'i rtogs pa nges pa yin na /
translated: If the understanding of blue is certain because it is the effect of blue,

original: rtags su gyur pa sngon po'i shes pas sngon po rtogs par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: rtags su gyur pa sngon po'i shes pas sngon po rtogs par 'gyur gyi /
translated: then the cognition of blue, which is the evidence, would understand blue.

original: de lta min na ste sngon po'i 'bras bu nyid ma yin na /
analyzed: de lta min na ste sngon po'i 'bras bu nyid ma yin na /
translated: If that were not so‚Äîthat is, if it were not the effect of blue‚Äî

original: 'khrul pa dang ma 'khrul ba'i rnam par dbye ba med pa kho nar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'khrul pa dang ma 'khrul ba'i rnam par dbye ba med pa kho nar 'gyur ro //
translated: then there would be no distinction at all between error and non-error.

original: rtogs 'gyur gyi zhes bya ba'i mthar thug pa 'chad pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rtogs 'gyur gyi zhes bya ba'i mthar thug pa 'chad pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The explanation of the final phrase ‚Äúbecause of that understanding‚Äù is ‚Äúif that were so.‚Äù

original: rab rib dang bral zhing sngon po la sogs pa'i lhan cig byed pa can 'di 'dra ba'i mig ni ma 'khrul pa'i rtogs pa skye ba'i rgyu yin la /
analyzed: rab rib dang bral zhing sngon po la sogs pa'i lhan cig byed pa can 'di 'dra ba'i mig ni ma 'khrul pa'i rtogs pa skye ba'i rgyu yin la /
translated: The eye that is free from the eye disease and has blue, etc. as its cooperating condition is the cause for the arising of a nonerroneous cognition.

original: rab rib dang bcas pa ni 'khrul pa'i rtogs pa skyed pa'i rgyu yin no zhes nges pa'o //
analyzed: rab rib dang bcas pa ni 'khrul pa'i rtogs pa skyed pa'i rgyu yin no zhes nges pa'o //
translated: The eye that has the eye disease is the cause for the arising of an erroneous cognition.

original: lhag ma rnam par 'grel pa ni /
analyzed: lhag ma rnam par 'grel pa ni /
translated: The commentary on the rest is as follows.

original: de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If it were not so, etc.

original: rtogs bzhin pa tha dad pa med do //
analyzed: rtogs bzhin pa tha dad pa med do //
translated: There is no difference in the cognition that is being cognized.

original: rtog pa tha dad pa nyid kyis tha snyad 'jug par 'gyur ro zhes dogs pa ni /
analyzed: rtog pa tha dad pa nyid kyis tha snyad 'jug par 'gyur ro zhes dogs pa ni /
translated: The doubt that the difference in the cognition is the cause for the difference in the conventional is as follows.

original: 'on te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'on te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: But, etc.

original: sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa can snang ba de nyid rang rig pa'i shes pas rnam par gzhag bar bya ba yin no zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa can snang ba de nyid rang rig pa'i shes pas rnam par gzhag bar bya ba yin no zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The appearance that has blue, etc. as its aspect is to be posited by the self-knowing cognition.

original: snang ba tsam las zhes bya ba rgyu dang 'bras bur ma gyur pa las so //
analyzed: snang ba tsam las zhes bya ba rgyu dang 'bras bur ma gyur pa las so //
translated: From mere appearance, etc. means from that which is not cause and effect.

original: ci ste de tsam gyi @217b tha snyad mi 'grub ce na /
analyzed: ci ste de tsam gyi @217b tha snyad mi 'grub ce na /
translated: If one says that even that much is not established as a convention,üîΩthen, etc.

original: mdun na gnas pa'i rnam pa can de tsam 'ba' zhig snang na ste gsal ba ni de las gzhan pa'i ci byar yod de ci'ang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: mdun na gnas pa'i rnam pa can de tsam 'ba' zhig snang na ste gsal ba ni de las gzhan pa'i ci byar yod de ci'ang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: If only that much, which has the aspect of being present in front, appears, then what else could be done other than that? Nothing at all exists.

original: de'i phyir snang ba tsam gyis ni tha snyad mi 'grub bo //
analyzed: de'i phyir snang ba tsam gyis ni tha snyad mi 'grub bo //
translated: Therefore, mere appearance does not establish convention.

original: gang mi 'grub pa'i tha snyad de ci 'dra ba zhig yin zhe na /
analyzed: gang mi 'grub pa'i tha snyad de ci 'dra ba zhig yin zhe na /
translated: What is the convention that is not established?

original: gzhan ni zhes bya ba ni bya ba byed pa ma yin pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan ni zhes bya ba ni bya ba byed pa ma yin pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúOther‚Äù means that which does not perform a function.

original: gzhan zhes bya ba ni blang bar bya ba ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan zhes bya ba ni blang bar bya ba ma yin pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúOther‚Äù means that which is not to be adopted.

original: snang ba tsam yin yang blang ba dang dor ba'i tha snyad ci ste ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: snang ba tsam yin yang blang ba dang dor ba'i tha snyad ci ste ma yin zhe na /
translated: Why is there not the convention of adopting and rejecting even though it is mere appearance?

original: snang ba tsam ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: snang ba tsam ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúMere appearance‚Äù is the response.

original: de'i skad cig nyid la yin gyis sngar ma yin phyis kyang ma yin te des na blang ba dang dor bar bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i skad cig nyid la yin gyis sngar ma yin phyis kyang ma yin te des na blang ba dang dor bar bya ba ma yin no //
translated: It is in that very moment, not before and not after, and therefore it is not to be adopted or rejected.

original: don dang don ma yin pa rnam par dbye ba dang bral ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: don dang don ma yin pa rnam par dbye ba dang bral ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is free from the distinction of being a referent object or not.

original: de lta na zhes bya ba ni snang ba tsam yin pa na'o //
analyzed: de lta na zhes bya ba ni snang ba tsam yin pa na'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIn that case‚Äù means if it is mere appearance.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po med pas tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa ma yin pa de'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po med pas tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa ma yin pa de'i phyir ro //
translated: Because in that way, there is no causal relation, and therefore it is neither different nor non-different.

original: gang gi yang zhes bya ba ni srog la sogs pa'i'o //
analyzed: gang gi yang zhes bya ba ni srog la sogs pa'i'o //
translated: ‚ÄúOf anything‚Äù means of life-force, etc.

original: de ni bdag go //
analyzed: de ni bdag go //
translated: That is the self.

original: gang las kyang zhes bya ba ni srog la sogs pa las so //
analyzed: gang las kyang zhes bya ba ni srog la sogs pa las so //
translated: ‚ÄúFrom anything‚Äù means from life-force, etc.

original: bshad zin pa'i don gyi sgrub byed du sngar sbyor ba ni rnam 'grel nyid da lta bshad zin pa'i don nye bar sdud pa nyid du nye bar ni /
analyzed: bshad zin pa'i don gyi sgrub byed du sngar sbyor ba ni rnam 'grel nyid da lta bshad zin pa'i don nye bar sdud pa nyid du nye bar ni /
translated: The application of the previously explained meaning as the proof is the summary of the previously explained meaning itself.

original: des na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: des na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúTherefore‚Äù means that.

original: de dang zhes bya ba me dang mi mthun pa'o //
analyzed: de dang zhes bya ba me dang mi mthun pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù is incompatible with fire.

original: des na zhes bya ba ni gnyi ga'i rang bzhin yin pas na'o //
analyzed: des na zhes bya ba ni gnyi ga'i rang bzhin yin pas na'o //
translated: ‚ÄúTherefore‚Äù means because of the nature of both.

original: de las kyang zhes bya ba ni brgya byin gyi co jo las kyang ngo //
analyzed: de las kyang zhes bya ba ni brgya byin gyi co jo las kyang ngo //
translated: ‚ÄúFrom that‚Äù means from the laughter of Indra.

original: me dang mi mthun pa'i tshogs pa 'di'o //
analyzed: me dang mi mthun pa'i tshogs pa 'di'o //
translated: This is the incompatible collection with fire.

original: tha dad tha dad byed min na //
analyzed: tha dad tha dad byed min na //
translated: If it is not different from that,

original: zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni /
translated: This is because

original: rang bzhin gcig ni 'bras bu'i tha dad par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: rang bzhin gcig ni 'bras bu'i tha dad par byed pa yin te /
translated: a single nature is what makes the effect different.

original: de na rgyu tha dad pa las kyang du ba la sogs pa'i 'bras bu 'byung la /
analyzed: de na rgyu tha dad pa las kyang du ba la sogs pa'i 'bras bu 'byung la /
translated: Therefore, even though the effect such as smoke arises from a different cause,üîΩit is not generated by a different nature that is not concordant with the previous one.

original: gang gis sngar dang mi mthun pa'i tshogs pas bskyed pa'i de skyed byed du 'gyur ba tha mi dad pa'i rang bzhin gzhan yang yod pa ma yin no zhes da ltar tha dad par byed pa dang tha dad par byed pa ma yin par khas len na rang
analyzed: gang gis sngar dang mi mthun pa'i tshogs pas bskyed pa'i de skyed byed du 'gyur ba tha mi dad pa'i rang bzhin gzhan yang yod pa ma yin no zhes da ltar tha dad par byed pa dang tha dad par byed pa ma yin par khas len na rang
translated: If you now accept that it is different and not different from what makes it different,üîΩthen its nature would not be different.

original: bzhin tha mi dad pa nyid nyams par 'gyur gyi dngos po la rang bzhin tha dad pa yod na /
analyzed: bzhin tha mi dad pa nyid nyams par 'gyur gyi dngos po la rang bzhin tha dad pa yod na /
translated: If things had different natures,

original: de lta na yang gcig nyid rang bzhin du mar khas blangs pa na /
analyzed: de lta na yang gcig nyid rang bzhin du mar khas blangs pa na /
translated: then even though one is accepted as having a multiple nature,

original: me dang me ma yin pa'i rang bzhin gnyis su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: me dang me ma yin pa'i rang bzhin gnyis su 'gyur ro //
translated: it would have two natures, one of fire and one of nonfire.

original: gang zhig tha dad par byed pa ma yin pa'i rang bzhin de nyid me yin gyi /
analyzed: gang zhig tha dad par byed pa ma yin pa'i rang bzhin de nyid me yin gyi /
translated: That nature which is not different is fire,

original: tha dad par byed pa gang yin pa de ni me ma yin no //
analyzed: tha dad par byed pa gang yin pa de ni me ma yin no //
translated: but that which is different is not fire.

original: @218a * // ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: @218a * // ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: dngos po zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dngos po zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Because of the thing.

original: tha dad ba des na'o //
analyzed: tha dad ba des na'o //
translated: Because of the difference.

original: brgya byin gyi ce de las byung ba'i phyir ci ltar mi 'khrul zhe na /
analyzed: brgya byin gyi ce de las byung ba'i phyir ci ltar mi 'khrul zhe na /
translated: How is there no error because of the origination from Indra‚Äôs head?

original: de zhes bya ba'o //üîΩdngos po de me'i rang bzhin yin na brgya byin gyi spyi'o gzhan srid pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de zhes bya ba'o // dngos po de me'i rang bzhin yin na brgya byin gyi spyi'o gzhan srid pa ma yin te /
translated: Because of that.

original: me nyid du 'dus pa'i phyir /
analyzed: me nyid du 'dus pa'i phyir /
translated: If the thing were of the nature of fire, the origination of Indra‚Äôs head would not be possible, because it is included in fire.

original: de'i rang bzhin gzhan med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin gzhan med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: There is no other nature of that. This is the meaning.

original: rang bzhin gang gis zhes bya ba ni me ma yin pa'i rang bzhin gyis so //
analyzed: rang bzhin gang gis zhes bya ba ni me ma yin pa'i rang bzhin gyis so //
translated: By what nature? By the nature of non-fire.

original: tha dad pa zhes bya ba ni me las brgya byin gyis mgo bor ro //
analyzed: tha dad pa zhes bya ba ni me las brgya byin gyis mgo bor ro //
translated: The difference is that Indra‚Äôs head is different from fire.

original: de na du ba'i skyed par byed pa ma yin pa kho na ste /
analyzed: de na du ba'i skyed par byed pa ma yin pa kho na ste /
translated: There, the origination of smoke is not possible, because of the difference.

original: des na du ba me las 'khrul par dogs pa gang la yod /
analyzed: des na du ba me las 'khrul par dogs pa gang la yod /
translated: Therefore, what is the doubt of error of smoke from fire?

original: me la sogs pa'i tshogs pa du ba skyed par byed ba gang yin pa de'i du bskyed pa'i rang bzhin de nyid gal te 'khrul pa'i yul du 'dod pa gzhan gyis yang rang bzhin yin na /
analyzed: me la sogs pa'i tshogs pa du ba skyed par byed ba gang yin pa de'i du bskyed pa'i rang bzhin de nyid gal te 'khrul pa'i yul du 'dod pa gzhan gyis yang rang bzhin yin na /
translated: If the nature of that which produces smoke, such as fire, is asserted to be the object of error, then it is the nature of that which is other.

original: de'i tshe 'khrul pa'i yul gyi tshogs pa de yang mi la sogs pa'i tshogs pa de nyid do //
analyzed: de'i tshe 'khrul pa'i yul gyi tshogs pa de yang mi la sogs pa'i tshogs pa de nyid do //
translated: In that case, that which is the object of error, the assembly of fire and so on, is just the assembly of human beings and so on.

original: des 'khrul pa ga las yod de /
analyzed: des 'khrul pa ga las yod de /
translated: How could there be error in that?

original: 'on te de du ba skyed pa'i rang bzhin ma yin na /
analyzed: 'on te de du ba skyed pa'i rang bzhin ma yin na /
translated: But if that is not the nature of that which produces smoke,

original: de'i tshe 'bras bu du ba la sogs pa de ni du bskyed ba'i rang bzhin ma yin pa de las byung bar ci ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: de'i tshe 'bras bu du ba la sogs pa de ni du bskyed ba'i rang bzhin ma yin pa de las byung bar ci ltar 'gyur /
translated: then how could the effect, such as smoke, arise from that which is not the nature of that which produces smoke?

original: de phyir zhes bya ba ni de bskyed pa'i rang bzhin ma yin pa las mi 'byung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de phyir zhes bya ba ni de bskyed pa'i rang bzhin ma yin pa las mi 'byung ba'i phyir /
translated: ‚Äú Therefore‚Äù means because it does not arise from that which is not the nature of that which produces it.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu dag phan tshun rang bzhin nges pa yin te /
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu dag phan tshun rang bzhin nges pa yin te /
translated: Cause and effect are ascertained to be mutually dependent.

original: gang zhig du bskyed par byed pa de nyid ni mi la sogs pa'i tshogs pa'i khyad par yin la /
analyzed: gang zhig du bskyed par byed pa de nyid ni mi la sogs pa'i tshogs pa'i khyad par yin la /
translated: That which produces smoke is just the particular assembly of human beings and so on.

original: me la sogs pa'i tshogs pas bskyed pa gang yin pa de nyid kyang du ba yin te /
analyzed: me la sogs pa'i tshogs pas bskyed pa gang yin pa de nyid kyang du ba yin te /
translated: Whatever is produced by the collection of fire and so on is smoke itself.

original: de ltar de dag gi rang bzhin nges pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar de dag gi rang bzhin nges pa yin no //
translated: Thus, their nature is ascertained.

original: des na zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin nges pas na rang nyid mthong ba bzhin te /
analyzed: des na zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin nges pas na rang nyid mthong ba bzhin te /
translated: ‚Äú Therefore‚Äù means that because their nature is ascertained, they are like seeing themselves.üîΩFor example, when one sees smoke, which is the effect of fire, one understands that fire exists.

original: dper na 'bras bu du ba rang gi mthong ba 'bras bur gyur pa yod na rtogs pa de bzhin du 'bras bu gyur pa'i rtags mthong ba na yang de'i rgyu go bar byed do //
analyzed: dper na 'bras bu du ba rang gi mthong ba 'bras bur gyur pa yod na rtogs pa de bzhin du 'bras bu gyur pa'i rtags mthong ba na yang de'i rgyu go bar byed do //
translated: In the same way, when one sees the effect of a reason, one understands its cause.

original: des na go bar bya ba dang go bar byed pa'i dngos po yin no //
analyzed: des na go bar bya ba dang go bar byed pa'i dngos po yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is the state of being that which is understood and that which causes understanding.

original: yang du ba la yang 'khrul par dogs pa bsu ba ni /
analyzed: yang du ba la yang 'khrul par dogs pa bsu ba ni /
translated: Again, anticipating doubt that smoke is mistaken, it is said:

original: 'o na zhes bya ba'o //üîΩ'bras bu gcig ni gcig las 'byung bar mthong yang /
analyzed: 'o na zhes bya ba'o // 'bras bu gcig ni gcig las 'byung bar mthong yang /
translated: ‚ÄúWell then,‚Äù and so on.üîΩAlthough one effect is seen to arise from one thing,

original: de dang rigs mi mthun pa las kyang skye bar mthong ste /
analyzed: de dang rigs mi mthun pa las kyang skye bar mthong ste /
translated: it is also seen to arise from something of a different type.

original: dper na 'bras bu la sogs pa gzugs dang ro la sogs pa rnam par 'gyur ba de lta ma yin par 'gyur ba'i mtshan nyid kyi rul pa ni /
analyzed: dper na 'bras bu la sogs pa gzugs dang ro la sogs pa rnam par 'gyur ba de lta ma yin par 'gyur ba'i mtshan nyid kyi rul pa ni /
translated: For example, the transformation of a result such as milk into curd is not like the transformation of a form such as rice into a different form such as curd.

original: 'o ma las 'byung ba yin la /
analyzed: 'o ma las 'byung ba yin la /
translated: The latter is characterized by decay, which arises from milk.üîΩAnd just as curd arises from milk, it would also arise from water, which is not of the same type.

original: yang 'o ma dang @218b rigs mi mthun ba chu las kyang 'byung bar 'gyur ba de bzhin du du ba yang 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: yang 'o ma dang @218b rigs mi mthun ba chu las kyang 'byung bar 'gyur ba de bzhin du du ba yang 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that smoke would also arise in the same way.

original: gal te chu dang 'o ma dag tha dad na /
analyzed: gal te chu dang 'o ma dag tha dad na /
translated: If water and milk are different,

original: de'i 'bras bu rul pa yang tha dad pa kho na'o //
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu rul pa yang tha dad pa kho na'o //
translated: then their result, curd, would also be different.

original: des na 'khrul ba ga la yod //
analyzed: des na 'khrul ba ga la yod //
translated: How then could there be error?

original: 'on te de'i 'bras bu rul pa tha mi dad na /
analyzed: 'on te de'i 'bras bu rul pa tha mi dad na /
translated: But if the result, curd, is not different,

original: de ltan 'o na /
analyzed: de ltan 'o na /
translated: then in that case

original: de'i rgyu chu dang 'o ma dag kyang tha mi dad pa kho na'o //
analyzed: de'i rgyu chu dang 'o ma dag kyang tha mi dad pa kho na'o //
translated: its causes, water and milk, would also not be different.üîΩHow then could there be error?

original: des na 'khrul par ci ltar 'gyur zhes bsams nas gsungs ba ni /üîΩde ltar ni zhes bya ba'o //üîΩgang gi phyir gsher ba'i nus pa gang las rul bar 'gyur ba /
analyzed: des na 'khrul par ci ltar 'gyur zhes bsams nas gsungs ba ni / de ltar ni zhes bya ba'o // gang gi phyir gsher ba'i nus pa gang las rul bar 'gyur ba /
translated: Thinking this, he says:üîΩIn that case,üîΩbecause the potency of wetness from which curd arises

original: rul bar byed pa'i rnam pa der ni /
analyzed: rul bar byed pa'i rnam pa der ni /
translated: is not different,

original: chu dang 'o ma gnyi ga'ang gcig pa nyid yin pa des na ci ltar 'khrul /
analyzed: chu dang 'o ma gnyi ga'ang gcig pa nyid yin pa des na ci ltar 'khrul /
translated: Since both water and milk are the same, how could there be error?

original: yang ci 'di ni zhes bya ba nas ci ltar yin gyi bar gyis 'khrul par brjod pa'o //
analyzed: yang ci 'di ni zhes bya ba nas ci ltar yin gyi bar gyis 'khrul par brjod pa'o //
translated: ‚Äú What is this? ‚Äù up to ‚Äúhow could there be error?‚Äù explains error.üîΩJust as the opponent‚Äôs position,

original: gang gis pha rol po'i bzhin du 'di pa'i ltar na yang /
analyzed: gang gis pha rol po'i bzhin du 'di pa'i ltar na yang /
translated: so too, according to this system,

original: rul pa'i 'bras bu 'khrul ba spong bar 'gyur ba /
analyzed: rul pa'i 'bras bu 'khrul ba spong bar 'gyur ba /
translated: the error of rotten fruit is refuted.

original: ci chu 'di ni 'o ma las snang ba tha dad pa'i phyir dang / nus pa gcig gi bdag nyid kyang yin pas na tha dad pa dang gcig pa'i rang bzhin can du sangs rgyas pas khas blangs pa yin nam /
analyzed: ci chu 'di ni 'o ma las snang ba tha dad pa'i phyir dang / nus pa gcig gi bdag nyid kyang yin pas na tha dad pa dang gcig pa'i rang bzhin can du sangs rgyas pas khas blangs pa yin nam /
translated: ‚Äú Is it that you Buddhists accept that water is of a different nature from milk, because it appears different from milk and has a different potency, and that it is of the same nature as milk, because it is not different from milk?

original: khas ma blangs pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: khas ma blangs pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: ‚Äù The meaning is that it is not the case that you do not accept this.

original: tha dad ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: tha dad ces bya ba ni /
translated: ‚Äú Different‚Äù meansüîΩ‚Äúdifferent from milk.‚ÄùüîΩ‚Äú The same‚Äù means ‚Äúthe same as milk.‚Äù

original: 'on te tha dad pa dang gcig par ni mi 'dod kyi /
analyzed: 'on te tha dad pa dang gcig par ni mi 'dod kyi /
translated: ‚Äú If you do not assert that it is different and the same,

original: 'on kyang tha dad pa kho na'i bdag nyid yin na /
analyzed: 'on kyang tha dad pa kho na'i bdag nyid yin na /
translated: but it is only of the nature of being different,

original: de lta na 'o na gsher ba nyid du gcig par brjod /
analyzed: de lta na 'o na gsher ba nyid du gcig par brjod /
translated: then in that case, you would say that wetness is the same.

original: chu dang 'o ma tha dad na gang las rul bar 'gyur ba'i rlon pa nyid du rang bzhin gcig par ci ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: chu dang 'o ma tha dad na gang las rul bar 'gyur ba'i rlon pa nyid du rang bzhin gcig par ci ltar 'gyur /
translated: If water and milk are different, how could they be of the same nature, since the water is wet and the milk is not?

original: rang bzhin gcig med na yang 'bras bu rul ba kho na'o zhe na /
analyzed: rang bzhin gcig med na yang 'bras bu rul ba kho na'o zhe na /
translated: If they are not of the same nature, then the result is only rotten milk.

original: brtag pa'i gcig pa nyid kyis 'khrul pa spang ba brjod pa ni /
analyzed: brtag pa'i gcig pa nyid kyis 'khrul pa spang ba brjod pa ni /
translated: The refutation of error by means of the identity of the two analyses is stated:

original: rlon ba nyid du gcig tu 'dzin pa'i rnam pa can /
analyzed: rlon ba nyid du gcig tu 'dzin pa'i rnam pa can /
translated: The form of the apprehension of the identity of the wetness isüîΩthe form of the apprehension of the identity of the milk.

original: de'i rang bzhin can gyis ni tha dad pa med ba'i phyir nus pa gcig ces brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin can gyis ni tha dad pa med ba'i phyir nus pa gcig ces brjod pa yin no //
translated: The possessor of that nature is said to be of one capacity, because there is no difference.

original: dngos po rnam la rnam par shes pa gcig dang du ma skye ba las gzhan pa'i gcig dang tha dad pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po rnam la rnam par shes pa gcig dang du ma skye ba las gzhan pa'i gcig dang tha dad pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no identity or difference of consciousness with regard to things other than the production of one or many.

original: des na bdag gcig gi ltar na yang dul ba'i 'bras bu 'khrul par ci ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: des na bdag gcig gi ltar na yang dul ba'i 'bras bu 'khrul par ci ltar 'gyur /
translated: Therefore, even if there is identity of the possessor, how could the result of the rotten milk be erroneous?

original: de kho na nyid du gcig par ci ste mi brjod snyam na /
analyzed: de kho na nyid du gcig par ci ste mi brjod snyam na /
translated: Why is it not said that they are identical in reality?

original: chu dang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: chu dang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The water and the milk.

original: 'o na ci ltar gcig nyid yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci ltar gcig nyid yin zhe na /
translated: How then are they identical?

original: de las zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de las zhes bya ba'o //
translated: From that.

original: ldog pa tha dad pa med pa'i phyir chu dang 'o ma dag gcig pa nyid de /
analyzed: ldog pa tha dad pa med pa'i phyir chu dang 'o ma dag gcig pa nyid de /
translated: because there is no difference in their exclusions.

original: ldog pa tha mi dad pa nyid ci ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ldog pa tha mi dad pa nyid ci ltar zhe na /
translated: How is there no difference in their exclusions?

original: @219a * // chu dang 'o ma de las gzhan pa sa ba la sogs pa'i rang bzhin de las tha dad pa de'i phyir ro //
analyzed: @219a * // chu dang 'o ma de las gzhan pa sa ba la sogs pa'i rang bzhin de las tha dad pa de'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are different from something else, such as curd, which is different from them.

original: sra ba'i rang bzhin las tha dad pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sra ba'i rang bzhin las tha dad pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is: different from the nature of solidity.

original: rgyu la rten ba'i gcig pa nyid brjod nas /
analyzed: rgyu la rten ba'i gcig pa nyid brjod nas /
translated: Having stated identity based on cause,

original: 'bras bu la brten pa nyid brjod pa ni /
analyzed: 'bras bu la brten pa nyid brjod pa ni /
translated: he states identity based on effect:

original: 'bras bu yang ldog pa gcig pas gcig pa nyid do zhes 'brel to //
analyzed: 'bras bu yang ldog pa gcig pas gcig pa nyid do zhes 'brel to //
translated: The effect is also identical because of the identity of its exclusion.

original: don dam pa nyid du ci ste tha mi dad pa ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: don dam pa nyid du ci ste tha mi dad pa ma yin zhe na /
translated: Why are they not ultimately non-different?

original: don dam par zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: don dam par zhes bya ba'o //
translated: He says: ultimately.

original: de skad ces bya ba ni tha mi dad bar ro //
analyzed: de skad ces bya ba ni tha mi dad bar ro //
translated: That is to say: non-different.

original: ci ltar chu dang 'o ma dag rang bzhin gang gis brlan pa'i rtogs pa'i rten yin ba'i rang bzhin de nyid kyis rul pa'i 'bras bu byed pa de'i rten yin la /
analyzed: ci ltar chu dang 'o ma dag rang bzhin gang gis brlan pa'i rtogs pa'i rten yin ba'i rang bzhin de nyid kyis rul pa'i 'bras bu byed pa de'i rten yin la /
translated: Just as water and milk are the basis of the cognition of wetness by virtue of their own nature, by that very nature they are the basis of the cognition of curd.

original: rang bzhin de nyid kyis na /
analyzed: rang bzhin de nyid kyis na /
translated: By virtue of that very nature,

original: de dag 'bras bu rul ba las rtogs pa yin pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: de dag 'bras bu rul ba las rtogs pa yin pa de bzhin du /
translated: it is understood from a rotten fruit.

original: me tha dad kyang cha gang gis de me'i rtogs pa'i rgyu nyid kyis rang bzhin gyis de las gzhan las ldog bas mar rtogs pa'i rten yin la /
analyzed: me tha dad kyang cha gang gis de me'i rtogs pa'i rgyu nyid kyis rang bzhin gyis de las gzhan las ldog bas mar rtogs pa'i rten yin la /
translated: In the same way, although fire is different, by virtue of the aspect that is the cause of the understanding of fire, it is the basis of the understanding of smoke by virtue of being different from that.

original: rang bzhin de nyid kyi bya ba byed pas de'i rten yin la /
analyzed: rang bzhin de nyid kyi bya ba byed pas de'i rten yin la /
translated: By virtue of that very nature, it performs a function, and thus it is the basis of that.

original: rtags du ba las rtogs ba yang rang bzhin de nyid kyis yin te /
analyzed: rtags du ba las rtogs ba yang rang bzhin de nyid kyis yin te /
translated: The understanding from the evidence of smoke is also by virtue of that very nature,

original: gzhan du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan du ni ma yin no //
translated: and not in any other way.

original: ci ltar na rang bzhin de nyid kyis du ba las rtogs pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci ltar na rang bzhin de nyid kyis du ba las rtogs pa yin zhe na /
translated: How is it that it is understood from smoke by virtue of that very nature?

original: mer shes yan lag ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: mer shes yan lag ces bya ba'o //
translated: The knowledge of fire is a component.

original: mer lhag par zhen ba'i shes bsgrub par byed pa kho na bud shing gi khyad par gyi lhan cig byed pa gzhan la ltos ba las du ba 'byung ba'i phyir na /
analyzed: mer lhag par zhen ba'i shes bsgrub par byed pa kho na bud shing gi khyad par gyi lhan cig byed pa gzhan la ltos ba las du ba 'byung ba'i phyir na /
translated: The knowledge that is the superimposition of fire is established by the mere presence of the special fuel that is a different co-operating condition. Since smoke arises from that fire,

original: du ba me de las 'khrul ba med pa can yin no //
analyzed: du ba me de las 'khrul ba med pa can yin no //
translated: smoke is infallible with respect to that fire.

original: des na rang bzhin de nyid kyis du ba las me rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: des na rang bzhin de nyid kyis du ba las me rtogs pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, fire is understood from smoke by means of that very nature.

original: ci ltar du ba rang gi rgyu la mi 'khrul ba de bzhin du 'bras bu gzhan yang de bzhin te /
analyzed: ci ltar du ba rang gi rgyu la mi 'khrul ba de bzhin du 'bras bu gzhan yang de bzhin te /
translated: Just as smoke is nonerroneous with regard to its cause, so too is another effect,

original: mi 'khrul bar grub pa yin no //
analyzed: mi 'khrul bar grub pa yin no //
translated: and it is established as nonerroneous.

original: 'chad pa ni de bzhin zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'chad pa ni de bzhin zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The explanation is ‚Äújust as.‚Äù

original: tha dad kyang chur rtogs pa tha mi dad pa'i rten nyid ci ltar zhe na /
analyzed: tha dad kyang chur rtogs pa tha mi dad pa'i rten nyid ci ltar zhe na /
translated: How is it that even though different, it is the basis for the nondifferent understanding of water?

original: de las gzhan rlon pa ma yin pa dag las ldog pas na'o //
analyzed: de las gzhan rlon pa ma yin pa dag las ldog pas na'o //
translated: It is because of the exclusion of other things that are not wet.

original: de las gzhan dag ces bya ba me ma yin par rtogs pa'i rgyu dag las ldog pa nyid kyis so //
analyzed: de las gzhan dag ces bya ba me ma yin par rtogs pa'i rgyu dag las ldog pa nyid kyis so //
translated: ‚ÄúOther than that‚Äù means that it is because of the exclusion of causes that are not fire.

original: de nyid kyis zhes bya ba mer rtogs pa'i rgyu nyid kyis du ba las me rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyis zhes bya ba mer rtogs pa'i rgyu nyid kyis du ba las me rtogs pa yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúBy that very thing‚Äù means that fire is understood from smoke by means of the very cause of the understanding of fire.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gzhan du zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan du zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúOtherwise,‚Äù

original: rnam 'grel gnyis ba rnam par 'grel ba ni /
analyzed: rnam 'grel gnyis ba rnam par 'grel ba ni /
translated: The second commentary on the commentary is:

original: mer zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mer zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚Äúfire.‚Äù

original: ci ltar du ba mi 'khrul te /
analyzed: ci ltar du ba mi 'khrul te /
translated: How is smoke nonerroneous?

original: brgya byin gyi spyi bo la sogs pa las kyang 'byung ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: brgya byin gyi spyi bo la sogs pa las kyang 'byung ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: because it also arises from the crown of Indra and so on.

original: 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Thus means in this way.

original: du ba @219b dang bud shing gi 'gyur ba dag gis yin te /
analyzed: du ba @219b dang bud shing gi 'gyur ba dag gis yin te /
translated: It is due to the transformation of smoke and fuel.

original: rgyu gang yin pa da las brten nas mer 'jog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu gang yin pa da las brten nas mer 'jog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because fire is posited as the cause in dependence on that.

original: gal te 'khrul pa'i yul du 'dod pa'i brgya byin gyi spyi bor me min no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te 'khrul pa'i yul du 'dod pa'i brgya byin gyi spyi bor me min no zhe na /
translated: If you say that fire does not exist on the crown of Indra, the object of error,

original: de'i tshe du ba nyid du 'dod pa de du ba ma yin te des na 'khrul pa med do //
analyzed: de'i tshe du ba nyid du 'dod pa de du ba ma yin te des na 'khrul pa med do //
translated: then what is asserted as smoke does not exist as smoke, and so there is no error.

original: gal te gzhan las skyes pa de yang du ba yin no zhe na ni /
analyzed: gal te gzhan las skyes pa de yang du ba yin no zhe na ni /
translated: If you say that what arises from another is also smoke,

original: de'i tshe du ba'i rgyur mngon par 'dod pa de me nyid yin gyi gang gi du ba 'khrul bar 'gyur ba me dang rigs mi 'dra ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i tshe du ba'i rgyur mngon par 'dod pa de me nyid yin gyi gang gi du ba 'khrul bar 'gyur ba me dang rigs mi 'dra ba ni ma yin no //
translated: then what is asserted as the cause of smoke is fire itself, and not something that is not similar to fire, in which case smoke would be erroneous.

original: 'di nyid ga las zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rtsod pa'o //
analyzed: 'di nyid ga las zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rtsod pa'o //
translated: The dispute is Why is that? and so on.

original: nges pa'i rnam pa smras ba ni /üîΩgzhan du ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: nges pa'i rnam pa smras ba ni / gzhan du ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The reply is Because it is said to have a definite form.üîΩOtherwise means if it were otherwise.

original: 'o na zhes bya ba ni lan no /
analyzed: 'o na zhes bya ba ni lan no /
translated: The reply is No.

original: // na du zhes bya ba ni sngon po ma yin par ro //
analyzed: // na du zhes bya ba ni sngon po ma yin par ro //
translated: ‚Äúna‚Äù means not blue.

original: dogs pa ni de lta yin na zhes bya ba ste gzhan du 'gyur ba yin na'o //
analyzed: dogs pa ni de lta yin na zhes bya ba ste gzhan du 'gyur ba yin na'o //
translated: The doubt is: if it were so, i.e., if it were otherwise.

original: lan ni du ba zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lan ni du ba zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The answer is: ‚Äúdh≈´ma·∏•‚Äù i.e., smoke.

original: yul dang dus gzhan du ma yin pa las skyen du ba nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yul dang dus gzhan du ma yin pa las skyen du ba nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Smoke does not arise from a non-fire, nor in a different place and time.

original: 'di ga las zhes bya ba'i brgal zhing brtag pa ni gzhan sngon po las mtshungs so ;
analyzed: 'di ga las zhes bya ba'i brgal zhing brtag pa ni gzhan sngon po las mtshungs so ;
translated: The objection ‚Äúwhy?‚Äù is the same as before, i.e., with regard to the blue.
