original: / ci ltar yul gzhan la sogs par me las gzhan las kyang du ba 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya bar rgol zhing rtogs pa de bzhin du sngon po yang yul gzhan la sogs par rnam pa gzhan du yang 'gyur ro zhes brgal zhing brtag par 'gyur te
analyzed: / ci ltar yul gzhan la sogs par me las gzhan las kyang du ba 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya bar rgol zhing rtogs pa de bzhin du sngon po yang yul gzhan la sogs par rnam pa gzhan du yang 'gyur ro zhes brgal zhing brtag par 'gyur te
translated: Just as one objects and argues that smoke arises from a non-fire, i.e., from a different place, etc., so one may object and argue that the blue also becomes different, i.e., in a different place, etc.

original: khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: There is no difference.

original: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rtsod par ni don 'di yin te /
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rtsod par ni don 'di yin te /
translated: The objection beginning with ‚Äúif‚Äù has this meaning:

original: sngon po ni sngon po nyid kyi rang bzhin yin pas ci ltar de med par 'gyur /
analyzed: sngon po ni sngon po nyid kyi rang bzhin yin pas ci ltar de med par 'gyur /
translated: Since the blue is of the nature of blue, how can it be non-existent?

original: rang gi rang bzhin gyis mtshon par bya ba'i dngos po ni de med par 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: rang gi rang bzhin gyis mtshon par bya ba'i dngos po ni de med par 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: The entity that is to be characterized by its intrinsic reality does not become nonexistent.

original: gang gis de med pas med par 'gyur ba bskyed par bya ba nyid ni dngos po'i mtshan nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: gang gis de med pas med par 'gyur ba bskyed par bya ba nyid ni dngos po'i mtshan nyid ma yin te /
translated: Since it is not nonexistent, the production of nonexistence is not the characteristic of an entity.

original: des na mngon par 'dod pa'i rgyus bskyed par bya ba nyid spangs nas /
analyzed: des na mngon par 'dod pa'i rgyus bskyed par bya ba nyid spangs nas /
translated: Therefore, having rejected the production of what is desired,

original: gzhan gyi rgyus bskyed par bya ba nyid du khas blangs kyang nyes pa med do zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi rgyus bskyed par bya ba nyid du khas blangs kyang nyes pa med do zhes bya ba'o //
translated: there is no fault in accepting the production of something else by a cause.

original: der yang ni du ba la yang ngo //
analyzed: der yang ni du ba la yang ngo //
translated: There, too, means also with respect to smoke.

original: rang bzhin zhes bya ba la sogs par ni don 'di yin no //
analyzed: rang bzhin zhes bya ba la sogs par ni don 'di yin no //
translated: The meaning of the passage beginning with ‚ÄúIntrinsic reality‚Äù is as follows.

original: dngos po nyid kyi mtshan nyid ni rgyus bskyed pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: dngos po nyid kyi mtshan nyid ni rgyus bskyed pa kho na yin te /
translated: The characteristic of an entity is just the production by a cause,

original: de las bzlog pa ni dngos po med pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de las bzlog pa ni dngos po med pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the opposite of that is the characteristic of a nonentity.

original: de lta ma yin na ni dngos po dang cig shos kyi rnam par dbye bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na ni dngos po dang cig shos kyi rnam par dbye bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If that were not so, then the distinction between an entity and its opposite would not be possible.

original: rnam bar dbye ba zhes bya ba ni 'khrul pa dang cig shos pa skyed par @220a * //
analyzed: rnam bar dbye ba zhes bya ba ni 'khrul pa dang cig shos pa skyed par @220a * //
translated: ‚ÄúDistinction‚Äù is that which is produced by a cause that produces error and its opposite.

original: byed pa'i rgyus byas pa gang yin pa de nyid kyi rnam par dbye ba byas pa yin no //
analyzed: byed pa'i rgyus byas pa gang yin pa de nyid kyi rnam par dbye ba byas pa yin no //
translated: That itself is the distinction that is made.

original: de ltar 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs med na mi 'byung ba nyid yin mod /
analyzed: de ltar 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs med na mi 'byung ba nyid yin mod /
translated: Thus, although the effect reason is non-observation of a non-observation,

original: rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs go ci ltar zhes dogs pa ni /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs go ci ltar zhes dogs pa ni /
translated: how is the essential nature reason?

original: rang bzhin zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is the ‚Äúessential nature.‚Äù

original: 'di'i med na mi 'byung ba yang rang nyid ci lta ba'i tshad ma la ltos te de rtogs par byed pa yin no zhes lan 'debs pa ni /
analyzed: 'di'i med na mi 'byung ba yang rang nyid ci lta ba'i tshad ma la ltos te de rtogs par byed pa yin no zhes lan 'debs pa ni /
translated: The non-observation of this is also dependent on the valid knowledge that is just like itself. It is the cause of the understanding of that.

original: ci ltar zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ci ltar zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is the ‚Äúhow.‚Äù

original: de ltar 'bras bu dang rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs gnyis kyi med na mi 'byung ba nyid brjod nas skabs nyid dang sbyor ba ni /
analyzed: de ltar 'bras bu dang rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs gnyis kyi med na mi 'byung ba nyid brjod nas skabs nyid dang sbyor ba ni /
translated: Thus, having stated the non-observation of the effect and the essential nature reasons, the context itself is applied.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar rjes su 'gro ba tsam ma ma ldog pa tsam gyi rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po ma yin pa de'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar rjes su 'gro ba tsam ma ma ldog pa tsam gyi rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po ma yin pa de'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the state of being cause and effect is not merely a matter of mere presence and mere absence.

original: bdag dang srog la sogs pa ni rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po ma yin pa'i phyir srog la sogs pa ni /
analyzed: bdag dang srog la sogs pa ni rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po ma yin pa'i phyir srog la sogs pa ni /
translated: Since the self, life-force, etc. are not the state of being cause and effect, life-force, etc.

original: bdag go par byed pa ma yin no //üîΩslob dpon phyogs kyi glang po'i'o //
analyzed: bdag go par byed pa ma yin no // slob dpon phyogs kyi glang po'i'o //
translated: are not the appropriator of the self.üîΩThis is the commentary on the twenty-first chapter of the Treasury of Abhidharma, called ‚ÄúThe Elements.‚Äù

original: ldog can zhes bya ba ni srog la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: ldog can zhes bya ba ni srog la sogs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúHaving an absence‚Äù refers to life-force, etc.

original: mjug sdud pa ni de ltar na re zhig ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: mjug sdud pa ni de ltar na re zhig ces bya ba'o //
translated: The summary is ‚ÄúThus, first of all,‚Äù etc.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: ldog pa can zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ldog pa can zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúHaving an absence‚Äù is said.

original: de lta na yang ci ltar gtan tshigs ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: de lta na yang ci ltar gtan tshigs ma yin zhe na /
translated: Even so, how is it not a reason?

original: de yang zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de yang zhes bya ba ste /
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù is said.

original: mnyan bya nyid kyang ngo //
analyzed: mnyan bya nyid kyang ngo //
translated: ‚ÄúBeing heard‚Äù is also that.

original: de ltar na yang ma nges pa ci ste yin zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar na yang ma nges pa ci ste yin zhe na /
translated: Even so, how is it indeterminate?

original: 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIn this way‚Äù is said.

original: 'o na ci ltar ldog pa can du gsungs she na /
analyzed: 'o na ci ltar ldog pa can du gsungs she na /
translated: Well then, how is it said to have an absence?

original: ma mthong ba tsam gyi zhes bya ba'o /
analyzed: ma mthong ba tsam gyi zhes bya ba'o /
translated: ‚ÄúMerely not seeing‚Äù is said.

original: gal te phung po gzhan med na ci ltar 'di bsgrub bar bya ba dang / cig shos dag la the tshom za ba'i rgyu yin zhe na /
analyzed: gal te phung po gzhan med na ci ltar 'di bsgrub bar bya ba dang / cig shos dag la the tshom za ba'i rgyu yin zhe na /
translated: If there is no other aggregate, how can it be the cause of doubt in regard to this and the other?

original: rtag pa dang zhes bya ba ste mnyan bya nyid la ltos nas so //
analyzed: rtag pa dang zhes bya ba ste mnyan bya nyid la ltos nas so //
translated: In regard to permanent and so on, it is in dependence upon the state of being heard.

original: bdag dang zhes bya ba ni srog la sogs pa dang ldan pa la ltos nas so /üîΩde lta ma yin na zhes bya ba ni /üîΩdngos po dang dngos po med pa dag gi 'ga' ba dang dngos po nyid ma yin na'o //
analyzed: bdag dang zhes bya ba ni srog la sogs pa dang ldan pa la ltos nas so / de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba ni / dngos po dang dngos po med pa dag gi 'ga' ba dang dngos po nyid ma yin na'o //
translated: In regard to self and so on, it is in dependence upon the possession of life and so on.üîΩOtherwise, it is in dependence upon the state of being heard and so on, and the possession of life and so on, that there is the designation permanent and so on, and self and so on.

original: gal te phung po gzhan med kyang ci ltar 'di the tshom gyi rgyu yin te /üîΩphyogs gnyi ga la mi srid pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: gal te phung po gzhan med kyang ci ltar 'di the tshom gyi rgyu yin te / phyogs gnyi ga la mi srid pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: If it were not so, then the state of being heard and so on, and the possession of life and so on, would not be the cause of the designation of the permanent and so on, and the self and so on.üîΩIf it were not so, then the state of being heard and so on, and the possession of life and so on, would not be the cause of the designation of the permanent and so on, and the self and so on.

original: phyogs gnyi ga las zhes bya ba'o //üîΩci'i phyir zhe na /üîΩgal te zhes bya ba'o //üîΩgal te mnyan par bya ba nyid thams cad las ldog na /
analyzed: phyogs gnyi ga las zhes bya ba'o // ci'i phyir zhe na / gal te zhes bya ba'o // gal te mnyan par bya ba nyid thams cad las ldog na /
translated: If it were not so, then the state of being heard and so on, and the possession of life and so on, would not be the cause of the designation of the permanent and so on, and the self and so on.üîΩ If it were not so, then the state of being heard and so on, and the possession of life and so on, would not be the cause of the designation of the permanent and so on, and the self and so on.

original: de'i tshe 'di med pa kho nar 'gyur ro //üîΩci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de'i tshe 'di med pa kho nar 'gyur ro // ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: If it were not so, then the state of being heard and so on, and the possession of life and so on, would not be the cause of the designation of the permanent and so on, and the self and so on.üîΩ If it were not so, then the state of being heard and so on, and the possession of life and so on, would not be the cause of the designation of the permanent and so on, and the self and so on.üîΩ If it were not so, then the state of being heard and so on, and the possession of life and so on, would not be the cause of the designation of the permanent and so on, and the self and so on.

original: rten med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rten med pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba'i chos zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba ni sgra la sogs pa'i chos can no //
translated: The term ‚Äúproperty to be established‚Äù refers to the property that is to be established, such as sound, etc., as the subject.

analyzed: gang la the tshom za ba'i rgyu yin zhen khyad par ci snyed kyis zhes bya ba ste / rtag pa dang mi rtag pa'am /
translated: With regard to the question, ‚ÄúWith regard to what are they the causes of doubt?‚Äù the root text states, ‚Äúwith regard to whatever is qualified by any of the distinctions.‚ÄùüîΩThe term ‚Äúwhatever‚Äù refers to all entities, such as sound, etc.üîΩThe term ‚Äúqualified by any of the distinctions‚Äù refers to all entities that are characterized as permanent or impermanent,

analyzed: bdag dang bcas pa dang bdag med pa'i mtshan nyid kyis dngos po mtha' dag bsdus pa de la'o //
translated: as having a self or as being without a self.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /

original: de dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ste /

analyzed: rtag pa dang mi rtag pa dang ldan pa'i rnam pas don gyi tshogs mtha' dag pa de bsdus pa'i phyir dang / gnyis las gcig tu nges pa yang ldog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The entire collection of entities is included within the categories of permanent and impermanent, and because it is also excluded from being determined as either one or the other.

analyzed: 'dis ni rnam gnyis kyis thams cad bsdus pa dang / gcig tu nges pa ldog pa yang the tshom gyi rgyu nyid rgyu mtshan du bstan pa yin na ;
translated: This shows that the two alternatives include all possibilities and that the exclusion of one alternative is the reason for doubting the other.

analyzed: 'di ni ma rtogs pa'i rgyu'i rgyu mtshan nyid du 'thad pa yin no //

original: de zhes bya ba ni de'i phyir te /
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni de'i phyir te /

translated: Since one doubts the exclusion of the quality of being audible, it is the reason for doubt.üîΩIt is not the reason for non-apprehension.

analyzed: de ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni grub pa'i mtha'o //

original: phung po gnyis las gal te mnyan bya nyid ldog pa des na /
analyzed: phung po gnyis las gal te mnyan bya nyid ldog pa des na /
translated: If the quality of being audible is excluded from the two alternatives,

original: de'i tshe chos can la mthong ba na de dag med pa nyid du go bar byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe chos can la mthong ba na de dag med pa nyid du go bar byed par 'gyur ro //

original: de ltan yang the tshom gyi rgyu'am ma rtogs pa'i rgyur ci ltar 'gyur zhes bya ba rtogs pa bskyed pa nyid ni ma rtogs pa'i rgyu ma yin no zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de ltan yang the tshom gyi rgyu'am ma rtogs pa'i rgyur ci ltar 'gyur zhes bya ba rtogs pa bskyed pa nyid ni ma rtogs pa'i rgyu ma yin no zhes bya ba'o //
translated: But how can that which is to be heard be the cause of doubt or non-understanding? That which generates understanding is not the cause of non-understanding.

original: mnyan par bya ba nyid gang zhig / rtag pa dang mi rtag pa gnyi ga las ldog par nges pa gang yin pa de gzhan chos can sgra la yod pas na /üîΩrtag pa dang mi rtag pa gnyi ga la yang mnyan par bya ba nyid @222a * //
analyzed: mnyan par bya ba nyid gang zhig / rtag pa dang mi rtag pa gnyi ga las ldog par nges pa gang yin pa de gzhan chos can sgra la yod pas na / rtag pa dang mi rtag pa gnyi ga la yang mnyan par bya ba nyid @222a * //
translated: That which is to be heard is ascertained as the opposite of both permanent and impermanent. Since that exists in the subject, sound,

original: kyis med par nges par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: kyis med par nges par 'gyur ro //
translated: it is ascertained that it does not exist in both permanent and impermanent.

original: med par nges par byed pa yin yang de dag la the tshom byed par 'gyur ro zhen rtag pa dang mi rtag pa dag ni ldog par byed pa mnyan par bya ba nyid sgra de gnyis la the tshom byed par ci ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: med par nges par byed pa yin yang de dag la the tshom byed par 'gyur ro zhen rtag pa dang mi rtag pa dag ni ldog par byed pa mnyan par bya ba nyid sgra de gnyis la the tshom byed par ci ltar 'gyur /
translated: Even though it ascertains non-existence, it causes doubt regarding those. But how can permanence and impermanence, which are the opposites of that which is to be heard, cause doubt regarding that sound which is both permanent and impermanent?

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gang gi phyir mnyan par bya ba nyid kyi rtag pa dang mi rtag pa dag las ldog pa gang yin pa de las rtag pa dang mi rtag pa gnyi ga la rnam par gcod pa bsgrub pa ni gzhan ma yin gyi /
analyzed: gang gi phyir mnyan par bya ba nyid kyi rtag pa dang mi rtag pa dag las ldog pa gang yin pa de las rtag pa dang mi rtag pa gnyi ga la rnam par gcod pa bsgrub pa ni gzhan ma yin gyi /
translated: Because the exclusion of permanence and impermanence from that which is to be heard is not different from the affirmation of both permanence and impermanence.

original: 'on kyang de las ldog pa nyid de dag la rnam par gcad pa bsgrub pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang de las ldog pa nyid de dag la rnam par gcad pa bsgrub pa yin no //
translated: Rather, the exclusion of that which is to be heard from those two, permanence and impermanence, is the affirmation of both permanence and impermanence.

original: 'di nyid ni brjod pa ni gang zhig ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di nyid ni brjod pa ni gang zhig ces bya ba'o //
translated: This is precisely what is stated by what.

original: thams cad ces bya ba ni gtan tshigs du ba la sogs pa yang rnam par gcod pa bsgrub pas gtan tshigs nyid yin la /
analyzed: thams cad ces bya ba ni gtan tshigs du ba la sogs pa yang rnam par gcod pa bsgrub pas gtan tshigs nyid yin la /
translated: Everything means that even the reason such as smoke is an affirmation of exclusion,

original: de rtag pa dang mi rtag pa rnam par gcod pa de ni mnyan par bya ba nyid la yang yod do des na /
analyzed: de rtag pa dang mi rtag pa rnam par gcod pa de ni mnyan par bya ba nyid la yang yod do des na /
translated: and that exclusion of permanence and impermanence exists also in that which is to be heard.

original: gtan tshigs ma yin par ci ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: gtan tshigs ma yin par ci ltar 'gyur /
translated: So how can it not be a reason?

original: rnam par gcod pa yin pas na gtan tshigs nyid yin no zhes ci ltar rtogs she na /
analyzed: rnam par gcod pa yin pas na gtan tshigs nyid yin no zhes ci ltar rtogs she na /
translated: How is it understood that it is a reason because it is an exclusion?

original: sgra dang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: sgra dang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Sound and so on.

original: gtan tshigs zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rtsod pa ni don 'di yin te /
analyzed: gtan tshigs zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rtsod pa ni don 'di yin te /
translated: The argument beginning with the words ‚ÄúA reason, etc.‚Äù has this meaning.

original: gang zhig ldog pa sngon du song ba'i sgrub pa'i nges par byed pa de kho na gtan tshigs yin te /
analyzed: gang zhig ldog pa sngon du song ba'i sgrub pa'i nges par byed pa de kho na gtan tshigs yin te /
translated: That which is a means of ascertaining a proof that has a prior exclusion is a reason.

original: dper na byas pa nyid rtag pa rnam par gcad pas mi rtag pa sgrub par byed pa na gtan tshigs yin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na byas pa nyid rtag pa rnam par gcad pas mi rtag pa sgrub par byed pa na gtan tshigs yin pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like the fact of being produced, which is a reason when it proves impermanence by excluding permanence.

original: mnyan bya nyid ni gnyi ga yang ldog pa tsam zhig sgrub pa yin te /
analyzed: mnyan bya nyid ni gnyi ga yang ldog pa tsam zhig sgrub pa yin te /
translated: Audibility, however, proves only the mere exclusion of both.

original: des na ma rtogs pa'i rgyu kho nar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: des na ma rtogs pa'i rgyu kho nar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Therefore, it is only a cause of non-understanding.

original: lan ni de bden te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lan ni de bden te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The answer is ‚ÄúThat is true. . . . ‚Äù

original: 'chad pa ni rjes su dpag pa ni zhes bya ba'o //üîΩgal te rtag pa nyid kyi sgro 'dogs rnam par gcad kyang /
analyzed: 'chad pa ni rjes su dpag pa ni zhes bya ba'o // gal te rtag pa nyid kyi sgro 'dogs rnam par gcad kyang /
translated: The explanation is ‚ÄúAn inference . . . ‚Äù

original: mi rtag pa nyid mi sgrub pa'i phyir ci ltar rjes su dpag pas don byas par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid mi sgrub pa'i phyir ci ltar rjes su dpag pas don byas par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Even if the superimposition of permanence is eliminated, since impermanence is not proved, how can an inference perform its function?

original: rnam pa dang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rnam pa dang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The answer is ‚ÄúThe form . . . ‚Äù

original: dogs ba ni de yang zhes bya ste mi rtag pa nyid kyang ngo //
analyzed: dogs ba ni de yang zhes bya ste mi rtag pa nyid kyang ngo //
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù refers to impermanence.

original: des na ci ltar rtag pa nyid log pas mi rtag pa nyid 'grub ce na /
analyzed: des na ci ltar rtag pa nyid log pas mi rtag pa nyid 'grub ce na /
translated: How is it that impermanence is established by the negation of permanence?

original: de ni ma yin te rtag pa dang rnam par bcad pas rjes su dpag pas bsgrubs pa'i mi rtag pa nyid de ni mngon sum gyis grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni ma yin te rtag pa dang rnam par bcad pas rjes su dpag pas bsgrubs pa'i mi rtag pa nyid de ni mngon sum gyis grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That is not so, because impermanence, which is established by inference through the negation of permanence, is established by direct perception.

original: sgra'i rang bzhin rtag pa dang ma 'dres par byas pa nyid la sogs pa'i rtags kyis bsgrubs pa de ni de kho na ltar mngon sum gyis gzung bas na /
analyzed: sgra'i rang bzhin rtag pa dang ma 'dres par byas pa nyid la sogs pa'i rtags kyis bsgrubs pa de ni de kho na ltar mngon sum gyis gzung bas na /
translated: The nature of sound, which is established by the reason of being produced, etc., is just like that, because it is apprehended by direct perception.

original: de yang res 'ga' med par 'gyur ro zhes ci @222b ltar brjod ce na /üîΩ'bras bu'i gtan tshigs la ci ltar zhes bya ba na /
analyzed: de yang res 'ga' med par 'gyur ro zhes ci @222b ltar brjod ce na / 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs la ci ltar zhes bya ba na /
translated: How can it be said that it sometimes does not exist?üîΩIn the case of a reason based on effect, how is it that it is not the case that it is not associated with fire?

original: gang gi me dang bcas pa nyid du yang mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i rtsod pa spong bar 'gyur ba me med par rnam par bcad nas me dang bcas pa nyid ci ltar mngon sum gyis 'grub ce na /
analyzed: gang gi me dang bcas pa nyid du yang mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i rtsod pa spong bar 'gyur ba me med par rnam par bcad nas me dang bcas pa nyid ci ltar mngon sum gyis 'grub ce na /
translated: How is it that the existence of fire is established by direct perception through the exclusion of the absence of fire?

original: 'di ni re zhig ces bya ba ni grub pa'i mthar don 'di yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni re zhig ces bya ba ni grub pa'i mthar don 'di yin te /
translated: This is the meaning of the passage beginning with ‚Äúfor the time being.‚Äù

original: me med pa rnam par bcad nas du bas bsgrubs pa'i me dang bcas pa yang mngon sum nyid yin te /
analyzed: me med pa rnam par bcad nas du bas bsgrubs pa'i me dang bcas pa yang mngon sum nyid yin te /
translated: Having eliminated the absence of fire, the existence of fire that is established by smoke is also direct perception.üîΩOtherwise, inference would not be a valid means of knowledge.

original: de lta ma yin na rjes su dpag pa tshad ma ma yin par 'gyur pa'i phyir ro zhes brjod zin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'o dpe bshad nas don 'chad pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na rjes su dpag pa tshad ma ma yin par 'gyur pa'i phyir ro zhes brjod zin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'o dpe bshad nas don 'chad pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Having explained the example, the meaning is explained beginning with ‚Äúif.‚Äù

original: gal te mnyan bya nyid kyis rtag pa dang mi rtag pa gnyi ga yang rnam par gcad pa yin na /
analyzed: gal te mnyan bya nyid kyis rtag pa dang mi rtag pa gnyi ga yang rnam par gcad pa yin na /
translated: If audibility eliminates both permanent and impermanent sounds,

original: de las gzhan du bsgrub pa la /
analyzed: de las gzhan du bsgrub pa la /
translated: then in establishing something else,

original: de'i tshe de las gzhan du mngon sum gyis grub par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i tshe de las gzhan du mngon sum gyis grub par 'gyur te /
translated: at that time it would establish something else by direct perception.

original: de'i phyir mnyan par bya ba nyid gtan tshigs kho nar 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: de'i phyir mnyan par bya ba nyid gtan tshigs kho nar 'gyur gyi /
translated: Therefore, audibility alone would be the reason,

original: ma rtogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi gtan chags ltar snang bar ni ma yin no //
analyzed: ma rtogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi gtan chags ltar snang bar ni ma yin no //
translated: but it would not be a fallacious reason that has the characteristic of not being understood.

original: gzhan gyi zhes bya ba ni mnyan bya nyid las gzhan byas pas mi rtag pa nyid de gcig bsgrubs pas mnyan bya nyid gtan tshigs ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan gyi zhes bya ba ni mnyan bya nyid las gzhan byas pas mi rtag pa nyid de gcig bsgrubs pas mnyan bya nyid gtan tshigs ma yin no zhe na /
translated: The opponent says: Impermanence is established by something other than being audible, so audibility is not the reason.

original: lan ni ma yin te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lan ni ma yin te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The response is: ‚ÄúNo, it is not.‚Äù

original: mngon sum gyis sgra las rtag pa dang mi rtag pa nyid las phyi rol du gyur par grub pa la gtan tshigs gzhan gyis rtag pa nyid 'god par byed pa'am /
analyzed: mngon sum gyis sgra las rtag pa dang mi rtag pa nyid las phyi rol du gyur par grub pa la gtan tshigs gzhan gyis rtag pa nyid 'god par byed pa'am /
translated: How could a reason establish permanence or impermanence, which are external to sound, when they are established by direct perception?

original: mi rtag pa nyid sgrub par byed par ci ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid sgrub par byed par ci ltar 'gyur /
translated: Or how could it establish impermanence?

original: 'on te zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi'o //üîΩdes na zhes bya ba ni 'gog par byed pa ma yin pas na'o //
analyzed: 'on te zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi'o // des na zhes bya ba ni 'gog par byed pa ma yin pas na'o //
translated: The opponent says:

original: lan ni ma yin te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lan ni ma yin te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The response is: ‚ÄúNo, it is not.‚Äù

original: mnyan par bya pa nyid ni gnyi ga las gcig tu ldog par 'dod pa yin te /
analyzed: mnyan par bya pa nyid ni gnyi ga las gcig tu ldog par 'dod pa yin te /
translated: Audibility is asserted to be the exclusion of one from both.

original: de lta ma yin na mi rtag pa'i rgyu nyid du khas len par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na mi rtag pa'i rgyu nyid du khas len par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, it would not be accepted as the reason for impermanence.

original: des na mnyan par bya ba nyid kyis gnyi ga rnam par gcad na /
analyzed: des na mnyan par bya ba nyid kyis gnyi ga rnam par gcad na /
translated: Therefore, when audibility excludes both,

original: gang gi mnyan bya gtan tshigs ma yin par 'gyur ba /
analyzed: gang gi mnyan bya gtan tshigs ma yin par 'gyur ba /
translated: Then it would not be a reason that is heard.

original: ci ltar gzhan pas mi rtag pa nyid sgrub /
analyzed: ci ltar gzhan pas mi rtag pa nyid sgrub /
translated: How could impermanence be established by another?

original: de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba ni mnyan par bya ba nyid mkhrang pas mi rtag pa nyid gnod par byas pa la yang /üîΩbyas pa nyid gzhan gyis bsgrub na de'i tshe mi rtag pa nyid kyi khyad par can du rtogs pa'i sgra de la yang rtags gzhan gyis rtag pa nyid sgrub par dogs par 'gyur ba'i phyir ci ltar gzhan @223a * //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba ni mnyan par bya ba nyid mkhrang pas mi rtag pa nyid gnod par byas pa la yang / byas pa nyid gzhan gyis bsgrub na de'i tshe mi rtag pa nyid kyi khyad par can du rtogs pa'i sgra de la yang rtags gzhan gyis rtag pa nyid sgrub par dogs par 'gyur ba'i phyir ci ltar gzhan @223a * //
translated: If it were not so, then even though impermanence is undermined by the rigidity of what is heard,üîΩif that which is produced were established by another, then at that time, there would be the doubt that the sound that is cognized as qualified by impermanence would also establish permanence by another reason.

original: byas pa nyid tshad ma yin par 'gyur /
analyzed: byas pa nyid tshad ma yin par 'gyur /
translated: How could that which is produced be a valid means of knowledge?

original: des na gtan tshigs thams cad la yid brtan du med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: des na gtan tshigs thams cad la yid brtan du med par 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, all reasons would be unreliable,

original: mtshan nyid dang ldan pa la gnod par mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mtshan nyid dang ldan pa la gnod par mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is seen that what possesses the characteristics is undermined.

original: mngon sum 'gog par byed pa nyid ma yin par khas blangs nas 'di skad brjod pa yin gyi /
analyzed: mngon sum 'gog par byed pa nyid ma yin par khas blangs nas 'di skad brjod pa yin gyi /
translated: This is stated by accepting that direct perception is not itself refuted.

original: 'gog par mi byed pa nyid ni rigs pa yang ma yin no zhes brjod pa ni /
analyzed: 'gog par mi byed pa nyid ni rigs pa yang ma yin no zhes brjod pa ni /
translated: It is not reasonable to say that it does not stop.

original: mngon sum zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mngon sum zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is the direct perception.

original: ci ltar sgrub par byed par mi 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ci ltar sgrub par byed par mi 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How does it not establish?

original: sgrub pa ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: sgrub pa ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is the establishment.

original: ci'i phyir de las gzhan tha dad pa bkag pa med par mi rtogs she na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir de las gzhan tha dad pa bkag pa med par mi rtogs she na /
translated: Why is it not understood that the exclusion of other is not separate from it?

original: 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is the way.

original: mngon sum gyis rtogs pa'i dngos po de gzhan dang ma 'dres pa'am zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa gcig ni /
analyzed: mngon sum gyis rtogs pa'i dngos po de gzhan dang ma 'dres pa'am zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa gcig ni /
translated: The thing that is understood by direct perception is either unmixed with other, which is the first conception,

original: 'on te gzhan dang 'dres par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: 'on te gzhan dang 'dres par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa'o //
translated: or it is mixed with other, which is the second conception.

original: gal te gzhan dang 'dres ba ni /
analyzed: gal te gzhan dang 'dres ba ni /
translated: If it is mixed with other,

original: de'i tshe dngos po mi 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe dngos po mi 'gyur ba'o //
translated: then it is not a thing.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'dres pa'i tha snyad med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dres pa'i tha snyad med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no convention of mixture.

original: 'chad pa ni 'dir zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'chad pa ni 'dir zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The explanation is here.

original: sgra'i mtshan nyid kyi dngos po ni /
analyzed: sgra'i mtshan nyid kyi dngos po ni /
translated: The thing that is the characteristic of sound,

original: gzhan rtag pa dang mi rtag pa dag las ldog pa'am mi ldog / ldog pa'i phyogs la yang rnam par rtog pa gnyis brjod pa ni /
analyzed: gzhan rtag pa dang mi rtag pa dag las ldog pa'am mi ldog / ldog pa'i phyogs la yang rnam par rtog pa gnyis brjod pa ni /
translated: In the case of exclusion, the two alternatives are stated:

original: bzung ba'am ma bzung ba yin bzung ba'i phyogs su ma 'byin pa ni gal te zhes bya pa'o //
analyzed: bzung ba'am ma bzung ba yin bzung ba'i phyogs su ma 'byin pa ni gal te zhes bya pa'o //
translated: It is either apprehended or not apprehended. The alternative of non-apprehension is stated in the phrase ‚Äúif it is not excluded.‚Äù

original: gzhan zhes bya ba ni rtag pa dang mi rtag pa'i phung po gnyis mi 'gog ste 'on kyang 'gog pa kho na'o //üîΩma bzung ba'i phyogs la brjod pa ni /
analyzed: gzhan zhes bya ba ni rtag pa dang mi rtag pa'i phung po gnyis mi 'gog ste 'on kyang 'gog pa kho na'o // ma bzung ba'i phyogs la brjod pa ni /
translated: The other, i.e., the two aggregates of the permanent and the impermanent, are not excluded, but are excluded.

original: de lta ma yin zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de lta ma yin zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The alternative of apprehension is stated in the phrase ‚Äúif it is excluded.‚Äù

original: gal te ldog pa ma bzung na de'i tshe mngon sum gyis 'dzings par rtogs pa'i phyir tha snyad med pas na'o //
analyzed: gal te ldog pa ma bzung na de'i tshe mngon sum gyis 'dzings par rtogs pa'i phyir tha snyad med pas na'o //
translated: If it is not excluded, then, because it is understood by direct perception, there is no convention.

original: don med do zhes bya ba ni 'jug pa dang ldog pa'i mtshan nyid kyi tha snyad med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don med do zhes bya ba ni 'jug pa dang ldog pa'i mtshan nyid kyi tha snyad med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: There is no point, i.e., there is no convention characterized by engagement and exclusion.

original: 'on te zhes bya ba ni mngon sum gyis sgra rtag pa dang mi rtag pa dag las mi ldog pa nyid du bzung yang byas pa nyid la sogs pa'i rtags kyis rtag pa nyid 'gog pa na /
analyzed: 'on te zhes bya ba ni mngon sum gyis sgra rtag pa dang mi rtag pa dag las mi ldog pa nyid du bzung yang byas pa nyid la sogs pa'i rtags kyis rtag pa nyid 'gog pa na /
translated: ‚ÄúOr‚Äù means that even though one holds that sound is not ascertained as permanent or impermanent by direct perception, when permanence is refuted by the reason of being produced, etc.,

original: mi rtag pa nyid kyis tha snyad 'jug par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid kyis tha snyad 'jug par byed pa yin te /
translated: ‚ÄúBut‚Äù means that even if one holds that perception does not turn away from the permanent and impermanent with regard to sound, when permanence is refuted by the reason of being produced, etc., impermanence is what causes the designation.

original: des na 'dzings pa zhes ci te brjod ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: des na 'dzings pa zhes ci te brjod ces bya ba'o //
translated: Therefore, why is it called ‚Äúentanglement‚Äù?

original: rtog pa la ni brtag pa la'o //
analyzed: rtog pa la ni brtag pa la'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIn thought‚Äù means in the conception.

original: gzhan gyis ni byas pas so //
analyzed: gzhan gyis ni byas pas so //
translated: ‚ÄúBy another‚Äù means by what is produced.

original: gzhan yang ni rjes su dpag pa yang ngo //
analyzed: gzhan yang ni rjes su dpag pa yang ngo //
translated: ‚ÄúAlso‚Äù means also by inference.

original: 'dis ni de lta ma yin zhes bya ba'i phyogs rnam pa gnyis su brtags te sun phyung @223b ba yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni de lta ma yin zhes bya ba'i phyogs rnam pa gnyis su brtags te sun phyung @223b ba yin no //
translated: This refutes the two alternatives of the position that it is not like that.

original: 'on te zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni phyogs dang po sun 'byin pa'o //
analyzed: 'on te zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni phyogs dang po sun 'byin pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúBut‚Äù and so on refute the first position.

original: lan ni las zhes bya ba ste mngon sum de las gzhan pa'i tshad ma ba rgyas kyang ngo //
analyzed: lan ni las zhes bya ba ste mngon sum de las gzhan pa'i tshad ma ba rgyas kyang ngo //
translated: The answer is ‚Äúaction,‚Äù which is perception and also the other valid knowledge.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rang gi rang bzhin zhes bya ba ste gzhan dang 'dres pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi rang bzhin zhes bya ba ste gzhan dang 'dres pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIts own nature‚Äù is mixed with another.

original: gzhan du zhes bya pa ni gzhan dang ma 'dres par ro //üîΩ'ga' zhig gis zhes bya ba ni chos kyi rang bzhin gyis mi rtag pa ma 'dres pa yin gyi /
analyzed: gzhan du zhes bya pa ni gzhan dang ma 'dres par ro // 'ga' zhig gis zhes bya ba ni chos kyi rang bzhin gyis mi rtag pa ma 'dres pa yin gyi /
translated: ‚ÄúOtherwise‚Äù means not mixed with other.

original: chos can gyi rang bzhin gyis ni ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: chos can gyi rang bzhin gyis ni ma yin pa'o //
translated: ‚Äú By some‚Äù means by the nature of the fact, not by the nature of the subject.

original: de lta ma yin te zhes bya ba ni mi ldog pa nyid du'o //
analyzed: de lta ma yin te zhes bya ba ni mi ldog pa nyid du'o //
translated: ‚Äú Otherwise‚Äù means not as irreversible.

original: dogs pa ni gzhan gyis zhes bya ba ste tshad ma gzhan gyis so //
analyzed: dogs pa ni gzhan gyis zhes bya ba ste tshad ma gzhan gyis so //
translated: ‚Äú Doubt‚Äù means by another, by another valid cognition.

original: lan ni gzhan gyis zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lan ni gzhan gyis zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚Äú Answer‚Äù means by another.

original: tshad ma gsum pa la sogs pas tshad ma gnyis pas bzung ba yang de lta ma yin par rtogs na thams cad la yid brtan du med do //
analyzed: tshad ma gsum pa la sogs pas tshad ma gnyis pas bzung ba yang de lta ma yin par rtogs na thams cad la yid brtan du med do //
translated: If one understands that what is grasped by the second valid cognition is not so by the third valid cognition and so on, then nothing can be relied on at all.

original: bstan zin to zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bstan zin to zhes bya ba ni /
translated: ‚Äú Already explained‚Äù means

original: de ltar ma yin na de la yang gzhan gyis bsgrub pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pas so //
analyzed: de ltar ma yin na de la yang gzhan gyis bsgrub pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pas so //
translated: that if it were not so, then it would be established by another, and so on.

original: gal te mngon sum la yang dus phyir 'byung ba'i tshad mas gnod pa'i phyir thams cad la yid brtan du med par 'gyur ro zhe na nyi tshan zhes bya pa'o //
analyzed: gal te mngon sum la yang dus phyir 'byung ba'i tshad mas gnod pa'i phyir thams cad la yid brtan du med par 'gyur ro zhe na nyi tshan zhes bya pa'o //
translated: If you say that because direct perception is invalidated by a later valid cognition, then nothing can be trusted, we reply: no.

original: nyi tshan las khyim phugs su zhugs ma thag pa'i skyes bu la rnam pa gzhan snang ba'i mngon sum la ma yin pa phyis gsal bar snang ba gang yin pa'i mngon sum phyi ma des snga ma la gnod kyis snga mas ni phyi ma la mi gnod pa'i
analyzed: nyi tshan las khyim phugs su zhugs ma thag pa'i skyes bu la rnam pa gzhan snang ba'i mngon sum la ma yin pa phyis gsal bar snang ba gang yin pa'i mngon sum phyi ma des snga ma la gnod kyis snga mas ni phyi ma la mi gnod pa'i
translated: For example, when a person has just entered a house from the sun, the direct perception of objects in the house is not clear, but later it becomes clear. The later direct perception invalidates the earlier one, but not vice versa.

original: phyir ci ltar yid brtan du med /
analyzed: phyir ci ltar yid brtan du med /
translated: So why can't anything be trusted?

original: des na zhes bya ba ni skabs kyi mjug sdud pa'o //
analyzed: des na zhes bya ba ni skabs kyi mjug sdud pa'o //
translated: Thus concludes the topic.

original: gzhan las zhes bya ba ni mnyan bya nyid las so //
analyzed: gzhan las zhes bya ba ni mnyan bya nyid las so //
translated: From another means from what is to be heard.

original: de ltar ma yin par ni nges par ro //
analyzed: de ltar ma yin par ni nges par ro //
translated: Otherwise means if it were not so.

original: de bzhin no zhes bya ba ni mnyan bya nyid kyis kyang gnyi ga las ldog pa'i sgra rtogs pa na gzhan las the tsham za ba'am nges par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin no zhes bya ba ni mnyan bya nyid kyis kyang gnyi ga las ldog pa'i sgra rtogs pa na gzhan las the tsham za ba'am nges par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: So it is means that when a word is understood as excluding both, there is no doubt or certainty from another.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar ldog pa nyid yin na gtan tshigs kho nar 'gyur ba des na'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar ldog pa nyid yin na gtan tshigs kho nar 'gyur ba des na'o //
translated: Because it is thus a contradistinction, it is a reason.

original: gal te ma mthong ba tsam la brten nas ldog pa can du gsungs na 'o na ci ltar zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te ma mthong ba tsam la brten nas ldog pa can du gsungs na 'o na ci ltar zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If it is said to be a contradistinction based on mere non-perception, then what is it?

original: lan ni gcig tu nges pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lan ni gcig tu nges pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The answer is: ‚Äúit is a certainty.‚Äù

original: ci ltar nges pa ldog snyam na /üîΩde ni zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: ci ltar nges pa ldog snyam na / de ni zhes bya ba ste /
translated: How is there a certainty of contradistinction?

original: mnyan par bya ba nyid do //
analyzed: mnyan par bya ba nyid do //
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù is what is to be heard.

original: des na zhes bya ba ni ma nges pa na'o //
analyzed: des na zhes bya ba ni ma nges pa na'o //
translated: ‚ÄúTherefore‚Äù is when there is no certainty.

original: nges pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni ma rtogs pa'i rgyu ni ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: nges pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni ma rtogs pa'i rgyu ni ma yin pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIt is a certainty‚Äù is not a cause of non-understanding.

original: de bas na thun mong pa bzhin du thun mong ma yin pa @224a * //
analyzed: de bas na thun mong pa bzhin du thun mong ma yin pa @224a * //
translated: Therefore, like a common [reason], an uncommon [reason]

original: yang ma nges pa kho na'o zhes bya bar gnas so //
analyzed: yang ma nges pa kho na'o zhes bya bar gnas so //
translated: is also only uncertain.

original: 'dis ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs las ldog par the tshom za ba gzhan dag gtan tshigs nyid du 'dod pa yang ma nges pa nyid du shes par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dis ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs las ldog par the tshom za ba gzhan dag gtan tshigs nyid du 'dod pa yang ma nges pa nyid du shes par bya'o //
translated: By this, one should understand that others who doubt a contradistinction from a discordant class also desire a reason that is only uncertain.

original: 'di tsam gyis ci zhig bshad snyam na /
analyzed: 'di tsam gyis ci zhig bshad snyam na /
translated: What is explained by just this much?

original: de ltar na re zhig ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: de ltar na re zhig ces bya ba'o //
translated: Thus, ‚Äúat one time.üîΩ‚Äù

original: ci ltar zhes bya ba nas zhe na'i bar ni rtsod pa'o //
analyzed: ci ltar zhes bya ba nas zhe na'i bar ni rtsod pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúHow?‚Äù up to ‚Äúis it?‚Äù is the dispute.

original: ldog pa can zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs mnyan bya nyid do //
analyzed: ldog pa can zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs mnyan bya nyid do //
translated: ‚ÄúThe exclusion‚Äù is the reason, ‚Äúis heard.‚Äù

original: 'di nyid brjod pa ni 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di nyid brjod pa ni 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is stated: ‚ÄúThus.‚Äù

original: ci ltar rjes 'gro gcig du nges pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci ltar rjes 'gro gcig du nges pa yin zhe na /
translated: How is there a single, definite pervasion?

original: nam mkha' zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: nam mkha' zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúSpace.‚Äù

original: 'di ni gzhal bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni gzhal bya'o //
translated: This is the object of evaluation.

original: ci ltar ldog pa med pa yin zhe na nam mkha' la ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ci ltar ldog pa med pa yin zhe na nam mkha' la ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: How is there no exclusion? ‚ÄúSpace is not.‚Äù

original: 'di ni gzhal bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni gzhal bya'o //
translated: This is the object of evaluation.

original: de ni nam mkha'o //
analyzed: de ni nam mkha'o //
translated: That is space.

original: des na zhes bya ba ni ldog pa med pas na'o //
analyzed: des na zhes bya ba ni ldog pa med pas na'o //
translated: ‚ÄúTherefore‚Äù is because there is no exclusion.

original: de ni ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gtan tshigs 'di ma nges pa nyid du brjod pa'o //
analyzed: de ni ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gtan tshigs 'di ma nges pa nyid du brjod pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThat is not so‚Äù and so forth expresses that this reason is not definite.

original: mdo sde pa mngon par 'dod pa nam mkha' med pa'i phyogs la ni gal te /
analyzed: mdo sde pa mngon par 'dod pa nam mkha' med pa'i phyogs la ni gal te /
translated: The SautrƒÅntikas assert that if there is no space,

original: nam mkha' de mi srid pa de lta na yang gzhal bya nyid ni nam mkha' med pa 'di la ci ltar yang mi ldog go //
analyzed: nam mkha' de mi srid pa de lta na yang gzhal bya nyid ni nam mkha' med pa 'di la ci ltar yang mi ldog go //
translated: Even though space is impossible, still the object of knowledge is not at all averted in this nonexistence of space.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: med pa la yang ngo zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: med pa la yang ngo zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Because of nonexistence.üîΩIf it were not so,

original: de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba ni med pa la gzhal bya nyid med na'o //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba ni med pa la gzhal bya nyid med na'o //
translated: if the object of knowledge did not exist in nonexistence,üîΩhow could there be a convention?

original: ci ltar tha snyad med par 'gyur zhe na yod pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ci ltar tha snyad med par 'gyur zhe na yod pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Because of existence.

original: 'ba' zhig ces bya ba ni gzhan las ldog pa med pa'o //
analyzed: 'ba' zhig ces bya ba ni gzhan las ldog pa med pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúOnly‚Äù means that there is no exclusion from another.

original: ci'i phyir nus pa ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir nus pa ma yin zhe na /
translated: Why is it not possible?

original: phan tshun zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: phan tshun zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Because of mutual.üîΩIf it were not so,

original: de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba ni phan tshun spangs pa ma yin na'o //üîΩtha snyad du byed pa su zhig tha snyad bya ba gang la'am /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba ni phan tshun spangs pa ma yin na'o // tha snyad du byed pa su zhig tha snyad bya ba gang la'am /
translated: if there were no mutual exclusion,üîΩwhat convention would anyone make about what?

original: dgos pa ci'i don du byed pa yin te /
analyzed: dgos pa ci'i don du byed pa yin te /
translated: For what purpose?

original: 'di thams cad med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di thams cad med par 'gyur ro //
translated: All of this would be impossible.

original: gal te de ltar don thams cad kyi /
analyzed: gal te de ltar don thams cad kyi /
translated: If it were so,

original: phan tshun med pa gzhal bya yin mod /
analyzed: phan tshun med pa gzhal bya yin mod /
translated: then all objects of knowledge would be mutually nonexistent.

original: med pa'i nam mkha' la go ci ltar zhe na /
analyzed: med pa'i nam mkha' la go ci ltar zhe na /
translated: How can space, which is non-existent, be an object of knowledge?

original: gzhan gyis zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyis zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Others say that space does not exist.

original: rigs pa can la sogs pa gzhan dag gis nam mkha' med do zhes bya ba'i phyogs med par ma rtogs pa te /
analyzed: rigs pa can la sogs pa gzhan dag gis nam mkha' med do zhes bya ba'i phyogs med par ma rtogs pa te /
translated: Others, such as the NaiyƒÅyikas, do not understand that the position that space does not exist is untenable.

original: ma nges pa ni mdo sde bas rang rang gi phyogs nam mkha' med pa'i phyogs gzhung gzugs par nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ma nges pa ni mdo sde bas rang rang gi phyogs nam mkha' med pa'i phyogs gzhung gzugs par nus pa ma yin no //
translated: The SautrƒÅntikas are uncertain, for they are unable to establish their own position that space does not exist.

original: des na mdo sde ba'i lugs kyi nam mkha' med pa yin yang gzhal bya ni yin pa kho na'o //
analyzed: des na mdo sde ba'i lugs kyi nam mkha' med pa yin yang gzhal bya ni yin pa kho na'o //
translated: Therefore, although space does not exist in the SautrƒÅntika system, it is certainly an object of knowledge.

original: de ltar gzhan gyi 'dod pa'i nam mkha' med pa @224b gzhal bya nyid du bsgrubs nas rang gi 'dod pa brjod pa ni /
analyzed: de ltar gzhan gyi 'dod pa'i nam mkha' med pa @224b gzhal bya nyid du bsgrubs nas rang gi 'dod pa brjod pa ni /
translated: Having thus established that space, which is non-existent according to others, is an object of knowledge, he states his own position:

original: nam mkha' yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: nam mkha' yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Space is also an object of knowledge.

original: thogs pa dang bcas pa'i dngos po med pa zhes bya ba'i ni yon tan sgra la bltos te /
analyzed: thogs pa dang bcas pa'i dngos po med pa zhes bya ba'i ni yon tan sgra la bltos te /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe non-existence of entities that possess obstruction‚Äù is stated with respect to the quality of sound.

original: nam mkha' yon tan can nyid yin pa sel ba'o //
analyzed: nam mkha' yon tan can nyid yin pa sel ba'o //
translated: It eliminates the notion that space possesses the quality of sound.

original: de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Otherwise,

original: gal te nam mkha' thogs pa dang bcas pa'i dngos po dang bral ba'i rang bzhin tshad ma'i spyod yul du mi 'dod na'o //
analyzed: gal te nam mkha' thogs pa dang bcas pa'i dngos po dang bral ba'i rang bzhin tshad ma'i spyod yul du mi 'dod na'o //
translated: If you do not accept that space is the nature of the absence of obstruction, which is the domain of a valid cognition.

original: mjug sdud pa ni des na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mjug sdud pa ni des na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The summary is stated in the line ‚ÄúTherefore, the absence of entity is also an object of comprehension.‚Äù

original: de zhes bya ba dngos po med /
analyzed: de zhes bya ba dngos po med /
translated: The absence of entity is that.

original: de ltar te dngos po rnams ma 'dres par rnam par 'jog pas rnam par gzhag par bya ba yin na /
analyzed: de ltar te dngos po rnams ma 'dres par rnam par 'jog pas rnam par gzhag par bya ba yin na /
translated: In that case, since entities are posited as objects of comprehension by being posited as unmixed,

original: de'i tshe tshad mas rnam par gzhag pa yin no zhes khas blang par bya ste /
analyzed: de'i tshe tshad mas rnam par gzhag pa yin no zhes khas blang par bya ste /
translated: at that time one must accept that they are posited by a valid cognition.

original: des na dngos po med pa yang gzhal bya yin no //
analyzed: des na dngos po med pa yang gzhal bya yin no //
translated: Therefore the absence of entity is also an object of comprehension.

original: ci ltar dngos po med pa gzhal bya yin te /
analyzed: ci ltar dngos po med pa gzhal bya yin te /
translated: How is the absence of entity an object of comprehension?

original: dngos po kho na gzhal bya yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: dngos po kho na gzhal bya yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: Because only an entity is an object of comprehension.

original: dngos po'i zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dngos po'i zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The response to that is stated in the line ‚ÄúAn entity is an object of comprehension.‚Äù

original: 'on kyang gzhan med pa'i yul can yang yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang gzhan med pa'i yul can yang yin no //
translated: However, it is also a subject that has a nonexistent object.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: tshad ma ni zhes bya ba ni gzhan dang bral ba'i dngos po 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshad ma ni zhes bya ba ni gzhan dang bral ba'i dngos po 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The response is stated in the line ‚ÄúBecause a valid cognition is defined as apprehending an entity that is free from another.‚Äù

original: 'di nyid brjod pa ni rnam par gcod par byed pa nyid ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di nyid brjod pa ni rnam par gcod par byed pa nyid ces bya ba'o //
translated: This is what is called ‚Äúthe eliminator.‚Äù

original: rnam par gcod par byed pa tshad ma yin na /
analyzed: rnam par gcod par byed pa tshad ma yin na /
translated: If the eliminator is a valid cognition,

original: nya phyis la dngul du shes pa yang tshad mar 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: nya phyis la dngul du shes pa yang tshad mar 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: then the cognition that perceives mother-of-pearl as silver would also be a valid cognition.

original: gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The response to that is ‚ÄúIf . . .‚Äù

original: gnod byed gzhan gyis so //
analyzed: gnod byed gzhan gyis so //
translated: ‚ÄúAnother‚Äù means another that is harmful.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar dngos po'i yul can nyid kyi tshad ma ma yin pa de'i phyir tha snyad du mi slu ba don byed pa gang yin pa de sgrub par byed pa'ang yin la shes pa'ang yin pa des gcad par bya ba'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar dngos po'i yul can nyid kyi tshad ma ma yin pa de'i phyir tha snyad du mi slu ba don byed pa gang yin pa de sgrub par byed pa'ang yin la shes pa'ang yin pa des gcad par bya ba'o //
translated: Since a valid cognition is not a cognition that has a real object, therefore, conventionally, that which is nondeceptive and performs a function is a valid cognition.

original: bum pa ni don bya ba rtogs pa nyid de dang shes pa gcig la 'dre ba'i shing rta la sogs pa med par rtogs pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bum pa ni don bya ba rtogs pa nyid de dang shes pa gcig la 'dre ba'i shing rta la sogs pa med par rtogs pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: A pot is understood to perform a function, and it is understood to be without a chariot and so on, which are mixed with it in a single cognition.

original: de bas na zhes bya ba ni rjes su 'gro ba mi 'khrul ba ma yin pas na'o //
analyzed: de bas na zhes bya ba ni rjes su 'gro ba mi 'khrul ba ma yin pas na'o //
translated: Therefore, because there is no nonerroneous positive concomitance,

original: 'on te zhes bya ba ni dogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'on te zhes bya ba ni dogs pa'o //
translated: the response to that is ‚ÄúIf . . .‚Äù

original: de lta yin na zhes bya ba ni lan no //
analyzed: de lta yin na zhes bya ba ni lan no //
translated: ‚ÄúIf that is so‚Äù is the response.

original: gang gi phyir don bya bar nus pa'i dngos po kho na gzhal bya yin pa des na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir don bya bar nus pa'i dngos po kho na gzhal bya yin pa des na /
translated: Since only things that are able to perform a function are objects of valid cognition,

original: don bya ba byed pa nyid mi rtag pa nyid kyi go bar byed pa yin no zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: don bya ba byed pa nyid mi rtag pa nyid kyi go bar byed pa yin no zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: it is understood that the performance of a function is the definition of impermanence.

original: de yang zhes bya ba ni don bya ba byed pa'i mtshan nyid kyi gzhal bya nyid ci ltar rjes su 'gro ba can gyi gtan tshigs yin zhes 'brel to //
analyzed: de yang zhes bya ba ni don bya ba byed pa'i mtshan nyid kyi gzhal bya nyid ci ltar rjes su 'gro ba can gyi gtan tshigs yin zhes 'brel to //
translated: ‚Äú That‚Äù refers to the definition of an object of valid cognition, which is the performance of a function. How is it a reason that pervades?

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: dngos po med pa las zhes bya ba'o //üîΩgal te gang zhig med pa @225a * //
analyzed: dngos po med pa las zhes bya ba'o // gal te gang zhig med pa @225a * //
translated: ‚Äú From a nonentity.‚Äù

original: ni 'byung khungs su 'gyur ba ma yin te /
analyzed: ni 'byung khungs su 'gyur ba ma yin te /
translated: If you think, ‚ÄúThat which does not exist is not a source,

original: des na ci ltar med pa las ldog ces brjod snyam na med pa las kyang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: des na ci ltar med pa las ldog ces brjod snyam na med pa las kyang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: so how can something be said to be ‚Äòexcluded from nonexistence‚Äô? ‚Äù

original: bstan zin to zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bstan zin to zhes bya ba ni /
translated: ‚Äú It has been explained‚Äù

original: phyir dngos dngos med rten can zhes bya bar ro //
analyzed: phyir dngos dngos med rten can zhes bya bar ro //
translated: in the statement, ‚ÄúThe existence and nonexistence of things are based on their being existent or nonexistent.‚Äù

original: 'dis ni zhes bya ba ni gzhal bya nyid thun mong gi ma nges par bstan pas na'o //
analyzed: 'dis ni zhes bya ba ni gzhal bya nyid thun mong gi ma nges par bstan pas na'o //
translated: This is because the common inconclusive nature of the object of cognition has been taught.

original: rjes su 'gro ba mi 'khrul pa nyid de dag gtan tshigs nyid yin pa yang gsal ba yin no //
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba mi 'khrul pa nyid de dag gtan tshigs nyid yin pa yang gsal ba yin no //
translated: The non-erroneous pervasion of those is also clarified to be the reason.

original: 'di ltar dngos po nyid kyang bsgrub par bya ba mi rtag pa nyid yin pa na /
analyzed: 'di ltar dngos po nyid kyang bsgrub par bya ba mi rtag pa nyid yin pa na /
translated: Thus, when the thing itself is the probandum impermanence,

original: bum pa dang nam mkha' dag la rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa yin no //
analyzed: bum pa dang nam mkha' dag la rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa yin no //
translated: there is pervasion and reversal in the case of a pot and space.

original: mdo sde pas nam mkha' yang dngos po med par 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mdo sde pas nam mkha' yang dngos po med par 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the Sautrantikas assert that space is also a non-thing.

original: med pa yang 'byung khungs su bsgrubs zin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩdes na ci ltar rtag pa nyid du bsgrub par bya ba la /
analyzed: med pa yang 'byung khungs su bsgrubs zin pa'i phyir ro // des na ci ltar rtag pa nyid du bsgrub par bya ba la /
translated: And because non-existence has already been established as a source.üîΩTherefore, just as the common inconclusive nature of the object of cognition is in the proof of permanence,

original: gzhal bya nyid thun mong gi ma nges pa yin pa de bzhin du mi rtag pa nyid bsgrub par bya ba la yang yin no zhes gnas so //
analyzed: gzhal bya nyid thun mong gi ma nges pa yin pa de bzhin du mi rtag pa nyid bsgrub par bya ba la yang yin no zhes gnas so //
translated: it is the same in the proof of impermanence.

original: phyogs kyi chos rnam pa dgur bstan pa la nyung ba nyid du rtsod pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: phyogs kyi chos rnam pa dgur bstan pa la nyung ba nyid du rtsod pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The argument that the teaching of the nine types of property of the subject is too few is as follows: If it is said that the property of the subject is not established, it is not so.

original: rtsod pa smra ba nyid grub pa'i mtha' smra ba'i dogs pa bsu ba ni /
analyzed: rtsod pa smra ba nyid grub pa'i mtha' smra ba'i dogs pa bsu ba ni /
translated: The opponent‚Äôs response to the objection that the proponent of the thesis has not established the reason is as follows:

original: 'on te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'on te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúBut if . . .‚Äù

original: de lta yin na zhes bya ba ni rtsod pa po nyid lan ldon pa'o //
analyzed: de lta yin na zhes bya ba ni rtsod pa po nyid lan ldon pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIn that case . . .‚Äù is the proponent‚Äôs response.

original: rang rgyud du zhes bya ba ni dngos po'i khyad par la mi ltos pa'o //
analyzed: rang rgyud du zhes bya ba ni dngos po'i khyad par la mi ltos pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúAutonomously‚Äù means without relying on the specific features of the object.

original: 'o na tha snyad kyi yul du gyur pa ci lta bur gyur pa zhig yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na tha snyad kyi yul du gyur pa ci lta bur gyur pa zhig yin zhe na /
translated: ‚ÄúBut what is the object of the convention?‚Äù

original: 'on kyang zhes bya ba'o //üîΩgal te rnam pa de lta bu'i dngos po med pa ni rang nyid 'grub mod /
analyzed: 'on kyang zhes bya ba'o // gal te rnam pa de lta bu'i dngos po med pa ni rang nyid 'grub mod /
translated: ‚ÄúNevertheless . . .‚Äù

original: rgyu dang khyad par byed pa med pa las de ci ltar sgrub snyam na /
analyzed: rgyu dang khyad par byed pa med pa las de ci ltar sgrub snyam na /
translated: ‚ÄúIf a non-thing of that kind is established, then how is it established without a cause and without a specific feature?‚Äù

original: dngos po de yang zhes bya ba'o //üîΩci'i phyir mi 'grub snyam na /
analyzed: dngos po de yang zhes bya ba'o // ci'i phyir mi 'grub snyam na /
translated: ‚ÄúThat thing . . .‚ÄùüîΩ‚ÄúWhy is it not established?‚Äù

original: de ma dmigs zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de ma dmigs zhes bya ba ste /
translated: ‚ÄúBecause it is not observed . . .‚Äù

original: 'bras bu the tshom za ba'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu the tshom za ba'o //
translated: This is the result of the doubt.

original: 'on ci ltar dngos po med par 'grub snyam na /
analyzed: 'on ci ltar dngos po med par 'grub snyam na /
translated: ‚ÄúBut how is a non-thing established?‚Äù

original: gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIf‚Äù means:üîΩ

original: de med par ni 'bras bu the tshom za ba la sogs pa de med par ro //
analyzed: de med par ni 'bras bu the tshom za ba la sogs pa de med par ro //
translated: Without that, the effect would be uncertain, etc.

original: de la yang zhes bya ba ni rgyu dang khyad par byed pa la'o //
analyzed: de la yang zhes bya ba ni rgyu dang khyad par byed pa la'o //
translated: ‚ÄúAnd‚Äù means ‚Äúcause‚Äù and ‚Äúdistinguisher.‚Äù

original: de nyid ces bya ba ni de'i bdag nyid dang de las byung ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid ces bya ba ni de'i bdag nyid dang de las byung ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThat itself‚Äù means ‚Äúthat nature‚Äù and ‚Äúthat origination.‚Äù

original: gal te 'brel pa grub pa kho na mi dmigs pa yin na /
analyzed: gal te 'brel pa grub pa kho na mi dmigs pa yin na /
translated: If non-apprehension is only established as a relation,

original: de'i tshe rang bzhin la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs bzhin du 'di la yang dper brjod pa ci te ma sbyar ce na zhes bya ba ni 'dri ba'i don to //
analyzed: de'i tshe rang bzhin la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs bzhin du 'di la yang dper brjod pa ci te ma sbyar ce na zhes bya ba ni 'dri ba'i don to //
translated: then, like the logical entity of nature, etc., why is an example not applied to this?

original: lan ni sbyar ba kho na'o zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lan ni sbyar ba kho na'o zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The answer is: ‚ÄúIt is applied.‚Äù

original: 'di ltar rgyu dang / ngo bo skyed par byed pa dang khyad par byed pa dag mi mthun pa'i @225b phyogs la ldog pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: 'di ltar rgyu dang / ngo bo skyed par byed pa dang khyad par byed pa dag mi mthun pa'i @225b phyogs la ldog pa nyid kyis /
translated: Thus, the cause and the nature, which are the producer and the distinguisher, are only excluded from the discordant side.

original: 'bras bu dang khyab byar gyur pa'i don ldog par slob dpon phyogs kyi glang pos brjod pa las de dag mi dmigs pa'i dpe ni grub pa de'i phyir de gnyis las tha dad par ma bshad do //
analyzed: 'bras bu dang khyab byar gyur pa'i don ldog par slob dpon phyogs kyi glang pos brjod pa las de dag mi dmigs pa'i dpe ni grub pa de'i phyir de gnyis las tha dad par ma bshad do //
translated: Master Dignaga stated that the meaning-distinguisher of effect and pervader is excluded, and he did not explain that those two are different from the non-observation of those.

original: gang gis de skad smra ba de ltar brjod pa yod dam zhe na 'di ni bstan zin to zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gang gis de skad smra ba de ltar brjod pa yod dam zhe na 'di ni bstan zin to zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If someone says, ‚ÄúIs there such a statement?‚Äù this has already been explained.

original: 'o na rang bzhin mi dmigs pa tshang ngo zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na rang bzhin mi dmigs pa tshang ngo zhe na /
translated: If it is said, ‚ÄúThe non-observation of nature is complete,‚Äù

original: rang bzhin zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin zhes bya ba'o //
translated: it is called ‚Äúnature.‚Äù

original: bstan pa nyid de zhes bya ba ni phyogs kyi chos rnam pa dgu bstan par ro //
analyzed: bstan pa nyid de zhes bya ba ni phyogs kyi chos rnam pa dgu bstan par ro //
translated: ‚ÄúIt is just explained‚Äù means that the nine types of property of the subject are explained.

original: ci ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ci ltar zhe na /
translated: How is it so?

original: rgyu dang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rgyu dang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúCause‚Äù and so on.

original: dngos po ni 'bras bu dang khyab bya'o //
analyzed: dngos po ni 'bras bu dang khyab bya'o //
translated: The thing is the effect and the pervaded.

original: de la'ang zhes bya ba gang gi sgra ni nges par gzung ba'i don to //
analyzed: de la'ang zhes bya ba gang gi sgra ni nges par gzung ba'i don to //
translated: ‚ÄúIn that‚Äù is the sound of certainty.

original: bstan pa kho na'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bstan pa kho na'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is ‚Äúit is just explained.‚Äù

original: mi dmigs pa gang gis gzhan dag mi mthun pa'i phyogs bum pa la gtan tshigs srog la sogs pa ldog par bstan pa'i don du bdag med par grub par byed pa'i mi dmigs pa de la slob dpon phyogs kyi glang pos the tshom za bar bshad pas bltar
analyzed: mi dmigs pa gang gis gzhan dag mi mthun pa'i phyogs bum pa la gtan tshigs srog la sogs pa ldog par bstan pa'i don du bdag med par grub par byed pa'i mi dmigs pa de la slob dpon phyogs kyi glang pos the tshom za bar bshad pas bltar
translated: The master Dignaga explained that the non-apprehension which proves the non-existence of the self, by which one shows that life-force and so on are absent in the vase, which is the counter-correlate of the vase, is doubtful.

original: rung ba'i don la mi dmigs pa de go bar byed pa yin no zhes bstan pa kho na'o //
analyzed: rung ba'i don la mi dmigs pa de go bar byed pa yin no zhes bstan pa kho na'o //
translated: Therefore, it is only taught that non-apprehension of a visible object is the proof.

original: ci ltar gtan tshigs the tshom za bar bshad ce na /
analyzed: ci ltar gtan tshigs the tshom za bar bshad ce na /
translated: How is it that the reason is said to be doubtful?

original: bdag gi mtshan nyid kyi skyes bu mthong ba med pa las srog la sogs pa ldog pa med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: bdag gi mtshan nyid kyi skyes bu mthong ba med pa las srog la sogs pa ldog pa med pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because the absence of life-force and so on is not established from the non-perception of a person who has the characteristics of a self,

original: ldog pa bkag pa'i phyir de bdag bltar mi rung ba'i yul can nyid kyis na mi dmigs pa tsam las the tshom za ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ldog pa bkag pa'i phyir de bdag bltar mi rung ba'i yul can nyid kyis na mi dmigs pa tsam las the tshom za ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: because the negation of absence is the object of a subject that is not suitable to see the self. Therefore, it is said that it is doubtful from mere non-apprehension.

original: rang bzhin dang 'bras bu dag kyang rnam par gcod pa'i yul can nyid kyis na /
analyzed: rang bzhin dang 'bras bu dag kyang rnam par gcod pa'i yul can nyid kyis na /
translated: Also, the reason and effect are the objects of exclusion.

original: mi dmigs pa'i rang bzhin nyid du dogs pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa'i rang bzhin nyid du dogs pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The doubt about the nature of non-apprehension is ‚Äúif‚Äù.

original: dgos pa ni 'o na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dgos pa ni 'o na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The purpose is ‚Äúthen‚Äù.

original: lan ni de'i bdag nyid do zhes bya ba'o /
analyzed: lan ni de'i bdag nyid do zhes bya ba'o /
translated: The reply is ‚Äútheir nature‚Äù.

original: gang dag dngos po'i rang bzhin khas ma blangs pa'i dgag pa sgrib pa de la ste /
analyzed: gang dag dngos po'i rang bzhin khas ma blangs pa'i dgag pa sgrib pa de la ste /
translated: The negation which does not accept the nature of entities is that.

original: dmigs par du ba rnams kyis yod pa rnams ni dmigs pa las gzhan ma yin pa kho na'o //
analyzed: dmigs par du ba rnams kyis yod pa rnams ni dmigs pa las gzhan ma yin pa kho na'o //
translated: The existents which are the objects of apprehension are not other than the objects of apprehension.

original: 'on kyang dmigs pa nyid yod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang dmigs pa nyid yod pa yin no //
translated: But the objects of apprehension themselves exist.

original: 'di ga las she na /
analyzed: 'di ga las she na /
translated: How is that?

original: med pa'o zhes bya ba'o //üîΩtha dad pas dogs pa bsu ba ni /
analyzed: med pa'o zhes bya ba'o // tha dad pas dogs pa bsu ba ni /
translated: ‚ÄúNon-existent‚Äù.

original: gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The anticipation of the doubt about the difference is ‚Äúif‚Äù.

original: 'di gnyis zhes bya ba ni shes pa med pa dang shes bya ba med pa dag go //
analyzed: 'di gnyis zhes bya ba ni shes pa med pa dang shes bya ba med pa dag go //
translated: ‚ÄúThese two‚Äù are the non-existence of cognition and the non-existence of the cognized.

original: 'on te shes pa dang shes bya dag tha mi dad pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: 'on te shes pa dang shes bya dag tha mi dad pa ma yin nam /
translated: But aren‚Äôt cognition and the cognized not different?

original: de ci ltar de med pa dag tha dad par sgrub pa'i don du 'di gnyis dpe nyid du nye bar blangs she na /
analyzed: de ci ltar de med pa dag tha dad par sgrub pa'i don du 'di gnyis dpe nyid du nye bar blangs she na /
translated: How is it that they are established as different non-existents? Why are these two taken as examples?

original: shes pa nyid @226a * //
analyzed: shes pa nyid @226a * //
translated: Cognition itself is not the cognized.

original: ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: ces bya ba'o //
translated: This is the purport.

original: de zhes bya ba ni don gyi yod pa'o //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni don gyi yod pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù refers to the existence of the object.

original: gal te mngon sum log pas kyang don med pa yin no zhes ci ltar shes she na /
analyzed: gal te mngon sum log pas kyang don med pa yin no zhes ci ltar shes she na /
translated: If it is asked how it is known that the nonexistence of the object is due to the cessation of perception,

original: 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
translated: it is said, ‚Äúin this way.‚Äù

original: 'on te rjes su dpag pas lkog tu gyur pa'i don mi 'dzin pa kho na ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te rjes su dpag pas lkog tu gyur pa'i don mi 'dzin pa kho na ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: But is it not the case that inference does not apprehend a hidden object?

original: du ba mthong bas zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: du ba mthong bas zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is said, ‚Äúwhen smoke is seen.‚Äù

original: 'on te der yang rjes su dpag pas dmigs pa yod pa yin te /
analyzed: 'on te der yang rjes su dpag pas dmigs pa yod pa yin te /
translated: But if it is said that the existence of the object is apprehended by inference there,

original: des na de log pas ni med pa go bar byed pa yin no zhe na der yang zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: des na de log pas ni med pa go bar byed pa yin no zhe na der yang zhes bya ba ste /
translated: and therefore the nonexistence of the object is understood from the cessation of that, it is said, ‚Äúthere also.‚Äù

original: lkog tu gyur pa'i don la'o //
analyzed: lkog tu gyur pa'i don la'o //
translated: It refers to a hidden object.

original: rjes su dpag pas yod pa la khyab pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pas yod pa la khyab pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that existence is not pervaded by inference.

original: ci ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ci ltar zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: rjes su dpag pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: It is said, ‚Äúinference.‚Äù

original: gang gi tshe rjes su dpag pa med kyang lkog tu gyur pa'i don de yod pa de'i tshe rdzas de rjes su dpag pa la 'khrul pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi tshe rjes su dpag pa med kyang lkog tu gyur pa'i don de yod pa de'i tshe rdzas de rjes su dpag pa la 'khrul pa yin no //
translated: When that hidden object exists even though there is no inference, then that substance is an error of inference.

original: 'di nyid brjod pa ni /
analyzed: 'di nyid brjod pa ni /
translated: This is what is being said:

original: rjes su dpag pa ldog pas ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa ldog pas ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚Äúbecause of the reversal of inference.‚Äù

original: 'on te rjes su dpag pas yod pa la ma khyab mod /
analyzed: 'on te rjes su dpag pas yod pa la ma khyab mod /
translated: But if it is not the case that existence is pervaded by inference,

original: yod pas ni rjes su dpag ba ci ltar ma khyab ce na /
analyzed: yod pas ni rjes su dpag ba ci ltar ma khyab ce na /
translated: then how is it that existence is not pervaded by inference?

original: 'das pa dang zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'das pa dang zhes gsungs so //
translated: ‚ÄúThe past and the future‚Äù are mentioned.

original: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i don ni med pa yin te /
analyzed: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i don ni med pa yin te /
translated: The meaning of the past and the future is nonexistence.

original: de lta na yang de dag la rjes su dgag pa mi 'jug pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta na yang de dag la rjes su dgag pa mi 'jug pa yin no //
translated: Even so, negation does not apply to them.

original: des na rjes su dpag pa la yang yod pas ma khyab pa'o //
analyzed: des na rjes su dpag pa la yang yod pas ma khyab pa'o //
translated: Therefore, existence is not pervaded by inference.

original: de nyid kyi phyir yod pa ldog pa rjes su dpag pa med pa med par mi 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir yod pa ldog pa rjes su dpag pa med pa med par mi 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: For this very reason, the reversal of existence is not nonexistent because of the nonexistence of inference.

original: des na shes pa dang shes bya dag bzhin du de med pa dag kyang tha dad pa kho na'o zhe na 'di ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni grub pa'i mtha'o //
analyzed: des na shes pa dang shes bya dag bzhin du de med pa dag kyang tha dad pa kho na'o zhe na 'di ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni grub pa'i mtha'o //
translated: Therefore, just as knowledge and the object of knowledge, so too their nonexistence is only different.

original: 'on kyang dmigs pa med pa nyid med pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang dmigs pa med pa nyid med pa yin no //
translated: But the nonexistence of the object of knowledge is nonexistence.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: dmigs pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe object of knowledge‚Äù is mentioned.

original: gal te ma dmigs pa nyid med pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te ma dmigs pa nyid med pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni yod pa ma yin te /
translated: If you think that non-apprehension itself is non-existence, that is not so.

original: des na ci ltar snang ba mi dmigs pas med pa'i tha snyad sgrub ces dogs na /
analyzed: des na ci ltar snang ba mi dmigs pas med pa'i tha snyad sgrub ces dogs na /
translated: Therefore, how can the convention of non-existence be established by the non-apprehension of what appears?

original: yod pa dang dmigs pa dag de'i bdag nyid du ston pas mi dmigs pa dang med pa dag kyang de'i bdag nyid du brjod pa ni /
analyzed: yod pa dang dmigs pa dag de'i bdag nyid du ston pas mi dmigs pa dang med pa dag kyang de'i bdag nyid du brjod pa ni /
translated: Since existence and apprehension are taught to be of the nature of that, non-apprehension and non-existence are also said to be of the nature of that.

original: de dag gi zhes bya ba ste bltar rung ba rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: de dag gi zhes bya ba ste bltar rung ba rnams kyi'o //
translated: Those are the objects of observation that are suitable to be seen.üîΩHow?

original: ci ltar zhe na /üîΩ'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ci ltar zhe na / 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Thus.

original: las kyi chos su gyur pa'i dmigs pa 'chad pa ni /
analyzed: las kyi chos su gyur pa'i dmigs pa 'chad pa ni /
translated: The explanation of the object of observation that is the quality of the action is

original: 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Thus.

original: de ste zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni byed pa po'i chos bstan to //
analyzed: de ste zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni byed pa po'i chos bstan to //
translated: If, etc. teaches the quality of the agent.

original: khyab pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni yod pa la'o //
analyzed: khyab pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni yod pa la'o //
translated: The pervasion is with respect to existence.

original: gal te las kyi chos @226b dmigs pa yin pa'i phyogs la /
analyzed: gal te las kyi chos @226b dmigs pa yin pa'i phyogs la /
translated: If the position is that the object of observation is the quality of the action,üîΩhow is the object of observation itself existent?

original: ci ltar dmigs pa nyid yod pa yin zhe na de las zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: ci ltar dmigs pa nyid yod pa yin zhe na de las zhes bya ba ste /
translated: From that, etc.

original: las kyi chos su gyur pa'i dmigs pa de las yod pa nyid tha dad pa med na tha dad par rtogs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: las kyi chos su gyur pa'i dmigs pa de las yod pa nyid tha dad pa med na tha dad par rtogs pa ma yin te /
translated: If the object that is the basis of the activity of perception were not different from existence, then it would not be perceived as different.

original: des na dmigs pa nyid yod pa yin no //
analyzed: des na dmigs pa nyid yod pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the object itself exists.

original: 'o na dmigs pa byed pa po'i chos yin pa'i phyogs la ci ltar yod pa dmigs pa nyid yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na dmigs pa byed pa po'i chos yin pa'i phyogs la ci ltar yod pa dmigs pa nyid yin zhe na /
translated: But in the case of the position that the object is a quality of the perceiver, how can existence be the object?

original: des na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: des na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Therefore, it is said, ‚ÄúIf the object is a quality of the perceiver.‚Äù

original: byed pa po'i chos dmigs pa tha dad pa ni mi 'khrul ba'i phyir na yod pa nyid dmigs pa yin no //
analyzed: byed pa po'i chos dmigs pa tha dad pa ni mi 'khrul ba'i phyir na yod pa nyid dmigs pa yin no //
