translated: Since the object, which is a quality of the perceiver, is not mistaken, existence is the object.

original: 'di yang khas blangs nas brjod pa yin no zhes gsungs pa ni tha dad pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di yang khas blangs nas brjod pa yin no zhes gsungs pa ni tha dad pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is also said to be accepted and then refuted.

original: tha dad pa dngos po dang dus mtshungs pa'i dmigs pa gang yin pa des don rnams dmigs pa ni mi srid do //
analyzed: tha dad pa dngos po dang dus mtshungs pa'i dmigs pa gang yin pa des don rnams dmigs pa ni mi srid do //
translated: The object that is simultaneous with the thing and different from it cannot possibly be the object of perception.

original: 'on ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: 'on ji ltar zhe na /
translated: But how is that?

original: 'on kyang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is said, ‚ÄúBut if the object is not different from the perceiver.‚Äù

original: dngos po der rjes su chud pa dmigs par bya ba'i las kyi chos su gyur pa gang yin pa de'i mtshan nyid kyi dmigs pa las don rnams dmigs pa yin no //
analyzed: dngos po der rjes su chud pa dmigs par bya ba'i las kyi chos su gyur pa gang yin pa de'i mtshan nyid kyi dmigs pa las don rnams dmigs pa yin no //
translated: The object is the object of the activity of the object of observation, which is the thing that is observed in the subsequent cognition.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar yod pa dang dmigs pa dag de'i bdag nyid yin pa de'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar yod pa dang dmigs pa dag de'i bdag nyid yin pa de'i phyir ro //
translated: The reason is that existence and observation are of the same nature.

original: 'dis ni de la'ang dmigs rung rnams kyi ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni de la'ang dmigs rung rnams kyi ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa bshad pa yin no //
translated: This explains the passage, ‚ÄúThose that are suitable to be observed in that . . .‚Äù

original: de las ni zhes bya ba ni yod pa dang dmigs pa dag de'i bdag nyid yin pa las so //
analyzed: de las ni zhes bya ba ni yod pa dang dmigs pa dag de'i bdag nyid yin pa las so //
translated: ‚ÄúFrom that‚Äù means from the fact that existence and observation are of the same nature.

original: de mi dmigs pa zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa rnam pa gnyis kyis dmigs pa med pa nyid do //
analyzed: de mi dmigs pa zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa rnam pa gnyis kyis dmigs pa med pa nyid do //
translated: ‚ÄúNonobservation of that‚Äù means the nonexistence of observation by the two kinds of observation.

original: 'dis ni dmigs par bya ba med pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni dmigs par bya ba med pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa bshad pa yin no //
translated: This explains the passage, ‚ÄúThe nonexistence of the object of observation . . .‚Äù

original: gal te shes pa dang shes bya dag de'i bdag nyid yin yang de med pa dag ci ltar 'di'i bdag nyid yin zhe na /
analyzed: gal te shes pa dang shes bya dag de'i bdag nyid yin yang de med pa dag ci ltar 'di'i bdag nyid yin zhe na /
translated: If cognition and the cognized are of the same nature, how can they be nonexistent?

original: dngos po med pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dngos po med pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The passage ‚ÄúThe nonexistence of the object of observation . . .‚Äù

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: dngos po tha dad pas zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dngos po tha dad pas zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Because of the difference of entity.

original: khyad par bum pa dang snam bu la sogs pa'i dngos po rnams tha dad pas dngos po med pa rnams tha dad pa yin no //
analyzed: khyad par bum pa dang snam bu la sogs pa'i dngos po rnams tha dad pas dngos po med pa rnams tha dad pa yin no //
translated: The difference of non-entity is due to the difference of entity, such as the pot and cloth, etc.

original: de nyid ces bya ba ni tha dad pa nyid do //
analyzed: de nyid ces bya ba ni tha dad pa nyid do //
translated: That itself is the difference.

original: khyad par dngos po tha dad pas dngos po med pa tha dad pa na khas blangs nas brjod pa yin gyi 'di yang yod pa ma yin no zhes brjod pa ni /
analyzed: khyad par dngos po tha dad pas dngos po med pa tha dad pa na khas blangs nas brjod pa yin gyi 'di yang yod pa ma yin no zhes brjod pa ni /
translated: If the difference of non-entity is due to the difference of entity, then the difference of non-entity is accepted and stated, but this is not existent.

original: bum pa dang snam bu med pa dag gi khyad par ni dngos po med pa las ldog pas bum pa dang snam bu dag gcig yin pa'i phyir na gcig kho na'o //
analyzed: bum pa dang snam bu med pa dag gi khyad par ni dngos po med pa las ldog pas bum pa dang snam bu dag gcig yin pa'i phyir na gcig kho na'o //
translated: The difference of the non-existence of the pot and cloth is the opposite of non-entity, because the pot and cloth are one, therefore, it is only one.

original: des cir 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: des cir 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What is the consequence of that?

original: des na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: des na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Therefore, it is said.

original: khyad par @227a * //
analyzed: khyad par @227a * //
translated: The differenceüîΩis one. Because of the difference of entity, the difference of non-entity is accepted and stated, but this is not existent.üîΩIf the difference of non-entity is due to the difference of entity, then the difference of non-entity is accepted and stated, but this is not existent.

original: gcig yin pa'i phyir na bum pa dang snam bu ldog pa'i sgo nas gcig nyid du gyur pa dag gis dngos po med pa gang yin pa de dag kyang gcig kho na'o //
analyzed: gcig yin pa'i phyir na bum pa dang snam bu ldog pa'i sgo nas gcig nyid du gyur pa dag gis dngos po med pa gang yin pa de dag kyang gcig kho na'o //
translated: The difference of the non-existence of the pot and cloth is the opposite of non-entity, because the pot and cloth are one, therefore, it is only one.

original: de ltar dngos po gnyis tha mi dad pas na /
analyzed: de ltar dngos po gnyis tha mi dad pas na /
translated: Thus, since the two things are not different,

original: de dag med pa dag kyang tha mi dad par bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag med pa dag kyang tha mi dad par bstan pa yin no //
translated: their non-existence is also taught to be not different.

original: yang na dngos po gnyis tha dad pa yin du chug pa de lta na yang de dag gi dngos po med pa dag ni tha dad pa ma yin no zhes brjod ba ni /
analyzed: yang na dngos po gnyis tha dad pa yin du chug pa de lta na yang de dag gi dngos po med pa dag ni tha dad pa ma yin no zhes brjod ba ni /
translated: Or, even if the two things are different, their non-existence is not different.

original: don dam par ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: don dam par ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is what is meant by ‚Äúultimately.‚Äù

original: des ni mi dmigs pa nyid med pa ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: des ni mi dmigs pa nyid med pa ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di gnas pa yin no //
translated: This is the position that non-apprehension itself is not non-existence.

original: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rtsod par don 'di yin te /
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rtsod par don 'di yin te /
translated: The point of the argument beginning with ‚ÄúIf‚Äù is this:

original: gal te bum pa med par sa gzhi la sogs pa yod pa nyid yin la mi dmigs pa yang sa gzhi'i rang bzhin yin na de'i tshe med pa mngon sum nyid kyis grub pa'i phyir na snang ba mi dmigs pa don med do zhes bya ba yin no
analyzed: gal te bum pa med par sa gzhi la sogs pa yod pa nyid yin la mi dmigs pa yang sa gzhi'i rang bzhin yin na de'i tshe med pa mngon sum nyid kyis grub pa'i phyir na snang ba mi dmigs pa don med do zhes bya ba yin no
translated: If the ground, etc. exist without the pot, and non-apprehension is also the nature of the ground, then since non-existence is established by direct perception, the non-apprehension of appearance is pointless.

original: // dngos po med pa la log par rtogs pa med pa nyid de /
analyzed: // dngos po med pa la log par rtogs pa med pa nyid de /
translated: There is no misconception about non-existence.

original: mngon sum gyis grub pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon sum gyis grub pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is established by direct perception.

original: mi shes zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin mi dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid ni med pa nyid yin no zhes mi shes pa /
analyzed: mi shes zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin mi dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid ni med pa nyid yin no zhes mi shes pa /
translated: As for ‚Äúignorance,‚Äù the characteristic of the non-apprehension of intrinsic nature is non-existence.

original: gang yin pa'i mi shes pa dang mi dmigs pa nyid med pa yin no zhes shes par bya ba'i phyir mi dmigs pa ste rang bzhin mi dmigs pa'i dpe gcig 'dod pa yin no //
analyzed: gang yin pa'i mi shes pa dang mi dmigs pa nyid med pa yin no zhes shes par bya ba'i phyir mi dmigs pa ste rang bzhin mi dmigs pa'i dpe gcig 'dod pa yin no //
translated: In order to understand that very ignorance and non-apprehension are non-existence, he accepts one example of non-apprehension, namely, the non-apprehension of intrinsic nature.

original: 'di nyid brjod pa ni gang zhig ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di nyid brjod pa ni gang zhig ces bya ba'o //
translated: This is what is being said:

original: rgol ba gzhan brjod pa ni grangs can zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rgol ba gzhan brjod pa ni grangs can zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The opponent‚Äôs statement is ‚ÄúThe SƒÅ·πÉkhya says . . .‚Äù

original: shes par bya ba'i don du zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: shes par bya ba'i don du zhes bya ba ni /
translated: ‚ÄúIn order to understand‚Äù means

original: gal te shes pa dang shes bya med pa dag tha mi dad par rtogs na /
analyzed: gal te shes pa dang shes bya med pa dag tha mi dad par rtogs na /
translated: if one understands that the absence of cognition and the cognized are not different,

original: de'i tshe de bstan pa don med de zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de'i tshe de bstan pa don med de zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: then at that time, the teaching of that is pointless. This is the meaning.

original: gal te yong ba dang dmigs pa dag tha mi dad na /
analyzed: gal te yong ba dang dmigs pa dag tha mi dad na /
translated: If the cognized and the apprehension are not different,

original: 'o na mi dmigs pa der bsgrub par bya ba ci zhig yin zhes bya ba ni dri ba'o //
analyzed: 'o na mi dmigs pa der bsgrub par bya ba ci zhig yin zhes bya ba ni dri ba'o //
translated: then what is the object to be established in that non-apprehension? This is the question.

original: lan ni yul zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lan ni yul zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The answer is: the object.

original: bum pa la sogs pa yod pa ni yul yin la /
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa yod pa ni yul yin la /
translated: The existence of a pot, etc. is the object.

original: shes pa dang sgra ni yul can yin no //
analyzed: shes pa dang sgra ni yul can yin no //
translated: Consciousness and speech are the subjects.

original: bum pa la sogs pa yod par the tshom za ba ni yul yin la /
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa yod par the tshom za ba ni yul yin la /
translated: The existence of a pot, etc. is the object.

original: the tshom za ba'i shes pa dang brjod pa dag ni yul can yin te /
analyzed: the tshom za ba'i shes pa dang brjod pa dag ni yul can yin te /
translated: The doubting consciousness and the expression of doubt are the subjects.

original: yul de med pas nges par mi dmigs pa der yul can shes pa la sogs pa 'gog pa yin te /
analyzed: yul de med pas nges par mi dmigs pa der yul can shes pa la sogs pa 'gog pa yin te /
translated: The object is not perceived because it does not exist. The subject, consciousness, etc. is refuted.

original: de ltar de dgag pa bsgrub par bya ba yin no //üîΩmi snang ba mi dmigs pa la ni /
analyzed: de ltar de dgag pa bsgrub par bya ba yin no // mi snang ba mi dmigs pa la ni /
translated: Thus, the negation of that is the probandum.üîΩAs for non-perception, the existence of a definite convention is refuted.

original: nges pa yod pa'i tha snyad nyid 'gog pa yin gyi the tshom @227b ni ma yin la gzhan du ni 'di mtha' dag 'gog pa yin no zhes sngar brjod zin to //
analyzed: nges pa yod pa'i tha snyad nyid 'gog pa yin gyi the tshom @227b ni ma yin la gzhan du ni 'di mtha' dag 'gog pa yin no zhes sngar brjod zin to //
translated: But doubt is not, and elsewhere this entire [process] is refuted. This was stated earlier.

original: ci dang 'dra bar zhe na dper na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ci dang 'dra bar zhe na dper na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: What is it like? It is like this.

original: sreg par byed pa rtogs pas ni shes pa dang brjod pa'i mtshan nyid me'i tha snyad du nges pa 'jug par byed pa yin la /
analyzed: sreg par byed pa rtogs pas ni shes pa dang brjod pa'i mtshan nyid me'i tha snyad du nges pa 'jug par byed pa yin la /
translated: The realization of the burner causes the definite engagement of the convention of fire, which has the characteristic of consciousness and speech.

original: the tshom za bas ni the tshom za ba yin no //
analyzed: the tshom za bas ni the tshom za ba yin no //
translated: and when there is doubt, there is doubt.

original: me de med na ni me'i tha snyad mtha' dag 'gog pa bzhin no //
analyzed: me de med na ni me'i tha snyad mtha' dag 'gog pa bzhin no //
translated: just as when there is no fire, all the conventions of fire are stopped.

original: yang 'dir yul ci 'dra ba zhig yin par 'dod cing /
analyzed: yang 'dir yul ci 'dra ba zhig yin par 'dod cing /
translated: Moreover, what sort of object is it that is accepted here?

original: 'di yang gang zhig yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'di yang gang zhig yin zhe na /
translated: And what is this?

original: shes pa dang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: shes pa dang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: consciousness, etc.

original: de dag tu the tshom za ba zhes bya ba ni yul la the tshom za ba ni yul yin no zhes skabs su bab pa'o //
analyzed: de dag tu the tshom za ba zhes bya ba ni yul la the tshom za ba ni yul yin no zhes skabs su bab pa'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúdoubt about them‚Äù means that the object is doubt about the object.

original: shes brjod the tshom za ba dag ni yul yin no //
analyzed: shes brjod the tshom za ba dag ni yul yin no //
translated: The object is consciousness, expression, and doubt.

original: gal te de ltar yin mod de lta na yang ci ltar yul can 'gog ce na /
analyzed: gal te de ltar yin mod de lta na yang ci ltar yul can 'gog ce na /
translated: Even if this is so, how can the object be refuted?

original: yul zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: yul zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The object is that which is to be known.

original: gang gis shes pa la sogs pa 'gog pa de'i yul ci ltar med ce na /
analyzed: gang gis shes pa la sogs pa 'gog pa de'i yul ci ltar med ce na /
translated: How can the object be nonexistent when consciousness, etc. are refuted?

original: bzlog pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: bzlog pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe negation of that‚Äù refers to the object.

original: dpe rnam par 'grel pa ni dper na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dpe rnam par 'grel pa ni dper na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The example is given in the phrase ‚Äúfor example.‚Äù

original: ci ltar 'di the tshom za ba'i me 'gog ce na /
analyzed: ci ltar 'di the tshom za ba'i me 'gog ce na /
translated: How is it that doubt about fire is refuted?

original: phyogs gzhan du zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: phyogs gzhan du zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúin another place‚Äù refers to the example.

original: sreg par byed pa med pa'i phyogs las gzhan ni phyogs te /
analyzed: sreg par byed pa med pa'i phyogs las gzhan ni phyogs te /
translated: The other side is the side that is not the burning,

original: sreg par byed pa yod pa ste der gyur pa'o //
analyzed: sreg par byed pa yod pa ste der gyur pa'o //
translated: that is, the side that is the burning.üîΩIf there were doubt about the burning,

original: sreg pa la the tshom du gyur na zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sreg pa la the tshom du gyur na zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: the meaning is that if there were doubt about the fire.

original: mer the tshom za ba zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mer the tshom za ba zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Doubt about the fire is

original: ci 'di me'am 'on te me ma yin zhes me'i tha snyad la the tshom za ba'o //
analyzed: ci 'di me'am 'on te me ma yin zhes me'i tha snyad la the tshom za ba'o //
translated: doubt about the convention ‚Äúfire,‚Äù thinking ‚ÄúIs this fire or is it not fire?‚ÄùüîΩIf that does not exist,

original: de med na ni zhes bya ba ni phyogs gzhan du gyur pa'i sreg par byed pa yod pa med na ni ldog pa nges pa'i sreg par byed pa med pa yod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de med na ni zhes bya ba ni phyogs gzhan du gyur pa'i sreg par byed pa yod pa med na ni ldog pa nges pa'i sreg par byed pa med pa yod pa'i phyir /
translated: that is, if the other side, the existence of the burning, does not exist, then the existence of the non-burning, which is the ascertainment of the negation, would be possible.

original: the tshom za ba'i me'i tha snyad de srid pa la 'gyur te mi 'gyur ba kho na'o //
analyzed: the tshom za ba'i me'i tha snyad de srid pa la 'gyur te mi 'gyur ba kho na'o //
translated: But the convention of doubt about the fire would not be possible.

original: ci'i phyir tha snyad dgag pa bsgrub kyi me med pa ni ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir tha snyad dgag pa bsgrub kyi me med pa ni ma yin zhe na /
translated: Why is the negation of the convention established, but not the non-existence of fire?

original: 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is like this.

original: de ltar snang ba mi dmigs pa la yod pa'i tha snyad dgag pa'i 'bras bu rnam pa gnyis brjod nas da ni med pa dang mi dmigs pa dag de'i bdag nyid du brjod pa sngon du 'gro ba can med pa'i tha snyad kyi 'bras bu can nyid du
analyzed: de ltar snang ba mi dmigs pa la yod pa'i tha snyad dgag pa'i 'bras bu rnam pa gnyis brjod nas da ni med pa dang mi dmigs pa dag de'i bdag nyid du brjod pa sngon du 'gro ba can med pa'i tha snyad kyi 'bras bu can nyid du
translated: Having thus described the two effects of the negation of the term existence in the non-apprehension of such appearance, now, the effect of the term non-existence is taught as having the non-apprehension of that as its antecedent:

original: bstan pa ni ci ltar zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: bstan pa ni ci ltar zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúHow?‚Äù

original: sreg byed ma yin pa las me med pa gzhan ni ma yin gyi /üîΩ'on kyang sreg par byed pa med pa nyid me ma yin pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: sreg byed ma yin pa las me med pa gzhan ni ma yin gyi / 'on kyang sreg par byed pa med pa nyid me ma yin pa de bzhin du /
translated: Fire is not other than the non-burner.üîΩHowever, the non-existence of the burner is not fire.

original: dmigs su rung ba'i med pa yang mi dmigs pa las gzhan ma yin gyi /
analyzed: dmigs su rung ba'i med pa yang mi dmigs pa las gzhan ma yin gyi /
translated: Likewise, the non-existence of the apprehensible is not other than the non-apprehension.

original: 'on kyang mi dmigs pa nyid med pa yin no //üîΩde yod pa las te /
analyzed: 'on kyang mi dmigs pa nyid med pa yin no // de yod pa las te /
translated: However, the non-apprehension itself is the non-existence.

original: mi dmigs pa yod pa las de'i @228a * //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa yod pa las de'i @228a * //
translated: That exists from the non-apprehension.

original: rgyu mtshan can med pa'i shes pa dang / sgra mi dmigs pa'i rgyu mtshan can sgrub par byed pa yin gyi /
analyzed: rgyu mtshan can med pa'i shes pa dang / sgra mi dmigs pa'i rgyu mtshan can sgrub par byed pa yin gyi /
translated: From the existence of the non-apprehension, the cognition of non-existence having that as its reason and the proof having the non-apprehension of sound as its reason exist.

original: dngos po med pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dngos po med pa ni ma yin no //
translated: However, the non-existence of the thing does not exist.

original: chad pa ni dmigs pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: chad pa ni dmigs pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe non-apprehension of that‚Äù refers to the object.

original: de zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa grub na'o //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa grub na'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúif that is established‚Äù refers to the object.

original: de bdag nyid ces bya ba ni mi dmigs pa'i ngo bo nyid do //üîΩde'i bdag nyid ma yin par dogs pa bsu ba ni /
analyzed: de bdag nyid ces bya ba ni mi dmigs pa'i ngo bo nyid do // de'i bdag nyid ma yin par dogs pa bsu ba ni /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúin the nature of that‚Äù refers to the nature of non-apprehension.

original: gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúif it is doubted that it is not in the nature of that‚Äù introduces the doubt.

original: lan ni bsgrub bya sgrub par byed pa'i rtags de nyid med pa dang mi dmigs pa 'dir ro //
analyzed: lan ni bsgrub bya sgrub par byed pa'i rtags de nyid med pa dang mi dmigs pa 'dir ro //
translated: The response is that the reason that proves the probandum is the absence of that and the non-apprehension of that.

original: 'on te ma grub pa las kyang bsgrub bya 'grub bo zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te ma grub pa las kyang bsgrub bya 'grub bo zhe na /
translated: But if the probandum is established even though the reason is not established, then the probandum would be established by a reason that is not established.

original: ma grub pa bsgrub par bya ba nyid du 'dod pa'i du ma nyid ni ma grub pas zhes bya ba bsgrub par bya ba sgrub pa'i mtshan nyid kyis rtags ma grub pa'i 'grub par 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: ma grub pa bsgrub par bya ba nyid du 'dod pa'i du ma nyid ni ma grub pas zhes bya ba bsgrub par bya ba sgrub pa'i mtshan nyid kyis rtags ma grub pa'i 'grub par 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: The reason is not established because the property to be established, the plurality of the non-established, is not established. The reason is not established because it does not have the characteristic of a property of the probandum.

original: ci ltar na rtags bsgrub bya sgrub par byed pa nyid ma grub ce na /
analyzed: ci ltar na rtags bsgrub bya sgrub par byed pa nyid ma grub ce na /
translated: How is it that the reason is not established as the property of the probandum?

original: med pa dang mi dmigs pa 'di la ni de'i bdag nyid khas mi len na 'brel pa med pa kho na'o //
analyzed: med pa dang mi dmigs pa 'di la ni de'i bdag nyid khas mi len na 'brel pa med pa kho na'o //
translated: In this case, the absence of that and the non-apprehension of that do not have the nature of that. Therefore, they are unrelated.

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'brel pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'brel pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúTherefore‚Äù means because there is no connection.

original: de zhes bya ba bsgrub bya bsgrub pa nyid ma grub ba'o //üîΩbsgrub par bya ba zhes bya ba la sogs pas rtsod pa rjes su brjod nas /
analyzed: de zhes bya ba bsgrub bya bsgrub pa nyid ma grub ba'o // bsgrub par bya ba zhes bya ba la sogs pas rtsod pa rjes su brjod nas /
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù refers to the unestablished proof of the probandum.üîΩHaving restated the objection beginning with ‚Äúthe probandum,‚Äù

original: de nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa rnam par 'grel par lan 'debs pa ni bsgrub par bya ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa rnam par 'grel par lan 'debs pa ni bsgrub par bya ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: the response is stated in the commentary beginning with ‚Äúthat,‚Äù which is ‚Äúthe probandum‚Äù and so on.

original: de bzhin du zhes bya ba ni bsgrub bya sgrub par byed pa'i rtags kyis so //
analyzed: de bzhin du zhes bya ba ni bsgrub bya sgrub par byed pa'i rtags kyis so //
translated: ‚ÄúIn the same way‚Äù means by the reason that proves the probandum.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /üîΩma grub pa ni zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na / ma grub pa ni zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Why is that?

original: tha dad pa nyid do //
analyzed: tha dad pa nyid do //
translated: ‚ÄúBecause of the unestablished‚Äù means because of the difference.

original: ma grub pas zhes bya ba ni bsgrub bya sgrub par byed pas so //
analyzed: ma grub pas zhes bya ba ni bsgrub bya sgrub par byed pas so //
translated: ‚ÄúThe unestablished‚Äù means the probandum.

original: bsgrub par bya ba las sgrub byed grub na phan tshun rten pa'i nyes pa brjod pa ni ci srid du zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba las sgrub byed grub na phan tshun rten pa'i nyes pa brjod pa ni ci srid du zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If the proof is established from the probandum, the error of mutual dependence is stated.

original: 'o na ci ltar bsgrub bya sgrub byed kyi dngos po 'grub ce na /
analyzed: 'o na ci ltar bsgrub bya sgrub byed kyi dngos po 'grub ce na /
translated: But how is the nature of the probandum and the proof established?

original: bsgrub bya sgrub byed kyi zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: bsgrub bya sgrub byed kyi zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe object of attainment and the means of attainment‚Äù is the object of attainment and the means of attainment.

original: 'on te de'i bdag nyid las gzhan pa'i 'brel pa yod pa nyid do zhes dogs na de nyid 'dir ni ma grub ste zhes bya ba rnam par 'grel te /
analyzed: 'on te de'i bdag nyid las gzhan pa'i 'brel pa yod pa nyid do zhes dogs na de nyid 'dir ni ma grub ste zhes bya ba rnam par 'grel te /
translated: But if you think that there is a relation that is different from the nature of those two, then ‚Äúthat itself is not established here‚Äù is explained.

original: brjod pa ni mi dmigs pa dang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: brjod pa ni mi dmigs pa dang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe expression‚Äù is ‚Äúnon-apprehension.‚Äù

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de dag ces bya ba ste /
analyzed: de dag ces bya ba ste /
translated: ‚ÄúThose‚Äù

original: mi dmigs pa dang med pa dag go //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa dang med pa dag go //
translated: are non-apprehension and non-existence.

original: gal te zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If is as follows.üîΩ

original: gal te dngos po med par shes pa yin na zhes 'brel to //
analyzed: gal te dngos po med par shes pa yin na zhes 'brel to //
translated: is connected to ‚Äúif it is the cognition of non-existence.‚Äù

original: gang gis zhe na /
analyzed: gang gis zhe na /
translated: By what?

original: mi dmigs pa las gzhan pa'i tshad mas so //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa las gzhan pa'i tshad mas so //
translated: By a valid cognition other than non-apprehension.

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba dngos po med pa tshad ma gzhan gyis @228b shes pa'i phyir dngos po med pa dang ngo //
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba dngos po med pa tshad ma gzhan gyis @228b shes pa'i phyir dngos po med pa dang ngo //
translated: ‚ÄúTherefore‚Äù means that because non-existence is cognized by another valid cognition, non-existence is cognized by another valid cognition.

original: gzhan du zhes bya ba ni gal te 'grel pa grub pa'i don du mi dmigs pa kho nas dngos po med pa shes pa yin na'o //
analyzed: gzhan du zhes bya ba ni gal te 'grel pa grub pa'i don du mi dmigs pa kho nas dngos po med pa shes pa yin na'o //
translated: ‚ÄúOtherwise‚Äù means that if non-apprehension alone cognizes non-existence for the purpose of establishing the commentary, then non-existence is cognized by non-apprehension alone.

original: gal te yang phan tshun rten pa nyid kyis gnyi ga rab tu ma grub pa de ltan yang /
analyzed: gal te yang phan tshun rten pa nyid kyis gnyi ga rab tu ma grub pa de ltan yang /
translated: But if neither is established by mutual dependence,üîΩthen the effect of that which has the characteristic of mutual understanding would be established.

original: phan tshun rtogs pa'i mtshan nyid de'i 'bras bu ni grub par 'gyur ro zhes dogs pa ni de nyid kyi phyir na zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: phan tshun rtogs pa'i mtshan nyid de'i 'bras bu ni grub par 'gyur ro zhes dogs pa ni de nyid kyi phyir na zhes gsungs te /
translated: The response to this qualm is ‚ÄúBecause of that,‚Äù

original: ma grub pa nyid kyi phyir na'o //
analyzed: ma grub pa nyid kyi phyir na'o //
translated: because they are not established.

original: phan tshun gyis byas pa'i 'bras bu 'grub pa ma yin te skye ba ma yin no //
analyzed: phan tshun gyis byas pa'i 'bras bu 'grub pa ma yin te skye ba ma yin no //
translated: The effect that is mutually created is not established, it does not arise.

original: de phyir de ma yin zhes bya ba rnam par 'grel pa ni /
analyzed: de phyir de ma yin zhes bya ba rnam par 'grel pa ni /
translated: Therefore, the commentary states, ‚ÄúIt is not that.‚Äù

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúBecause of that‚Äù is the reason.

original: 'on te de'i bdag nyid kyi 'grel pa khas len na /
analyzed: 'on te de'i bdag nyid kyi 'grel pa khas len na /
translated: But if you accept that it is an effect that has the same nature,

original: de'i tshe de'i bdag nyid kyis zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe de'i bdag nyid kyis zhes bya ba'o //
translated: then it is an effect that has the same nature.

original: 'di srid kyis rnam 'grel gyi phyed snga ma bshad nas /
analyzed: 'di srid kyis rnam 'grel gyi phyed snga ma bshad nas /
translated: Having explained the first half of the commentary on the thirty-second chapter,

original: phyed phyi ma 'chad pa ni phyir tha snyad bsgrub bar bya ba yin no zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: phyed phyi ma 'chad pa ni phyir tha snyad bsgrub bar bya ba yin no zhes bya ba'o //
translated: the second half is explained in order to establish the conventional.

original: 'chad par 'gyur ba'i rtsod pa zhe khongs la bzhag nas gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: 'chad par 'gyur ba'i rtsod pa zhe khongs la bzhag nas gsungs pa ni /
translated: Having set forth the qualm that will be explained, he says,

original: snang ba zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: snang ba zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚Äúappearance‚Äù is the name.

original: ci ltar 'di der nges pa yin te /
analyzed: ci ltar 'di der nges pa yin te /
translated: How is it ascertained in that way?üîΩBecause there is no awareness, etc.

original: blo dang bral ba la sogs pa yang yod pa'i phyir ro zhe na gang gi phyir bltar rung ba ma mthong ba de'i 'bras bu yin yang /
analyzed: blo dang bral ba la sogs pa yang yod pa'i phyir ro zhe na gang gi phyir bltar rung ba ma mthong ba de'i 'bras bu yin yang /
translated: Even though it is the effect of not seeing what is suitable to be seen,

original: blo sgra the tshom med de nges pa yin no //
analyzed: blo sgra the tshom med de nges pa yin no //
translated: there is no doubt that awareness is ascertained.

original: ci ltar de la de dag nges she na snang ba ma mthong na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ci ltar de la de dag nges she na snang ba ma mthong na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: How are they ascertained in that way? ‚ÄúIf there is no seeing of the appearance.‚Äù

original: des na de'i 'bras bu yin yang de dag nges par 'grub bo //
analyzed: des na de'i 'bras bu yin yang de dag nges par 'grub bo //
translated: Therefore, even though it is the effect of that, they are ascertained.

original: de nyid kyi phyir med pa'i tha snyad kyi yul du rung ba nyid ni mi dmigs pa'i rang bzhin nyid kyis 'grub pa yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir med pa'i tha snyad kyi yul du rung ba nyid ni mi dmigs pa'i rang bzhin nyid kyis 'grub pa yin no //
translated: For that very reason, the suitability of being the object of the convention of non-existence is established by the nature of non-apprehension.

original: rtsod pa gzhan brjod pa ni tha snyad kyang zhes bya ba'o /
analyzed: rtsod pa gzhan brjod pa ni tha snyad kyang zhes bya ba'o /
translated: The statement of another objection is ‚ÄúEven though there is a convention.‚Äù

original: lhur bya ba'i don gyis rtsa ba rnam par 'grel pas lan brjod pa ni /üîΩ'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lhur bya ba'i don gyis rtsa ba rnam par 'grel pas lan brjod pa ni / 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The response, which is an explanation of the root text, is ‚ÄúBecause of the meaning of the primary.‚Äù

original: rtsod pa gnyis pa la brjod pa ni /
analyzed: rtsod pa gnyis pa la brjod pa ni /
translated: The statement of the second objection is ‚ÄúIf it is not seen.‚Äù

original: de tsam gyi zhes bya ba ste mi dmigs pa tsam gyi rgyu mtshan gyis so //
analyzed: de tsam gyi zhes bya ba ste mi dmigs pa tsam gyi rgyu mtshan gyis so //
translated: The reason is ‚Äúmerely that,‚Äù i.e., merely the non-apprehension.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: rung ba nyid ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rung ba nyid ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúBecause of the possibility.‚Äù

original: gal te mi dmigs pa yod kyang 'ga' zhig tha snyad mi 'jug pa kho na ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te mi dmigs pa yod kyang 'ga' zhig tha snyad mi 'jug pa kho na ma yin nam /
translated: If there is non-apprehension, is it not the case that one does not engage in verbal activity at all?

original: des na ci ltar de la bltos te rung ba nyid mi dmigs pa'i rang bzhin yin zhe na /
analyzed: des na ci ltar de la bltos te rung ba nyid mi dmigs pa'i rang bzhin yin zhe na /
translated: So how can the possibility be based on that, and be of the nature of non-apprehension?

original: sems dang ldan pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: sems dang ldan pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúOne who has a mind‚Äù

original: de zhes bya ba ni snang ba mi dmigs pa mthong ba las so //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni snang ba mi dmigs pa mthong ba las so //
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù refers to the seeing of the non-apprehension of appearance.

original: gal te lus dang ngag gis tha snyad 'jug par mi byed pa ci ltar yid kyi tha snyad 'jug par byed ce na dngos po med pa'i zhes bya ba'o //üîΩci @229a * //
analyzed: gal te lus dang ngag gis tha snyad 'jug par mi byed pa ci ltar yid kyi tha snyad 'jug par byed ce na dngos po med pa'i zhes bya ba'o // ci @229a * //
translated: If one does not engage in verbal activity by means of body and speech, how does one engage in verbal activity by means of mind? ‚ÄúBecause of the non-existence of the object.‚ÄùüîΩHow is it that one does not engage in verbal activity by means of body and speech?

original: ltar de gnyis mi 'jug na de la mi dmigs pa ci ltar tshad ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ltar de gnyis mi 'jug na de la mi dmigs pa ci ltar tshad ma yin zhe na /
translated: If one does not engage in verbal activity by means of body and speech, how is the non-apprehension of that a valid cognition?

original: tshad ma ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: tshad ma ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúA valid cognition‚Äù

original: rtogs pa ste med par shes ba sgrub pas yin gyi /
analyzed: rtogs pa ste med par shes ba sgrub pas yin gyi /
translated: is an understanding, a cognition of non-existence, because of the establishment of that.

original: lus la sogs pa'i tha snyad sgrub pas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: lus la sogs pa'i tha snyad sgrub pas ni ma yin no //
translated: but not by the establishment of the conventions of body, etc.

original: de'i phyir de la yang mi dmigs pa'i rang bzhin gyi rung ba grub pa kho na'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir de la yang mi dmigs pa'i rang bzhin gyi rung ba grub pa kho na'o //
translated: Therefore, in that case, too, the suitability of the nature of non-apprehension is established.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar mi dmigs ba med pa'i tha snyad du rung ba nyid la mi 'khrul par grub pa de'i phyir snang ba mi dmigs pa'i bdag nyid can gyi yul yod na yang rmongs pas 'jim gong la sogs pa 'dir rtogs par bya ba med pa'i
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar mi dmigs ba med pa'i tha snyad du rung ba nyid la mi 'khrul par grub pa de'i phyir snang ba mi dmigs pa'i bdag nyid can gyi yul yod na yang rmongs pas 'jim gong la sogs pa 'dir rtogs par bya ba med pa'i
translated: Since thus the suitability of the convention of non-apprehension is established without error, therefore, even when the object is of the nature of the non-apprehension of appearance, the ignorant do not engage in the convention of non-existence, etc., with regard to this clay lump, etc., which is to be understood.

original: tha snyad la sogs pa 'jug par mi byed pa mi brjod dag la brda dran par byed pa 'ba' zhig go //
analyzed: tha snyad la sogs pa 'jug par mi byed pa mi brjod dag la brda dran par byed pa 'ba' zhig go //
translated: They do not make the convention, they do not speak, they merely recall the sign.

original: ci 'dra ba zhig 'jig rten na snang du rung ba las mi dmigs pas na med pa'i tha snyad kyi yul du sgrub pa dang / gang la khyod kyis kyang med pa'i tha snyad byas pa de dang 'di 'dra ba yin te /
analyzed: ci 'dra ba zhig 'jig rten na snang du rung ba las mi dmigs pas na med pa'i tha snyad kyi yul du sgrub pa dang / gang la khyod kyis kyang med pa'i tha snyad byas pa de dang 'di 'dra ba yin te /
translated: What is it like? It is like that which is suitable to appear in the world, but is not apprehended, and is thus established as the object of the convention of non-existence. It is like that which you also call non-existent.

original: des na 'di grub pa'i yul dang / chos mthun pa las 'dir yang med pa'i tha snyad kyi yul la zhugs shig zhes so //
analyzed: des na 'di grub pa'i yul dang / chos mthun pa las 'dir yang med pa'i tha snyad kyi yul la zhugs shig zhes so //
translated: Therefore, having entered into the object of the convention of non-existence in accordance with the object established by that, here also, one should enter into the object of the convention of non-existence.

original: bsdu ba'o zhes bya ba ni rgyu mtshan can gyi sgra shes grub ces bya ba de'i'o //
analyzed: bsdu ba'o zhes bya ba ni rgyu mtshan can gyi sgra shes grub ces bya ba de'i'o //
translated: The word collection is of that [word] established by cognition which is a word with a reason.

original: ci dang 'dra bar med pa'i tha snyad bsgrub ce na /
analyzed: ci dang 'dra bar med pa'i tha snyad bsgrub ce na /
translated: In what way is the convention of non-existence established?

original: ci ltar zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ci ltar zhes bya ba'o //
translated: As it is said, how?.

original: 'o na ci ltar don tha dad pa med par sgra tha dad du 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci ltar don tha dad pa med par sgra tha dad du 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Then, how can there be a different word for a non-different meaning?

original: de gnyis la ni zhes bya ba'o //üîΩgal te rgyu dang 'bras bu nyid ni rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag las gzhan kho na ma yin nam /
analyzed: de gnyis la ni zhes bya ba'o // gal te rgyu dang 'bras bu nyid ni rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag las gzhan kho na ma yin nam /
translated: As it is said, in those two.

original: de ci ltar na de'i tha snyad bsgrub pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: de ci ltar na de'i tha snyad bsgrub pa yin zhe na /
translated: If causality is not just the positive and negative concomitance, then how is the convention of that established?

original: mthong ba dang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mthong ba dang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: As it is said, by seeing.

original: 'di'i 'bras bu zhes pa'i sgras ni don 'di brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di'i 'bras bu zhes pa'i sgras ni don 'di brjod pa yin te /
translated: By the word its effect, this meaning is expressed:

original: 'di med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: without this, etc.

original: de ltar gyur na zhes bya ba ni de med kyang yod par gyur na'o //
analyzed: de ltar gyur na zhes bya ba ni de med kyang yod par gyur na'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIf it were so‚Äù means if it existed even though it does not exist.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i mtshan nyid can gyi 'brel pa gzhan don med de /
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i mtshan nyid can gyi 'brel pa gzhan don med de /
translated: There is no other relation that has the character of cause and effect,

original: me med kyang 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: me med kyang 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would occur even when fire does not exist.

original: de ltar yin na zhes bya ba ni de med par 'byung ba yin na'o //
analyzed: de ltar yin na zhes bya ba ni de med par 'byung ba yin na'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIf it were so‚Äù means if it occurred even when that does not exist.

original: de nyid ces bya ba ni ldog pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid ces bya ba ni ldog pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThat itself‚Äù means the negation.

original: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rtsod pa la don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rtsod pa la don ni 'di yin te /
translated: The argument beginning with ‚ÄúIf‚Äù means the following:

original: gnyis la gnas pa'i 'brel pa gzhan yod na de med na med la /
analyzed: gnyis la gnas pa'i 'brel pa gzhan yod na de med na med la /
translated: If there were another relation that resides in the two, then it would not exist when that does not exist,

original: de yod na yang yod do zhes bya bar 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: de yod na yang yod do zhes bya bar 'gyur gyi /
translated: and it would exist when that exists.

original: 'brel pa med na ni 'di dag bum pa dang snam bu bzhin du med pa kho nar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'brel pa med na ni 'di dag bum pa dang snam bu bzhin du med pa kho nar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'o //
translated: But if there were no relation, then they would not exist at all, like a cloth and a pot.

original: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i lan la yang don @229b 'di yin te /üîΩgal te gnyis la gnas pa'i 'brel pa yod pas /
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i lan la yang don @229b 'di yin te / gal te gnyis la gnas pa'i 'brel pa yod pas /
translated: The response beginning with ‚ÄúIf‚Äù means the following:

original: me yod na du ba yod do zhes bya bar 'dod na /
analyzed: me yod na du ba yod do zhes bya bar 'dod na /
translated: If you assert that smoke exists when fire exists because the relation that resides in the two exists,üîΩthen

original: de'i tshe dus mtshungs ba dag la rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po med pa'i phyir me'i dus na du ba med na ci ltar gnyis la gnas pa'i 'brel par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe dus mtshungs ba dag la rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po med pa'i phyir me'i dus na du ba med na ci ltar gnyis la gnas pa'i 'brel par 'gyur ro //
translated: At that time, since there is no causal entity in the two simultaneous things, if there is no smoke at the time of fire, how could there be a relation in the two?

original: des na ci ltar 'brel pa yod pas rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog par 'gyur ba yin zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: des na ci ltar 'brel pa yod pas rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog par 'gyur ba yin zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Therefore, how could there be concomitance and reverse concomitance because of the relation?

original: sngar zhes bya ba ni du ba skyes pa las so //
analyzed: sngar zhes bya ba ni du ba skyes pa las so //
translated: Previously means from the arising of smoke.

original: gnyis la gnas pa'i 'brel ba de gang gis yin te 'brel pa can gnyis po med pa'i phyir 'ga'i yang ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gnyis la gnas pa'i 'brel ba de gang gis yin te 'brel pa can gnyis po med pa'i phyir 'ga'i yang ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: By what is that relation in the two? It is not of any because the two relata do not exist.

original: gcig yod pa la zhes bya ba ni me nyid yod pa la'o //
analyzed: gcig yod pa la zhes bya ba ni me nyid yod pa la'o //
translated: In the existence of one means in the existence of fire alone.

original: 'brel pa gnyis la gnas par khas mi len gyi 'on kyang 'bras bu skye bar rung ba nyid yin la /
analyzed: 'brel pa gnyis la gnas par khas mi len gyi 'on kyang 'bras bu skye bar rung ba nyid yin la /
translated: We do not accept a relation in the two, but rather the mere possibility of the effect‚Äôs arising.

original: de la'ang rgyu'i dus na yod pa kho na'o zhes dogs pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de la'ang rgyu'i dus na yod pa kho na'o zhes dogs pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: And that exists only at the time of the cause.

original: lan ni rgyu nyid las ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lan ni rgyu nyid las ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The response is: From the cause itself.

original: rgyu las 'bras bu 'byung ba yin no zhes bya bar mngon sum du mi dmigs pas grub pa'i phyir rigs pa dang ldan pa yin gyi //
analyzed: rgyu las 'bras bu 'byung ba yin no zhes bya bar mngon sum du mi dmigs pas grub pa'i phyir rigs pa dang ldan pa yin gyi //
translated: Since it is established by direct perception that an effect arises from a cause, it is reasonable.

original: de las tha dad pa'i rung ba nyid ni rigs pa dang ldan pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: de las tha dad pa'i rung ba nyid ni rigs pa dang ldan pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: But it is not reasonable to posit a separate capacity.

original: gal te 'brel pa tha dad pa med na /
analyzed: gal te 'brel pa tha dad pa med na /
translated: If there is no difference in relation,

original: ci ltar rgyu las 'bras bu 'byung bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ci ltar rgyu las 'bras bu 'byung bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: how can an effect arise from a cause?

original: 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is like this.

original: du bskyed par nus pa'i me ni rang gi rgyu kho nas bskyed pa yin la /
analyzed: du bskyed par nus pa'i me ni rang gi rgyu kho nas bskyed pa yin la /
translated: Fire, which has the capacity to produce smoke, is produced only from its own cause.

original: des ni du bskyed pa yin no //
analyzed: des ni du bskyed pa yin no //
translated: And it produces smoke.üîΩThe commentary beginning with ‚Äúfrom the cause itself‚Äù is the forward

original: rgyu nyid las ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa rnam par 'grel pa ni rjes su 'gro ba dang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rgyu nyid las ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa rnam par 'grel pa ni rjes su 'gro ba dang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: telic function.

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa las rgyu dang 'bras bu nyid gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa las rgyu dang 'bras bu nyid gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, because cause and effect are not different from the forward and reverse entailments,

original: ci ltar mthong ba dang ma mthong las zhes bya ba rnam par 'grel pa ni /
analyzed: ci ltar mthong ba dang ma mthong las zhes bya ba rnam par 'grel pa ni /
translated: how is it that the commentary beginning with ‚Äúfrom seeing and not seeing‚ÄùüîΩis the reverse telic function?

original: rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag las zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag las zhes bya ba'o //
translated: From the going after and turning away.

original: don tha dad pa ni rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i don las rgyu dang 'bras bu nyid kyi don to //
analyzed: don tha dad pa ni rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i don las rgyu dang 'bras bu nyid kyi don to //
translated: The meaning of difference is the meaning of cause and effect from the meaning of going after and turning away.

original: sgra gzhan nyid ni rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i sgra las rgyu dang 'bras bu nyid kyi sgra'o //
analyzed: sgra gzhan nyid ni rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i sgra las rgyu dang 'bras bu nyid kyi sgra'o //
translated: The meaning of other words is the meaning of cause and effect from the words of going after and turning away.

original: gal te de yin pa de ltan yang phyogs kyi chos rnam pa dgur bstan pa 'di sogs su ci ste ma bstan ce na /
analyzed: gal te de yin pa de ltan yang phyogs kyi chos rnam pa dgur bstan pa 'di sogs su ci ste ma bstan ce na /
translated: If that is so, then why is this teaching of the nine aspects of the property of one part not taught in the S≈´tra?

original: des na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: des na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Therefore is said.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar med pa'i tha snyad du byar rung ba mi dmigs pa'i rang bzhin yin pa des na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar med pa'i tha snyad du byar rung ba mi dmigs pa'i rang bzhin yin pa des na /
translated: Because it is not possible to make a convention of nonexistence in that way, the nature of non-apprehension is

original: snang ba mi dmigs pa ni mtshan nyid kyi rgyu las 'bras bu skyer rung @230a * //
analyzed: snang ba mi dmigs pa ni mtshan nyid kyi rgyu las 'bras bu skyer rung @230a * //
translated: The non-apprehension of appearance is suitable for the arising of the effect from the cause of the characteristic.

original: ba nyid bsgrub pas na 'di ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs nang du 'dus pa de'i phyir gtan tshigs kyi rab tu dbye ba bshad pa la 'di tha dad par dper ma bstan to //
analyzed: ba nyid bsgrub pas na 'di ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs nang du 'dus pa de'i phyir gtan tshigs kyi rab tu dbye ba bshad pa la 'di tha dad par dper ma bstan to //
translated: Since it is established by the nature of things, it is included in the reason based on the nature of things. Therefore, when the classification of reasons is explained, it is not shown as a separate example.

original: ci ltar mi dmigs pa rang bzhin gyi nang du 'du zhe na /
analyzed: ci ltar mi dmigs pa rang bzhin gyi nang du 'du zhe na /
translated: How is non-apprehension included in the reason based on the nature of things?

original: nus pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: nus pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The phrase due to the capacity is used.

original: 'bras bu'i rang bzhin du zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu bskyed par rung ba'i rang bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: 'bras bu'i rang bzhin du zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu bskyed par rung ba'i rang bzhin nyid do //
translated: The phrase in the nature of the effect means the very nature of being suitable to produce the effect.

original: gal te mi dmigs pa ni don gyi bdag nyid du ma grub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gal te mi dmigs pa ni don gyi bdag nyid du ma grub pa'i phyir /
translated: If non-apprehension is not established as the nature of the object,

original: rung pa'i bdag nyid du ma grub pas na ci ltar rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kyi nang du 'du shes dogs pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rung pa'i bdag nyid du ma grub pas na ci ltar rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kyi nang du 'du shes dogs pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: since it is not established as the nature of the suitable, how can it be included in the reason based on the nature of things? This is the doubt. The phrase if... expresses this doubt.

original: ci ltar de'i bdag nyid ce na ci ltar zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ci ltar de'i bdag nyid ce na ci ltar zhes bya ba'o //
translated: How is it of that nature? The phrase how... expresses this.

original: 'di nyid brjod pa ni bdag med pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di nyid brjod pa ni bdag med pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is stated in the phrase selflessness...

original: ci ltar dben pa dmigs pa nyid mi dmigs pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci ltar dben pa dmigs pa nyid mi dmigs pa yin zhe na /
translated: How is the very observation of emptiness non-observation?

original: 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //üîΩgang gi phyir gcig dmigs pa nyams su myong ba las dran pa la gnas pa'i dgag par bya ba 'di ma dmigs la ;
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o // gang gi phyir gcig dmigs pa nyams su myong ba las dran pa la gnas pa'i dgag par bya ba 'di ma dmigs la ;
translated: ‚ÄúThus‚Äù means:üîΩBecause one experiences the perception of one thing, the memory of that thing arises, and the cognition of the absence of another thing arises.

original: sa phyogs la sogs pa 'di ni dmigs so zhes bya bar rtogs pa can gyi blo skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sa phyogs la sogs pa 'di ni dmigs so zhes bya bar rtogs pa can gyi blo skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The cognition of the absence of the other thing is not the perception of the mere thing, but rather the perception of the place, etc.

original: ci ltar sa phyogs dgag par bya bas dben par dmigs pa nyid de med pa yin gyi de las tha dad pa ni ma yin zhe na stong pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ci ltar sa phyogs dgag par bya bas dben par dmigs pa nyid de med pa yin gyi de las tha dad pa ni ma yin zhe na stong pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
translated: How is it that the place, etc. are perceived as devoid of the absent thing? They are not perceived as different from it.

original: tshad ma'i spyod yul du rnam par dpyod pa der rung ba ste tshad mas grub pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: tshad ma'i spyod yul du rnam par dpyod pa der rung ba ste tshad mas grub pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the place, etc. are not established by valid cognition as the domain of the operation of valid cognition.

original: de ni grub pa nyid do zhe na dben pa'i bdag nyid kyi dngos po med pa de ni rang bzhin gyi ngo bo tsam du grub kyang mi 'dra ba la sogs pa cung zad kyang grub pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni grub pa nyid do zhe na dben pa'i bdag nyid kyi dngos po med pa de ni rang bzhin gyi ngo bo tsam du grub kyang mi 'dra ba la sogs pa cung zad kyang grub pa ma yin no //
translated: If it is argued that this is established, it is replied: ‚ÄúThat absence which has the nature of isolation is established as the mere intrinsic nature, but nothing else, such as difference, is established.‚Äù

original: 'on te ci'i phyir med kyang gzhan dag khas len no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te ci'i phyir med kyang gzhan dag khas len no zhe na /
translated: But if it does not exist, why do others accept it?

original: de ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is what is said.

original: dngos po rnams 'chol bar rtogs pa ste /
analyzed: dngos po rnams 'chol bar rtogs pa ste /
translated: It is the understanding of things as a confused mass.üîΩIf the nature of the emptiness of non-entity exists, it is a confused mass.

original: dngos po med pa stong pa'i bdag nyid med na 'chol bar 'gyur zhes sems pa de'i lta ba gang la yod pa de dag gi dngos po med pa de ltar mi 'chol bar byed pa nyid du 'dod pa yin te /
analyzed: dngos po med pa stong pa'i bdag nyid med na 'chol bar 'gyur zhes sems pa de'i lta ba gang la yod pa de dag gi dngos po med pa de ltar mi 'chol bar byed pa nyid du 'dod pa yin te /
translated: Those who think that way, for whom that view exists, assert that non-entity is not a confused mass.

original: des na ci ltar de ci yang byed pa ma yin par 'gyur /
analyzed: des na ci ltar de ci yang byed pa ma yin par 'gyur /
translated: Therefore, how could it be that it does not do anything at all?

original: cung zad byed pa yang ma 'dres pa rnams ma 'dres par byed pas na'am /
analyzed: cung zad byed pa yang ma 'dres pa rnams ma 'dres par byed pas na'am /
translated: If it does something, it is because unmixed things are done unmixed,üîΩor mixed things are done mixed.

original: 'dres pa rnams zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: 'dres pa rnams zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: This is conceptualization.

original: de la zhes bya ba ni phyogs 'di gnyis la'o //
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba ni phyogs 'di gnyis la'o //
translated: In this regard means in regard to these two positions.

original: dang po sel ba ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dang po sel ba ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The first is eliminated. If it is said

original: gnyis pa 'gog pa ni 'on te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gnyis pa 'gog pa ni 'on te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: the second is refuted. If it is said

original: @230b gal te stong pa'i rang bzhin gyi dngos po med pa med na /
analyzed: @230b gal te stong pa'i rang bzhin gyi dngos po med pa med na /
translated: If the nature of the emptiness of non-entity does not exist,

original: 'o na ci ltar sa phyogs na bum pa med ces tha dad par ston ce na /
analyzed: 'o na ci ltar sa phyogs na bum pa med ces tha dad par ston ce na /
translated: Well then, how is it that one teaches that the pot does not exist in a particular place?üîΩTherefore,

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //üîΩde ltar zhes bya ba ni tha dad par ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba'o // de ltar zhes bya ba ni tha dad par ro //
translated: thus,üîΩteaching,

original: ston pa ni rnam pa brjod pa ni bum pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ston pa ni rnam pa brjod pa ni bum pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: expression,

original: gal te dben pa nyid gzhan med mod /
analyzed: gal te dben pa nyid gzhan med mod /
translated: If emptiness is the non-existence of something else,

original: de dmigs pa go ci ltar mi dmigs pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: de dmigs pa go ci ltar mi dmigs pa yin zhe na /
translated: how is it that the non-existence of something is not apprehended?

original: 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
translated: In this way,

original: ci ma dmigs snyam na /
analyzed: ci ma dmigs snyam na /
translated: If one thinks that it is not apprehended,

original: dran pa la mngon du gnas pa'i dgag par bya ba 'di ni'o //üîΩsa phyogs zhes bya ba ni dben pa'i sa phyogs nyams su myong ba nyid gzhan ma dmigs pa yin gyi /
analyzed: dran pa la mngon du gnas pa'i dgag par bya ba 'di ni'o // sa phyogs zhes bya ba ni dben pa'i sa phyogs nyams su myong ba nyid gzhan ma dmigs pa yin gyi /
translated: this is the negation of the object of memory that is present.üîΩThe place,

original: shes pa gtan med pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: shes pa gtan med pa ni ma yin no //
translated: the place of emptiness is the non-apprehension of something else that is experienced, but it is not the complete non-existence of consciousness.

original: 'o na de'i bdag nyid 'gog pa'i phyogs la ci ltar gzhan dmigs pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na de'i bdag nyid 'gog pa'i phyogs la ci ltar gzhan dmigs pa yin zhe na /
translated: Well then, how is it that in the case of the negation of its own nature, something else is apprehended?

original: gang gi phyir zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Because,üîΩthis,

original: 'di ni zhes bya ba ni myong bzhin pa'i phyogs la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni zhes bya ba ni myong bzhin pa'i phyogs la sogs pa'o //
translated: the place that is being experienced, and so on.

original: gzhan gyi zhes bya ba ni dran pa la gnas pa'i bum pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin du'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi zhes bya ba ni dran pa la gnas pa'i bum pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin du'o //
translated: ‚ÄúOther‚Äù refers to the nature of the pot, etc., which is the basis of memory.

original: rang bzhin des de ltar ma dmigs kyang ci ltar des dben pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: rang bzhin des de ltar ma dmigs kyang ci ltar des dben pa yin zhe na /
translated: Even though it is not perceived in that way by that nature, how can it be devoid of that?

original: gcig dmigs zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'dir ro //
analyzed: gcig dmigs zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'dir ro //
translated: This is the case with ‚Äúthe perception of one,‚Äù etc.

original: gang zhe na /
analyzed: gang zhe na /
translated: What is that?

original: de'i zhes bya ba ste bum pa la sogs pa'o'o //
analyzed: de'i zhes bya ba ste bum pa la sogs pa'o'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù refers to the pot, etc.

original: 'di ni zhes bya ba ni sa phyogs so //
analyzed: 'di ni zhes bya ba ni sa phyogs so //
translated: ‚ÄúThis‚Äù refers to the place.

original: sa phyogs bum pa la sogs pa'i bdag nyid du ma dmigs pa nyid do bum pa la sogs pa'i dben pa nyid do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sa phyogs bum pa la sogs pa'i bdag nyid du ma dmigs pa nyid do bum pa la sogs pa'i dben pa nyid do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The place is not perceived in the nature of the pot, etc. This is the meaning of ‚Äúthe absence of the pot, etc.‚Äù

original: gzhan gyi bsam pas ldog pa med par dogs pa bsu ba ni /
analyzed: gzhan gyi bsam pas ldog pa med par dogs pa bsu ba ni /
translated: In order to prevent the opponent from thinking that there is no negation, he anticipates this with

original: gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIf you say,‚Äù etc.

original: bum pa la sogs pa'i dngos po des phyogs 'di na med pa'o zhes de ltar bum pa la sogs pa de med par bsgrub par bya ba'o //
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa'i dngos po des phyogs 'di na med pa'o zhes de ltar bum pa la sogs pa de med par bsgrub par bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThis place is devoid of that entity, the pot, etc.‚Äù In this way, the non-existence of the pot, etc. is established.

original: bzlog ste zhes bya ba ni dngos po med pa las bzlog pa ste /
analyzed: bzlog ste zhes bya ba ni dngos po med pa las bzlog pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúThe opposite‚Äù is the opposite of non-existence.

original: sa phyogs la sogs pa yod pa la dngos po med pa'i sgras brjod /
analyzed: sa phyogs la sogs pa yod pa la dngos po med pa'i sgras brjod /
translated: In the case of the existence of a place, etc., it is expressed by the word non-entity.

original: ci ltar sa phyogs la sogs pa nyid du bum pa'i rang bzhin du med par bsgrub ste dngos po med par gzhan nyid bsgrub par bya bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ci ltar sa phyogs la sogs pa nyid du bum pa'i rang bzhin du med par bsgrub ste dngos po med par gzhan nyid bsgrub par bya bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: How is it that the nature of a place, etc. is established as non-existent, i.e., as something other than an entity? This is the meaning.

original: lan ni 'di ni zhig na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lan ni 'di ni zhig na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The answer is: ‚ÄúIf it were destroyed.‚Äù

original: gang gi tshe zhe na gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gang gi tshe zhe na gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: When? ‚ÄúIf it were.‚Äù

original: 'di'i zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'di'i zhes bya ba ni /
translated: ‚ÄúThis‚Äù refers to

original: sa phyogs bum pa'i rang bzhin du med do zhes bya bar brjod pa'i'o //
analyzed: sa phyogs bum pa'i rang bzhin du med do zhes bya bar brjod pa'i'o //
translated: the place, which is expressed as not having the nature of a pot.

original: gal te sa phyogs la sogs pa'i don dngos po'i rang bzhin du gyur pa gzhan nang du mi 'du ba yin na'o //üîΩnang @231a * //
analyzed: gal te sa phyogs la sogs pa'i don dngos po'i rang bzhin du gyur pa gzhan nang du mi 'du ba yin na'o // nang @231a * //
translated: If the meaning of a place, etc. were not included within the nature of an entity,üîΩit would be included within

original: du yang 'du ba yin te /
analyzed: du yang 'du ba yin te /
translated: They are also included in the two truths.üîΩ

original: des na phyogs nyid bum pa med pa'i rang bzhin du bsgrub par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: des na phyogs nyid bum pa med pa'i rang bzhin du bsgrub par bya ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, the place itself is established as having the nature of the absence of a pot.

original: ci ltar dngos po dngos po med pa'i rang bzhin yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci ltar dngos po dngos po med pa'i rang bzhin yin zhe na /
translated: How is an entity the nature of a non-entity?

original: 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIn this way,‚Äù it is said.

original: de'i ni bum pa'i rang bzhin gyis so //
analyzed: de'i ni bum pa'i rang bzhin gyis so //
translated: The nature of the pot is that.

original: 'di yis zhes bya ba ni sa phyogs kyis so//
analyzed: 'di yis zhes bya ba ni sa phyogs kyis so//
translated: This refers to the place.

original: 'chad pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'chad pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The explanation is ‚Äúif.

original: des ni sa phyogs so //
analyzed: des ni sa phyogs so //
translated: ‚Äù That refers to the place.

original: 'dis ni bum pas so //
analyzed: 'dis ni bum pas so //
translated: This refers to the pot.

original: bum pa 'di yang sa phyogs des so //
analyzed: bum pa 'di yang sa phyogs des so //
translated: The pot is also that place.

original: de ltar shin tu gsal ba'i don sa phyogs bum pa med pa'i rang bzhin yin pa la gzhan dag dngos po med pa tha dad pa yod pa yin no ci ltar rmongs par rigs /
analyzed: de ltar shin tu gsal ba'i don sa phyogs bum pa med pa'i rang bzhin yin pa la gzhan dag dngos po med pa tha dad pa yod pa yin no ci ltar rmongs par rigs /
translated: Thus, how can others be confused about the very clear meaning that the place is the nature of the absence of the pot?

original: gang gi phyir de ltar dngos po med pa tha dad pa yod pa ma yin pa de'i phyir na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar dngos po med pa tha dad pa yod pa ma yin pa de'i phyir na /
translated: Since the absence of the thing does not exist as a separate thing,

original: bum pa la sogs pa des dben pa nyid sa phyogs 'dir bum pa de'i dngos po med pa yin no //
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa des dben pa nyid sa phyogs 'dir bum pa de'i dngos po med pa yin no //
translated: therefore, the very absence of the pot in the place that is devoid of the pot is the nonexistence of the pot in this place.

original: gal te de ltar yin du chug pa de lta na yang 'dir mi dmigs pa nyid dmigs pa yin par ci ltar 'gyur zhe na gang gi phyir zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te de ltar yin du chug pa de lta na yang 'dir mi dmigs pa nyid dmigs pa yin par ci ltar 'gyur zhe na gang gi phyir zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Even if that is so, how can the very nonapprehension here be apprehension?

original: shes pa gzhan zhes bya ba ni sa phyogs kyi shes pa'i dmigs pa gang yin pa de bum pa'i mi dmigs pa yin du chug mod /üîΩshes bya gzhan zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: shes pa gzhan zhes bya ba ni sa phyogs kyi shes pa'i dmigs pa gang yin pa de bum pa'i mi dmigs pa yin du chug mod / shes bya gzhan zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúanother cognition‚Äù means that the object of the cognition of a place may be the nonapprehension of a pot.

original: sa phyogs kyi shes pa'i dmigs pa nyid bum pa med par ci ltar yin /
analyzed: sa phyogs kyi shes pa'i dmigs pa nyid bum pa med par ci ltar yin /
translated: But how can the object of the cognition of a place be the nonexistence of a pot?

original: sa phyogs shes pa bum pa shes pa med pa yin mod /
analyzed: sa phyogs shes pa bum pa shes pa med pa yin mod /
translated: The cognition of a place is not the cognition of a pot,

original: bum pa med pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bum pa med pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: but it is not the nonexistence of a pot.

original: shes pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i lan gyi mdo don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: shes pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i lan gyi mdo don ni 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning of the s≈´tra passage beginning with ‚Äúcognition‚Äù is as follows.

original: dmigs pa nyid don rnams kyi yod pa yin pa des na /
analyzed: dmigs pa nyid don rnams kyi yod pa yin pa des na /
translated: The existence of objects is their being the object of cognition.

original: shes pa med pa nyid shes bya med pa yin no zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: shes pa med pa nyid shes bya med pa yin no zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Therefore, the nonexistence of a cognition is the nonexistence of an object of cognition.

original: yang na zhes bya ba la sogs pa la bshad pa snga mar ni'am gyi sgra la ma reg go //
analyzed: yang na zhes bya ba la sogs pa la bshad pa snga mar ni'am gyi sgra la ma reg go //
translated: Or, in the other explanation, the word ‚Äúor‚Äù in the previous explanation is not used.

original: de'i rjes la ni bsdu ba'i don du bshad do //
analyzed: de'i rjes la ni bsdu ba'i don du bshad do //
translated: It is explained as having the sense of ‚Äúand.‚Äù

original: de ni kho na'i don du 'chad pa'o //
analyzed: de ni kho na'i don du 'chad pa'o //
translated: This is the explanation of the word ‚Äúonly.‚Äù

original: dmigs so zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa bskyed pa'i sgo nas yul yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dmigs so zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa bskyed pa'i sgo nas yul yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúIt is an object‚Äù means that it is an object in the sense that it generates a conceptual image.

original: de bzhin du zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa nyid du nges par byas pa la dmigs pa zhes brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa nyid du nges par byas pa la dmigs pa zhes brjod pa yin te /
translated: ‚ÄúJust like that‚Äù means that it is called an object because it is ascertained as an object.

original: de ltar ma yin na 'gro ba na rtsa la reg pa dang / 'dra ba'i phyir dmigs pas dmigs pa'i rnam par gzhag pa nyams su myong ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar ma yin na 'gro ba na rtsa la reg pa dang / 'dra ba'i phyir dmigs pas dmigs pa'i rnam par gzhag pa nyams su myong ba ma yin no //
translated: If it were not so, then when one walks, one would not experience the sensation of touching the ground, and the object would not be established as an object because it would be similar to the non-object.

original: de bzhin du ma dmigs so snyam pa'i zhen pa las kyang ma dmigs par brjod pa yin no//
analyzed: de bzhin du ma dmigs so snyam pa'i zhen pa las kyang ma dmigs par brjod pa yin no//
translated: In the same way, the non-object is expressed as a non-object from the conception that thinks, ‚ÄúIt is not perceived.‚Äù

original: @231b gal te zhes bya ba ni 'di med pa'o zhes bya ba de lta bu'i rang bzhin gyi dngos po med pa'i tshad mas bsgrub pa'i dngos po med pa yod pa nyid las dngos po rnams kyi khyad par ma 'chol bar grub pa yin no zhes bya ba'o
analyzed: @231b gal te zhes bya ba ni 'di med pa'o zhes bya ba de lta bu'i rang bzhin gyi dngos po med pa'i tshad mas bsgrub pa'i dngos po med pa yod pa nyid las dngos po rnams kyi khyad par ma 'chol bar grub pa yin no zhes bya ba'o
translated: ‚ÄúIf‚Äù means that the non-existence of such a nature of an entity is established by valid cognition. The existence of non-existence is established without confusing the differences among entities.

original: // myong ba khyad par can nyid las zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: // myong ba khyad par can nyid las zhes bya ba ni /
translated: ‚ÄúFrom the very experience of the difference‚Äù means that

original: dngos po med pa'i tshad mas bsgrubs pa'i dngos med las ni ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i tshad mas bsgrubs pa'i dngos med las ni ma yin pa'o //
translated: not from a non-entity established by a valid cognition of non-entity.

original: khyad par can zhes bya ba ni ma 'dres pa'o //
analyzed: khyad par can zhes bya ba ni ma 'dres pa'o //
translated: The distinguished means the unmixed.

original: gal te myong ba'i khyab par sgrub par byed pa gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: gal te myong ba'i khyab par sgrub par byed pa gang yin zhe na /
translated: If one asks, What is the proof of the pervasion of experience?

original: de lta'i zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de lta'i zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is said, In that way.

original: myong ba 'di'i so sor nges pa'i bdag nyid nyams su myong ba nyid tha dad pa'i blo'i rgyu yin no ;
analyzed: myong ba 'di'i so sor nges pa'i bdag nyid nyams su myong ba nyid tha dad pa'i blo'i rgyu yin no ;
translated: The experience itself, which is the nature of individual determination, is the cause of the cognition of difference.

original: / de ni myong ba gzhan nam dngos po med pa'i khyad par can ma yin te /
analyzed: / de ni myong ba gzhan nam dngos po med pa'i khyad par can ma yin te /
translated: It is not another experience or a distinguished non-entity.

original: des na thug pa med pa ma yin no zhes dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: des na thug pa med pa ma yin no zhes dgongs pa'o //
translated: Therefore, there is no infinite regress, that is the idea.

original: phyed snga ma ldog pa'i sgo nas 'chad pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: phyed snga ma ldog pa'i sgo nas 'chad pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The explanation by way of the first half of the verse in terms of the negation is, if one says.

original: myong bar bya ba zhes bya ba sa phyogs kyi khyad par ma 'chol ba gang yin pa de rtogs par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: myong bar bya ba zhes bya ba sa phyogs kyi khyad par ma 'chol ba gang yin pa de rtogs par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: The distinction of the place of experience, which is not mixed, will not be understood.

original: gal te sa phyogs kyi shes pa bum pa'i shes pa las mi ldog nas phyogs kyang mi ldog go zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gal te sa phyogs kyi shes pa bum pa'i shes pa las mi ldog nas phyogs kyang mi ldog go zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: If the cognition of the place does not turn away from the cognition of the pot, then the place does not turn away. This is the meaning.

original: 'dis ni rigs par bya ba phyi rol gyi khyad par rtogs pa med par bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni rigs par bya ba phyi rol gyi khyad par rtogs pa med par bstan to //
translated: This shows that the object to be cognized is not the external particular.

original: da ni phyed phyi ma ldog pa'i sgo nas rnam par 'grel pas 'dzin par byed pa yang 'dzin par byed pa gzhan las mi ldog na /
analyzed: da ni phyed phyi ma ldog pa'i sgo nas rnam par 'grel pas 'dzin par byed pa yang 'dzin par byed pa gzhan las mi ldog na /
translated: Now, in the second half, the author explains by way of the negation. If the apprehender does not turn away from another apprehender,

original: khyad par rtogs pa med par brjod pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: khyad par rtogs pa med par brjod pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: then the statement that there is no cognition of the particular is ‚ÄúIf . . .‚Äù

original: de'i rang bzhin can zhes bya ba ni sa phyogs kyi rnam pa can gyi shes pa'o //
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin can zhes bya ba ni sa phyogs kyi rnam pa can gyi shes pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúHaving that as its nature‚Äù means having the aspect of the cognition of the place.

original: de'i yang zhes bya ba ni de'i shes pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi sa phyogs kyi yang ngo //
analyzed: de'i yang zhes bya ba ni de'i shes pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi sa phyogs kyi yang ngo //
translated: ‚ÄúOf that‚Äù means not only of that cognition but also of the place.

original: khyad par zhes bya ba ni ma 'chol ba nyid do //
analyzed: khyad par zhes bya ba ni ma 'chol ba nyid do //
translated: ‚ÄúParticular‚Äù means unmixed.

original: sngar bshad zin pa'i rtsod pa nyid dngos su bzlog pa'i phyir dogs pa bsu ba ni /
analyzed: sngar bshad zin pa'i rtsod pa nyid dngos su bzlog pa'i phyir dogs pa bsu ba ni /
translated: In order to directly refute the objection already explained, the author anticipates the objection:

original: dngos po med pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dngos po med pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIf the cognition of the place does not turn away from the cognition of the pot, then the place does not turn away. This is the meaning.‚Äù

original: de'i yang dngos po ldog pa'i dngos po med pa'i rang bzhin la 'di ni don med do zhes shes pa'i rigs pas khyad par can nyid rtogs so zhe na /
analyzed: de'i yang dngos po ldog pa'i dngos po med pa'i rang bzhin la 'di ni don med do zhes shes pa'i rigs pas khyad par can nyid rtogs so zhe na /
translated: And if you think that the nature of the non-entity of the reversal of entity is understood through the reasoning that this is meaningless, then:

original: dbye ba zhes bya ba ni lan no //
analyzed: dbye ba zhes bya ba ni lan no //
translated: The response is ‚Äúthe distinction.‚Äù

original: nam gyi tshe zhe na dbye ba med pa mngon sum gyis rig pa na'o //
analyzed: nam gyi tshe zhe na dbye ba med pa mngon sum gyis rig pa na'o //
translated: When? ‚ÄúWhen the non-distinction is known through perception.‚Äù

original: bstan zin pas zhes bya ba ni tshad ma slu ba med pa can gyis zhes bya ba der ro //
analyzed: bstan zin pas zhes bya ba ni tshad ma slu ba med pa can gyis zhes bya ba der ro //
translated: ‚ÄúSince it has been shown‚Äù means ‚Äúthrough the valid knowledge that is non-deceptive.‚Äù

original: des na dngos po med pa rigs pas ni ma 'dres par grub pa ma yin no //üîΩ'o na ci @232a * //
analyzed: des na dngos po med pa rigs pas ni ma 'dres par grub pa ma yin no // 'o na ci @232a * //
translated: Therefore non-entity is not established by reasoning without confusion.

original: ltar khyad par can nyams su myong ba nyid ma 'chol ba'i sgrub par byed pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ltar khyad par can nyams su myong ba nyid ma 'chol ba'i sgrub par byed pa yin zhe na /
translated: Well then, how is the experience of the distinction itself the unconfused proof?

original: 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is like this.

original: gang gi phyir dran pa med par ni 'di ni med do zhes bya ba de lta bu'i rnam pa can dngos po med pa'i shes pa yod par mi srid do //
analyzed: gang gi phyir dran pa med par ni 'di ni med do zhes bya ba de lta bu'i rnam pa can dngos po med pa'i shes pa yod par mi srid do //
translated: Because without memory, the knowledge ‚Äúthis is not existent‚Äù in that way is impossible.

original: gang gi phyir khyad par can nyams su myong ba med par ni dngos po med pa'i shes pa'i rgyur gyur pa'i dran pa yod pa ma yin pa de'i phyir khyad par can nyams su myong ba nyid ma 'dres par grub par byed pa yin no zhes dogs pa'o
analyzed: gang gi phyir khyad par can nyams su myong ba med par ni dngos po med pa'i shes pa'i rgyur gyur pa'i dran pa yod pa ma yin pa de'i phyir khyad par can nyams su myong ba nyid ma 'dres par grub par byed pa yin no zhes dogs pa'o
translated: Because without the experience of the distinctive feature, there is no memory that is the cause of the cognition of the absence of a thing, therefore, the experience of the distinctive feature is established as unmixed.

original: // 'chad pa ni bzlog zla zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: // 'chad pa ni bzlog zla zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The explanation is ‚Äúthe opposite.‚Äù

original: 'on te zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar bsams pa yin te /
analyzed: 'on te zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar bsams pa yin te /
translated: ‚ÄúOr‚Äù means this is the thought:

original: sngar ni ma 'dres pa nyams su myong ba yin te /
analyzed: sngar ni ma 'dres pa nyams su myong ba yin te /
translated: Previously, there was the experience of the unmixed.

original: de dran pa ni de'i stobs kyis dus gzhan du gyur pa yin no zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de dran pa ni de'i stobs kyis dus gzhan du gyur pa yin no zhes bya ba'o //
translated: That memory is the power of that, which becomes another time.

original: lan ni de ltar yin na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lan ni de ltar yin na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The answer is ‚ÄúIf that is so.‚Äù

original: 'di yang zhes bya ba ni de ltar ba'i sa phyogs so //
analyzed: 'di yang zhes bya ba ni de ltar ba'i sa phyogs so //
translated: ‚ÄúThis‚Äù is the place like that.

original: ci ltar dran pa'i bag chags 'jog par byed pa'i nyams su myong ba ma 'dres pa'i dngos po 'dzin par byed par khas len pa de bzhin du dran pa nye bar sad par byed pa yang khas blang par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ci ltar dran pa'i bag chags 'jog par byed pa'i nyams su myong ba ma 'dres pa'i dngos po 'dzin par byed par khas len pa de bzhin du dran pa nye bar sad par byed pa yang khas blang par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that just as you accept that the experience of the placement of the latent potentialities of memory holds on to the unmixed entity, in just the same way, you should accept that the arousing of memory is also like that.

original: de lta yin dang de nyid ma 'chol ba'i sgrub par byed pa yin no //
