original: gzhan zhes bya ba ni snang ba mi dmigs pa brtags pas so ;
analyzed: gzhan zhes bya ba ni snang ba mi dmigs pa brtags pas so ;
translated: ‚ÄúAnother‚Äù is the non-apprehension of the appearance, which is imagined.

original: / glo bur ba las zhes bya ba ni 'bad pas 'brel pa dran pa med par rmongs pa du ba rtogs pa yin te du ba nyid ni mes bskyed par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: / glo bur ba las zhes bya ba ni 'bad pas 'brel pa dran pa med par rmongs pa du ba rtogs pa yin te du ba nyid ni mes bskyed par bya ba yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúFrom the adventitious‚Äù means that the cognition of smoke is from the non-apprehension of the connection through effort, without memory. Smoke is what is produced by fire.

original: de yang rmongs pa ni de'i rang bzhin gyi rjes su dpag pa las rtogs pa yin la ma rmongs pa ni mngon sum las yin no //
analyzed: de yang rmongs pa ni de'i rang bzhin gyi rjes su dpag pa las rtogs pa yin la ma rmongs pa ni mngon sum las yin no //
translated: Moreover, the cognition of that is from inference of its nature for the confused, and from perception for the non-confused.

original: yang na du ba las rtogs pa zhes tshig sbyar te //
analyzed: yang na du ba las rtogs pa zhes tshig sbyar te //
translated: Or else, the expression ‚Äúfrom smoke‚Äù should be applied.

original: dper na ma rmongs pa du ba las glo bur du me rtogs pa de bzhin du rang bzhin mi dmigs pa yang rgyu dang khyad par byed pa'i mi dmigs pa'i rang bzhin du gyur pas ma rmongs pa las yang dngos po med pa sgrub par 'gyur ro zhes
analyzed: dper na ma rmongs pa du ba las glo bur du me rtogs pa de bzhin du rang bzhin mi dmigs pa yang rgyu dang khyad par byed pa'i mi dmigs pa'i rang bzhin du gyur pas ma rmongs pa las yang dngos po med pa sgrub par 'gyur ro zhes
translated: For example, just as the non-confused person suddenly cognizes fire from smoke, in the same way, the non-apprehension of the nature also establishes the non-existence of the thing from the non-apprehension of the cause and the differentia, because it is the nature of the non-apprehension of the cause and the differentia.

original: bya ba'i don to ;
analyzed: bya ba'i don to ;
translated: This is the meaning of the expression.

original: / de nyid kyi phyir de la ni zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: / de nyid kyi phyir de la ni zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Therefore, it is said, ‚Äújust that.‚Äù

original: rang bzhin mi dmigs pa gcig la rgyu dang khyab byed mi dmigs pa bstan pas gsum nyid do //
analyzed: rang bzhin mi dmigs pa gcig la rgyu dang khyab byed mi dmigs pa bstan pas gsum nyid do //
translated: In the case of the non-apprehension of the nature of one thing, the non-apprehension of the cause and the pervader are taught, so there are three.

original: 'di ltar bum pa'i shes pa ni bum pa'i rgyu yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar bum pa'i shes pa ni bum pa'i rgyu yin te /
translated: Thus, the cognition of a pot is the cause of a pot,

original: 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i rgyur smra ba ces len pa'i phyir ro //üîΩdes na bum pa'i @235a * //
analyzed: 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i rgyur smra ba ces len pa'i phyir ro // des na bum pa'i @235a * //
translated: because it is said to be the cause of what is to come.

original: shes pa med pas bum pa med pa ni /
analyzed: shes pa med pas bum pa med pa ni /
translated: Therefore, the non-existence of a pot due to the non-existence of the cognition of a pot

original: rgyu mi dmigs pa las yin no //
analyzed: rgyu mi dmigs pa las yin no //
translated: is from the non-apprehension of the cause.

original: dmigs pa nyid yod pa rnams kyi yod pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tshul gyis na shes pa ni khyab par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: dmigs pa nyid yod pa rnams kyi yod pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tshul gyis na shes pa ni khyab par byed pa yin te /
translated: By the method, ‚ÄúThe existence of existent things is just the apprehension of them,‚Äù cognition is the pervader,

original: des na khyab par byed par shes pa med pas khyab par bya ba shes bya med pa yin no//
analyzed: des na khyab par byed par shes pa med pas khyab par bya ba shes bya med pa yin no//
translated: so the non-existence of the object of cognition due to the non-existence of the cognition of the pervader is from the non-apprehension of the pervader.

original: gang gi tshe ba ltar rung ba'i yod pa mthong ba'i yul nyid kyi khyab pa de'i tshe rang bzhin mi dmigs pa yang yin pa ni bsal ba kho na'o //
analyzed: gang gi tshe ba ltar rung ba'i yod pa mthong ba'i yul nyid kyi khyab pa de'i tshe rang bzhin mi dmigs pa yang yin pa ni bsal ba kho na'o //
translated: When there is the apprehension of the existence of a suitable object, the pervasion is just that. At that time, the non-apprehension of the nature is just the opposite.

original: de ltar na rang bzhin mi dmigs pa la ni gsum nyid yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na rang bzhin mi dmigs pa la ni gsum nyid yin no //
translated: Thus, there are three types of non-observation of nature.

original: gang gis gcig gi tshe ni rang bzhin mi dmigs pa yin la gzhan gyi tshe ni khyab byed mi dmigs par 'gyur ba rang bzhin dang khyad par byed pa mi dmigs pa dag la khyab par bya ba dang khyab par byed pa'i dngos po khyad par yod pa
analyzed: gang gis gcig gi tshe ni rang bzhin mi dmigs pa yin la gzhan gyi tshe ni khyab byed mi dmigs par 'gyur ba rang bzhin dang khyad par byed pa mi dmigs pa dag la khyab par bya ba dang khyab par byed pa'i dngos po khyad par yod pa
translated: Moreover, there is no difference in the nature of the pervaded and pervader in the case of non-observation of nature and non-observation of the distinguishing feature, by which one is non-observation of nature and the other is non-observation of the pervader.

original: yang ma yin no zhes ston pa ni gzhan yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: yang ma yin no zhes ston pa ni gzhan yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: To demonstrate this, he says, ‚ÄúMoreover, . . .‚Äù

original: 'dir ni zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin dang khyab byed mi dmigs pa dag la khyab bya khyab byed kyi dngos po gang yin pa de ni don dam par tha dad pa yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dir ni zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin dang khyab byed mi dmigs pa dag la khyab bya khyab byed kyi dngos po gang yin pa de ni don dam par tha dad pa yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Here, the nature of the pervaded and pervader in the case of non-observation of nature and non-observation of the pervader is ultimately not different,

original: gnyi ga la yang khyab par bya ba dang khyad par byed pa'i dngos po mtshungs pa nyid do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gnyi ga la yang khyab par bya ba dang khyad par byed pa'i dngos po mtshungs pa nyid do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: because the nature of the pervaded and pervader is the same in both cases. This is the meaning.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: dmigs pa nyid ni zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: dmigs pa nyid ni zhes bya ba ste /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúBecause the object of observation . . .‚Äù

original: rang bzhin mi dmigs par dmigs pa nyid yod pa yin no zhes bsgrub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang bzhin mi dmigs par dmigs pa nyid yod pa yin no zhes bsgrub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The existence of the non-apprehension of intrinsic reality is established by the very non-apprehension of intrinsic reality.

original: 'chad pa ni bltar rung ba'i zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'chad pa ni bltar rung ba'i zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The explanation is ‚Äúthat which is suitable to be seen.‚Äù

original: 'di ni zhes bya ba ni khyab bya khyab byed kyi dngos po'o //
analyzed: 'di ni zhes bya ba ni khyab bya khyab byed kyi dngos po'o //
translated: ‚Äú This‚Äù refers to the relationship of the pervaded and the pervader.

original: ci ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ci ltar zhe na /
translated: How?

original: de'i zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de'i zhes bya ba ste /
translated: ‚Äú That‚Äù refers to the non-apprehension of intrinsic reality.

original: dgag pa nyid kyis khyab bya khyab byed yin pa kho na'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dgag pa nyid kyis khyab bya khyab byed yin pa kho na'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The very negation is the relationship of the pervaded and the pervader.

original: chos mchog la sogs pa ni rang gi mtshan nyid kyis rig pa mi dmigs pa ni rang bzhin mi dmigs pa ltar 'dod pa yin no zhes ston pa ni gang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: chos mchog la sogs pa ni rang gi mtshan nyid kyis rig pa mi dmigs pa ni rang bzhin mi dmigs pa ltar 'dod pa yin no zhes ston pa ni gang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The supreme object, etc., are taught to be like the non-apprehension of intrinsic reality, which is the non-apprehension of the object of negation by intrinsic identity.

original: me'i 'bras bu de ni me de'i rang bzhin dang khyad par med pas na'o //
analyzed: me'i 'bras bu de ni me de'i rang bzhin dang khyad par med pas na'o //
translated: The effect of fire is not different from the intrinsic reality of that fire.

original: ci ltar khyad par med ce na /
analyzed: ci ltar khyad par med ce na /
translated: How is it not different?

original: rgyu me khyab pa gang yin pa dang de'i 'bras bu me las bzlog pa med pa des na'o //
analyzed: rgyu me khyab pa gang yin pa dang de'i 'bras bu me las bzlog pa med pa des na'o //
translated: It is because the cause of fire is pervaded by that and its effect is not separate from fire.

original: nus pa'i rgyu la ni 'bras bus khyab pa yin te /
analyzed: nus pa'i rgyu la ni 'bras bus khyab pa yin te /
translated: The effect pervades the cause that has the capacity.

original: des na rang bzhin ltar 'di yang tha dad pa med pa yin no //
analyzed: des na rang bzhin ltar 'di yang tha dad pa med pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, like the nature, this is also not different.üîΩBy that non-difference, its own nature and pervasion are not established.

original: tha mi dad pa des na de'i rang gi ngo bo dang khyab par med pa yin no de zhes bya ba 'bras bu mi dmigs pa ni /
analyzed: tha mi dad pa des na de'i rang gi ngo bo dang khyab par med pa yin no de zhes bya ba 'bras bu mi dmigs pa ni /
translated: The non-observation of the effect is just the non-observation of the nature.üîΩThus, the non-observation of smoke, which is the effect of fire, is explained to be included within the non-observation of the nature.

original: rang bzhin mi dmigs pa nyid @235b du brjod do zhes de ltar du ba mi dmigs pa'i rang bzhin gyi 'bras bu mi dmigs pa rang bzhin mi dmigs pa'i khongs su 'du ba nyid du 'chad ba rmongs pa slob dpon chos mchog la sogs pa de myong ba
analyzed: rang bzhin mi dmigs pa nyid @235b du brjod do zhes de ltar du ba mi dmigs pa'i rang bzhin gyi 'bras bu mi dmigs pa rang bzhin mi dmigs pa'i khongs su 'du ba nyid du 'chad ba rmongs pa slob dpon chos mchog la sogs pa de myong ba
translated: The deluded master Dharmottara and so on experience

original: zhes bya ba de'i 'bras bur gyur pa bum pa'i shes pa ma dmigs pa rang bzhin mi dmigs par ci ltar 'chad /
analyzed: zhes bya ba de'i 'bras bur gyur pa bum pa'i shes pa ma dmigs pa rang bzhin mi dmigs par ci ltar 'chad /
translated: how is the non-observation of the consciousness of the pot, which is its effect, explained as the non-observation of the nature?

original: gang zhig 'bras bu mi dmigs pa rang bzhin mi dmigs pa'i nang du 'dus par 'chad pa de /
analyzed: gang zhig 'bras bu mi dmigs pa rang bzhin mi dmigs pa'i nang du 'dus par 'chad pa de /
translated: Whoever explains the non-observation of the effect to be included within the non-observation of the nature

original: rig pa mi dmigs pa ni gsal bar yang rang bzhin mi dmigs par 'chad de dang ngo //
analyzed: rig pa mi dmigs pa ni gsal bar yang rang bzhin mi dmigs par 'chad de dang ngo //
translated: also clearly explains the non-observation of the object to be the non-observation of the nature.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar rang bzhin mi dmigs pa yin gyi khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa ma yin pa de'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar rang bzhin mi dmigs pa yin gyi khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa ma yin pa de'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the non-observation of nature is like that, but not the non-observation of the pervader.

original: gal te zhes bya ba ni gang zhig khyab byed mi dmigs pa nyid du sbyar bar nus pa de gal te rang bzhin mi dmigs pa'i nang du 'dus na /
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba ni gang zhig khyab byed mi dmigs pa nyid du sbyar bar nus pa de gal te rang bzhin mi dmigs pa'i nang du 'dus na /
translated: If, in the case of the non-observation of the pervader, one is able to apply it to the non-observation of the nature,

original: de'i tshe khyab byed mi dmigs pa bum pa med pa'i tha snyad du byas pa la mi srid par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de'i tshe khyab byed mi dmigs pa bum pa med pa'i tha snyad du byas pa la mi srid par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: then at that time, the non-observation of the pervader would be impossible in the convention of the non-existence of the pot. This is the meaning.

original: lan ni bden de zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: lan ni bden de zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The answer is ‚ÄúThat is true‚Äù and so forth.

original: gal te khyab byed mi dmigs par rang bzhin mi dmigs pa'i nang du 'dus na /
analyzed: gal te khyab byed mi dmigs par rang bzhin mi dmigs pa'i nang du 'dus na /
translated: If the non-observation of the pervader is included in the non-observation of the nature,

original: 'o na rang bzhin dang khyab byed mi dmigs pa dag ci ltar tha dad ce na /
analyzed: 'o na rang bzhin dang khyab byed mi dmigs pa dag ci ltar tha dad ce na /
translated: then how are the non-observation of the nature and the non-observation of the pervader different?

original: lan ni khyab par byed pa dang khyab par bya ba shing dang sha pa dag tha dad pa'i phyir ni rang bzhin dang khyab byed mi dmigs pa dag tha dad pa yin no //
analyzed: lan ni khyab par byed pa dang khyab par bya ba shing dang sha pa dag tha dad pa'i phyir ni rang bzhin dang khyab byed mi dmigs pa dag tha dad pa yin no //
translated: The answer is: because the pervader and the pervaded, the tree and the fig, are different, the non-apprehension of the nature and the non-apprehension of the pervaded are different.

original: de dag tha dad pa nyid ci ltar zhe na /
analyzed: de dag tha dad pa nyid ci ltar zhe na /
translated: How are they different?

original: lhag pa dang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lhag pa dang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: By excess and by deficiency.

original: shing nyid ni lhag pa yin te aa mra la sogs pa la yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shing nyid ni lhag pa yin te aa mra la sogs pa la yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The tree is in excess, because it exists in the mango, etc.

original: sha pa ni de lta ma yin no //
analyzed: sha pa ni de lta ma yin no //
translated: The fig is not like that.

original: lhag pa dang chad pas tha dad pa 'ba' zhig tu ni ma zad kyi /
analyzed: lhag pa dang chad pas tha dad pa 'ba' zhig tu ni ma zad kyi /
translated: Not only are they different by excess and deficiency,

original: 'on kyang khyab par bya ba dang / khyab par byed pa dag nye ba dang ring ba las snang ba dang mi snang ba las kyang tha dad pa'i phyir rang bzhin dang khyab byed mi dmigs pa dag tha dad pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang khyab par bya ba dang / khyab par byed pa dag nye ba dang ring ba las snang ba dang mi snang ba las kyang tha dad pa'i phyir rang bzhin dang khyab byed mi dmigs pa dag tha dad pa yin no //
translated: but also the non-apprehension of the nature and the non-apprehension of the pervaded are different because the pervaded and the pervader are different by proximity and distance, by appearance and non-appearance.

original: 'chad pa ni shing nyid ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'chad pa ni shing nyid ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The explanation is: The tree is...

original: gang gi phyir de ltar khyab par bya ba dang khyab par byed pa dag tha dad pa yin pas na zhes bya ba de'i phyir rang bzhin dang khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa dag tha dad do //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar khyab par bya ba dang khyab par byed pa dag tha dad pa yin pas na zhes bya ba de'i phyir rang bzhin dang khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa dag tha dad do //
translated: Because the pervaded and the pervader are different, therefore the non-observation of essential nature and the non-observation of the pervader are different.

original: snang du rung ba dang dmigs pa dag kyang de kho na bzhin du tha dad par 'gyur ro zhe na /üîΩdmigs pa'i zhes bya ba ste /üîΩdmigs pa'i @236a * //
analyzed: snang du rung ba dang dmigs pa dag kyang de kho na bzhin du tha dad par 'gyur ro zhe na / dmigs pa'i zhes bya ba ste / dmigs pa'i @236a * //
translated: And the suitability of appearance and the observation are also just like that, they are different.üîΩThe observation is that which has the characteristic of observation and it is also existent.

original: mtshan nyid du gyur ba'ang de yin la yod pa yang yin pa dang dmigs pa de dag gi tha dad par brtags par mi nus so //
analyzed: mtshan nyid du gyur ba'ang de yin la yod pa yang yin pa dang dmigs pa de dag gi tha dad par brtags par mi nus so //
translated: The difference between those observations cannot be imagined.

original: des na zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir shing dang sha pa dag ltar tha dad pa med pa des na /
analyzed: des na zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir shing dang sha pa dag ltar tha dad pa med pa des na /
translated: Therefore, because there is no difference between them, like a tree and a ≈õirƒ´·π£a tree,

original: 'di na bum pa med do zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin mi dmigs pa kho na yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di na bum pa med do zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin mi dmigs pa kho na yin gyi /
translated: here, a pot does not exist is only the non-observation of an essential nature.

original: khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not the non-observation of a pervader.

original: de ltar na mi dmigs pa rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kyi nang du 'du ba bsgrubs nas gtan tshigs rab dbye bshad pa la /
analyzed: de ltar na mi dmigs pa rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kyi nang du 'du ba bsgrubs nas gtan tshigs rab dbye bshad pa la /
translated: Thus, having established that non-apprehension is included within the natural argument, the explanation of the analysis of the argument is concluded.

original: tha dad pa ni dper ma brjod ces gang gsungs pa de'i mjug sdud pa ni des na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: tha dad pa ni dper ma brjod ces gang gsungs pa de'i mjug sdud pa ni des na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The conclusion of the statement, ‚ÄúDifference is not mentioned as an example,‚Äù is ‚ÄúTherefore‚Ä¶‚Äù

original: gang gi phyir de lta bu'i mi dmigs pa dngos po med pa'i tha snyad sgrub pa de nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de lta bu'i mi dmigs pa dngos po med pa'i tha snyad sgrub pa de nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because of just that non-apprehension which is the proof of the convention of non-existence.

original: gzhan du mi snang ba mi dmigs pa ni gzhan pa yod pa'i tha snyad 'gog pa yin gyi med pa'i tha snyad sgrub pa ni ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan du mi snang ba mi dmigs pa ni gzhan pa yod pa'i tha snyad 'gog pa yin gyi med pa'i tha snyad sgrub pa ni ma yin pa'o //
translated: Non-apprehension of non-appearance is the refutation of the convention of the existence of another, but it is not the proof of the convention of non-existence.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: mi snang ba la yod pa'am med par nges pa mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi snang ba la yod pa'am med par nges pa mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not possible to ascertain existence or non-existence in non-appearance.

original: gang zhig nges pa med pa'i bltar mi rung ba de ci 'dra ba zhig ce na /
analyzed: gang zhig nges pa med pa'i bltar mi rung ba de ci 'dra ba zhig ce na /
translated: What is that which is not ascertained and is not suitable to be seen?

original: dper zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dper zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúFor example‚Ä¶‚Äù

original: des med pa des na'o //
analyzed: des med pa des na'o //
translated: ‚ÄúBecause of that non-existence‚Ä¶‚Äù

original: 'bras bu nges pa med pa'i rang bzhin mi dmigs pa 'dis ni gtan tshigs kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs las ldog pa bsgrub par nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'bras bu nges pa med pa'i rang bzhin mi dmigs pa 'dis ni gtan tshigs kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs las ldog pa bsgrub par nus pa ma yin no //
translated: This non-apprehension of an effect or nature that is not ascertained is not able to prove the exclusion of the counter-pervasion of the reason.

original: 'on gang gis nus pa ma yin no zhe na dang po zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'on gang gis nus pa ma yin no zhe na dang po zhes bya ba ste /
translated: But by what is it not able? By the first, i.e.,

original: rgyu dang rang bzhin mi dmigs pa kho na gtan tshigs kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs las ldog pa sgrub pa'i dbang du byas pa yin no //
analyzed: rgyu dang rang bzhin mi dmigs pa kho na gtan tshigs kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs las ldog pa sgrub pa'i dbang du byas pa yin no //
translated: only the non-apprehension of cause and nature are taken into account in the proof of the exclusion of the counter-pervasion of the reason.

original: dang po zhes bya ba rnam par 'grel pa ni /
analyzed: dang po zhes bya ba rnam par 'grel pa ni /
translated: The commentary on the first is:

original: dang po zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dang po zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The first is the non-apprehension of the cause and nature.

original: gal te mi dmigs pa gnyi ga la yang mi mthun pa'i phyogs mtha' dag las ldog pa ma grub pa'i phyir ci ltar des ldog pa nges par 'gyur snyam na der yang zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: gal te mi dmigs pa gnyi ga la yang mi mthun pa'i phyogs mtha' dag las ldog pa ma grub pa'i phyir ci ltar des ldog pa nges par 'gyur snyam na der yang zhes bya ba ste /
translated: If one thinks that, since the non-apprehension of both is not established as the exclusion of all the counter-pervasion, how can it ascertain the exclusion by that? Then, also,

original: 'bras bu dang rang bzhin 'ba' zhig tu ni ma zad kyi rgyu dang khyab byed mi dmigs par yang ngo //
analyzed: 'bras bu dang rang bzhin 'ba' zhig tu ni ma zad kyi rgyu dang khyab byed mi dmigs par yang ngo //
translated: it is not only the effect and nature, but also the non-apprehension of cause and pervader.

original: des na ma grub pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: des na ma grub pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Therefore, it is not the case that it is not established. This is the meaning.

original: dogs pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dogs pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The doubt is, ‚ÄúIf . . .‚Äù

original: lan ni de yang zhes bya ste /
analyzed: lan ni de yang zhes bya ste /
translated: The response is, ‚ÄúThat also . . . ‚Äù

original: 'gal ba'o // 'gal bar ci ltar rtogs she na /
analyzed: 'gal ba'o // 'gal bar ci ltar rtogs she na /
translated: How is the contradiction understood?

original: yod na zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: yod na zhes bya ba ste /
translated: If it does, then it is not tenable that it is a non-thing.üîΩ

original: grang ba'i reg ba rgyun du 'byung ba na /
analyzed: grang ba'i reg ba rgyun du 'byung ba na /
translated: When the cold sensation occurs continuously,

original: de yod pas med pa'i phyir 'gal bar rtogs so //
analyzed: de yod pas med pa'i phyir 'gal bar rtogs so //
translated: because it exists, the heat does not exist. Therefore, the contradiction is understood.

original: gal te 'gal ba'i gtan tshigs med pa kho na ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te 'gal ba'i gtan tshigs med pa kho na ma yin nam /
translated: If the contradictory reason does not exist,üîΩis this not the classification of non-apprehension?

original: de @236b ltar mi dmigs pa'i rab tu dbye ba yin zhe na 'gal ba'i gtan tshigs ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de @236b ltar mi dmigs pa'i rab tu dbye ba yin zhe na 'gal ba'i gtan tshigs ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The contradictory reason . . . ‚Äù

original: de las gzhan pa'i zhes bya ba ni ci ltar 'gal ba de las gzhan 'bras bu mi dmigs pa la sogs pa mi dmigs pa'i rab tu dbye ba min pa de bzhin no //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i zhes bya ba ni ci ltar 'gal ba de las gzhan 'bras bu mi dmigs pa la sogs pa mi dmigs pa'i rab tu dbye ba min pa de bzhin no //
translated: Other than that . . . ‚Äù Just as the contradiction is not a classification of non-apprehension, such as the non-apprehension of the effect, in the same way . . .

original: de ltar ma yin na zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de ltar ma yin na zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If it were not so . . . ‚Äù

original: gal te 'gal ba mi dmigs pa'i dbye ba ma yin na de'i tshe /
analyzed: gal te 'gal ba mi dmigs pa'i dbye ba ma yin na de'i tshe /
translated: If the contradiction were not a classification of non-apprehension, then . . .

original: grang ba dang 'gal ba'i me dang 'bras bu du ba la sogs pa dang 'gal bas khyab pa ba dang / sogs pa'i sgras rgyus 'gal ba la sogs pa dag kyang bye brag ba la sogs pa gzhan dag tha dad pa ston par byed par 'gyur /
analyzed: grang ba dang 'gal ba'i me dang 'bras bu du ba la sogs pa dang 'gal bas khyab pa ba dang / sogs pa'i sgras rgyus 'gal ba la sogs pa dag kyang bye brag ba la sogs pa gzhan dag tha dad pa ston par byed par 'gyur /
translated: and fire and smoke, which are mutually exclusive because they are mutually contradictory, and so on, and the words ‚Äúand so on‚Äù indicate that other schools such as the Vaise~ika also teach that there are other types of difference, such as that of cause and effect.

original: 'o na gang gi tshe nyes pa 'di med snyam na /
analyzed: 'o na gang gi tshe nyes pa 'di med snyam na /
translated: But if you think that there is no fault in this,

original: gang gi tshe zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gang gi tshe zhes bya ba'o //
translated: then the response is, ‚ÄúWhen?‚Äù

original: de nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin mi dmigs pa'i'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin mi dmigs pa'i'o //
translated: ‚ÄúFor that very reason‚Äù means because of the non-apprehension of essence.

original: ci ltar 'di'i rnam ba'i dbye ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci ltar 'di'i rnam ba'i dbye ba yin zhe na /
translated: How is it a classification of that?

original: 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The response is, ‚ÄúIn this way.‚Äù

original: gal te dmigs ba ci ltar dngos po med pa'i sgrub par byed pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: gal te dmigs ba ci ltar dngos po med pa'i sgrub par byed pa yin zhe na /
translated: If the apprehension of an object is a proof of the existence of an object, how is the non-apprehension of an object a proof of the non-existence of an object?

original: ci ltar zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ci ltar zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The response is, ‚ÄúIn this way.‚Äù

original: ci'i phyir zhes bya ba ni dri ba'o //
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhes bya ba ni dri ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúWhy?‚Äù is a question.

original: lan ni 'gal ba'i zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lan ni 'gal ba'i zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The response is, ‚ÄúBecause of contradiction.‚Äù

original: gal te 'gal ba can dag las 'gal ba zhes bya ba gzhan ni yod ba ma yin la /
analyzed: gal te 'gal ba can dag las 'gal ba zhes bya ba gzhan ni yod ba ma yin la /
translated: If there is no other so-called contradiction apart from the contradictory things,

original: de yang rtogs pa ma yin pas na ci ltar na 'gal ba rtogs zhes brjod snyam na /
analyzed: de yang rtogs pa ma yin pas na ci ltar na 'gal ba rtogs zhes brjod snyam na /
translated: If you think, ‚ÄúSince it is not a realization, how can it be said that a contradiction is realized?‚Äù

original: 'gal ba ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'gal ba ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is a contradiction.

original: 'gal ba ni yod pa dang med pa'i mtshan nyid kho na yin pas /
analyzed: 'gal ba ni yod pa dang med pa'i mtshan nyid kho na yin pas /
translated: Since it is only the characteristic of existence and nonexistence that is a contradiction,

original: dmigs pa dang mi dmigs pas bsgrub par bya ba yin pa'i phyir dmigs pa dang mi dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid yin no zhes brjod ba yin no //
analyzed: dmigs pa dang mi dmigs pas bsgrub par bya ba yin pa'i phyir dmigs pa dang mi dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid yin no zhes brjod ba yin no //
translated: it is said that it is the characteristic of nonobservation and observation because it is to be established by nonobservation and observation.

original: des na 'gal ba me'i gzugs mthong ba las dro ba'i reg pa'i mtshan nyid grang ba'i reg pa mi dmigs pa bsgrub par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: des na 'gal ba me'i gzugs mthong ba las dro ba'i reg pa'i mtshan nyid grang ba'i reg pa mi dmigs pa bsgrub par bya ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, from the observation of the form of fire, the characteristic of the contact of heat, the cold contact is to be established as not observed.

original: gal te de lta na yang rang bzhin mi dmigs pa las rang bzhin 'gal ba dmigs pa ci ltar gzhan ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de lta na yang rang bzhin mi dmigs pa las rang bzhin 'gal ba dmigs pa ci ltar gzhan ma yin zhe na /
translated: If you think, ‚ÄúIn that case, how is the observation of a contradiction that is the opposite of the nonobservation of an intrinsic reality from the intrinsic reality itself?‚Äù

original: de las zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de las zhes bya ba'o //
translated: From that.üîΩIf you think, ‚ÄúHow is the observation of heat the nonobservation of cold?‚Äù

original: gal te dro ba'i reg pa dmigs pa ci ltar grang ba mi dmigs pa yin zhe na /üîΩdro ba yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te dro ba'i reg pa dmigs pa ci ltar grang ba mi dmigs pa yin zhe na /üîΩdro ba yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Heat.

original: de nyid kyang zhes bya ba ni cang med kyi rang bzhin dngos po med pa ni ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyang zhes bya ba ni cang med kyi rang bzhin dngos po med pa ni ma yin pa'o //
translated: That itself is not non-existent, i.e., not a non-entity, which has the nature of nothingness.

original: ci ltar dngos po nyid dngos po med pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci ltar dngos po nyid dngos po med pa yin zhe na /
translated: How can an entity be a non-entity?

original: des dben pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: des dben pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is devoid of that, i.e., of the entity.

original: dro ba'i reg pa 'ba' zhig ni grang ba med pa ma yin gyi /üîΩgrang ba dang dro ba @237a * //
analyzed: dro ba'i reg pa 'ba' zhig ni grang ba med pa ma yin gyi / grang ba dang dro ba @237a * //
translated: The mere sensation of heat is not the absence of cold,

original: gnyi ga ma yin pa yang grang ba med pa yin no //
analyzed: gnyi ga ma yin pa yang grang ba med pa yin no //
translated: but the absence of both cold and heat is the absence of cold.

original: gang go phyir de ltar srin pa des na dro ba'i reg bde dmigs pa nyid grang ba de mi dmigs pa yin no //
analyzed: gang go phyir de ltar srin pa des na dro ba'i reg bde dmigs pa nyid grang ba de mi dmigs pa yin no //
translated: Since it is so, the perception of the sensation of heat is itself the non-perception of cold.

original: 'gal ba'i 'bras bu dmigs pa yang rang bzhin mi dmigs pa las gzhan ma yin no zhes bstan ba ni 'gal ba'i zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'gal ba'i 'bras bu dmigs pa yang rang bzhin mi dmigs pa las gzhan ma yin no zhes bstan ba ni 'gal ba'i zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The perception of an effect that is incompatible with a certain thing is not different from the non-perception of the nature of that certain thing. This is what is being taught:üîΩThe perception of an effect that is incompatible with a certain thing is not different from the non-perception of the nature of that certain thing.

original: yang zhes bya ba ni 'gal ba dmigs pa 'ba' zhig tu ni ma zad kyi de'i 'bras bu dmigs pa yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: yang zhes bya ba ni 'gal ba dmigs pa 'ba' zhig tu ni ma zad kyi de'i 'bras bu dmigs pa yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù means that it is not only the perception of an incompatible thing, but also the perception of an effect of that incompatible thing.

original: dro ba'i reg pa dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi grang ba mi dmigs pa ni du ba'i mtshan nyid kyi 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs gang yin pa de'i rjes su dpag pa des grub pa yin no ;
analyzed: dro ba'i reg pa dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi grang ba mi dmigs pa ni du ba'i mtshan nyid kyi 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs gang yin pa de'i rjes su dpag pa des grub pa yin no ;
translated: The non-apprehension of cold which has the characteristic of the object of the sensation of heat is established by that inference which is the reason of effect having the characteristic of smoke.

original: / gal te 'di ci ltar rjes su dpag pas 'grub pa yin zhe na /üîΩsnga ma ni zhes bya ste rang bzhin 'gal ba dmigs par ni gzugs dang dro ba'i reg pa dag tshogs pa gcig la rag las ba nyid kyis na /
analyzed: / gal te 'di ci ltar rjes su dpag pas 'grub pa yin zhe na / snga ma ni zhes bya ste rang bzhin 'gal ba dmigs par ni gzugs dang dro ba'i reg pa dag tshogs pa gcig la rag las ba nyid kyis na /
translated: How is this established by inference?

original: gzugs mthong ba las ba ltar rung ba'i grang ba mi dmigs pa dro ba'i reg pa dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid rjes su dpog pa yin no //
analyzed: gzugs mthong ba las ba ltar rung ba'i grang ba mi dmigs pa dro ba'i reg pa dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid rjes su dpog pa yin no //
translated: The former, i.e., the apprehension of the contradictory essential nature, is the inference of the sensation of heat which has the characteristic of the non-apprehension of cold suitable to be seen from the seeing of form, because of the dependence of the collection of form and the sensation of heat on the same thing.

original: des na 'dir yang de'i rjes su dpag bas grub pa kho na'o //
analyzed: des na 'dir yang de'i rjes su dpag bas grub pa kho na'o //
translated: Therefore, here also, it is established only by the inference of that.

original: de ltar lhan cig mi gnas pa'i mtshan nyid kyi 'gal ba bstan nas /üîΩphan tshun spangs te gnas pa'i mtshan nyid 'gal ba brjod pa ni /
analyzed: de ltar lhan cig mi gnas pa'i mtshan nyid kyi 'gal ba bstan nas / phan tshun spangs te gnas pa'i mtshan nyid 'gal ba brjod pa ni /
translated: Thus, having taught contradiction as the non-coexistence of two things,üîΩhe states contradiction as the mutual exclusion of two things.

original: phan tshun zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: phan tshun zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Mutual exclusion is stated.

original: thams cad du zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: thams cad du zhes bya ba ni /
translated: ‚ÄúIn every way‚Äù means

original: lhan cig mi gnas pa'i mtshan nyid dang / mtshan nyid pa'i 'gal ba la yang ngo //
analyzed: lhan cig mi gnas pa'i mtshan nyid dang / mtshan nyid pa'i 'gal ba la yang ngo //
translated: that it is also the contradictory of the characteristic of non-coexistence.

original: bzlog pa dgag par bya bas dben pa dmigs pa nyid mi dmigs pa yin gyi med par dgag pa'i rang bzhin ma yin no zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: bzlog pa dgag par bya bas dben pa dmigs pa nyid mi dmigs pa yin gyi med par dgag pa'i rang bzhin ma yin no zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The opposite of that is the non-perception of the object of negation, which is the absence of the object of negation. It is not a negation that is the nature of an absence.

original: phan tshun spangs te gnas pa'i 'gal ba 'phen par byed pa nyid kyi 'gal ba gsum pa yang brjod pa ni /
analyzed: phan tshun spangs te gnas pa'i 'gal ba 'phen par byed pa nyid kyi 'gal ba gsum pa yang brjod pa ni /
translated: The third contradiction is stated to be the contradiction of the nature of the reason.

original: tshad ma zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: tshad ma zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is called ‚Äúthe valid means of knowledge.‚Äù

original: ci dang 'dra bar zhe na nges 'gyur dang ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ci dang 'dra bar zhe na nges 'gyur dang ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: What is it like? It is ‚Äúthat which is ascertained.‚Äù

original: ci ltar tshad mas gnod kyang 'gal ba ci ltar yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci ltar tshad mas gnod kyang 'gal ba ci ltar yin zhe na /
translated: How is it contradictory even when it is contradicted by a valid means of knowledge?

original: ci ltar zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ci ltar zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúHow?‚Äù

original: ci ltar 'di 'gal ba gzhan yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci ltar 'di 'gal ba gzhan yin zhe na /
translated: How is this a different contradiction?

original: 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIn this way.‚Äù

original: ltos bcas dang nges par 'gyur dag la yang 'gal ba 'di yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: ltos bcas dang nges par 'gyur dag la yang 'gal ba 'di yin nam zhe na /
translated: Is this contradiction also in the case of dependence and ascertainment?

original: ltos pa dang bcas pa yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ltos pa dang bcas pa yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúEven in the case of dependence.‚Äù

original: 'gal ba gzhan nyid gzhung 'dzugs pa ni 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'gal ba gzhan nyid gzhung 'dzugs pa ni 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The establishment of another contradiction is as follows:

original: ltos pa dang bcas pa'i rtags @237b las ni nges par 'gyur pa med pa sgrub par byed pa de yang phan tshun spangs pas 'gal ba yin no //
analyzed: ltos pa dang bcas pa'i rtags @237b las ni nges par 'gyur pa med pa sgrub par byed pa de yang phan tshun spangs pas 'gal ba yin no //
translated: From a reason that is related, there is no ascertainment of the probandum. That also is a contradiction that is mutually exclusive.

original: bstan pa dang bstan pa ma yin pa dag la yang don dam par yod par kho na yin te /
analyzed: bstan pa dang bstan pa ma yin pa dag la yang don dam par yod par kho na yin te /
translated: With respect to the taught and the non-taught, there is ultimate existence.

original: des na 'gal pa gzhan yin no //
analyzed: des na 'gal pa gzhan yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is another contradiction.

original: gzhan dag 'gal ba 'di 'gal ba gzhan yin pa spong ba ni /
analyzed: gzhan dag 'gal ba 'di 'gal ba gzhan yin pa spong ba ni /
translated: Others, rejecting this contradiction as another contradiction, say:

original: gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIf‚Äù means:üîΩ

original: de ni bden mod kyi zhes bya ba'i lan la don 'di yin te /
analyzed: de ni bden mod kyi zhes bya ba'i lan la don 'di yin te /
translated: That is true, but the reply is as follows: The meaning is this.

original: dngos su 'gal ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: dngos su 'gal ba ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not a direct contradiction,

original: 'on kyang brgyud nas yin te /
analyzed: 'on kyang brgyud nas yin te /
translated: but rather an indirect one.

original: des na 'dis ni 'gal ba gzhan kho na'o zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: des na 'dis ni 'gal ba gzhan kho na'o zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Therefore, this is just another contradiction.

original: dgag par bya ba nges par 'gyur ba nyid dang 'gal ba nges par 'gyur ba med pa nyid kyis khyab pa la ltos pa dang bcas pa de'i rang bzhin gyis kyang don gyis te /
analyzed: dgag par bya ba nges par 'gyur ba nyid dang 'gal ba nges par 'gyur ba med pa nyid kyis khyab pa la ltos pa dang bcas pa de'i rang bzhin gyis kyang don gyis te /
translated: The object of negation is ascertained as just the opposite of what is ascertained as the absence of existence.

original: dngos po ma yin par 'gal ba la bsams nas 'gal ba gzhan nyid du brjod pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dngos po ma yin par 'gal ba la bsams nas 'gal ba gzhan nyid du brjod pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the nature of that which is dependent is also contradictory to non-existence, and that the other contradiction is stated in terms of the contradiction of non-existence.

original: 'di la yang zhes bya ba ni 'gal bas khyab pa'i rang bzhin kyang ;
analyzed: 'di la yang zhes bya ba ni 'gal bas khyab pa'i rang bzhin kyang ;
translated: Here, also means that the nature which is pervaded by contradiction is also

original: don gyi 'gal bar 'gyur bas na zhes bstan pa la'o //
analyzed: don gyi 'gal bar 'gyur bas na zhes bstan pa la'o //
translated: contradictory in meaning.

original: gang gis 'di nye bar bstan pa la dogs pa yod par 'gyur ba ci 'di dgag par sgrub par byed pa yin par mthong ngam zhe na 'di ltar zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gang gis 'di nye bar bstan pa la dogs pa yod par 'gyur ba ci 'di dgag par sgrub par byed pa yin par mthong ngam zhe na 'di ltar zhes gsungs so //
translated: If one wonders how this is taught, the meaning is that it is seen as an affirmation of negation.

original: gzhan dag ces bya ba ni mi dmigs pa'i rang bzhin tsam gtan tshigs yin par smra ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan dag ces bya ba ni mi dmigs pa'i rang bzhin tsam gtan tshigs yin par smra ba'o //
translated: Others refers to those who say that the mere nature of non-apprehension is the reason.

original: tshigs thams cad ni mi dmigs pa las gzhan ma yin te /
analyzed: tshigs thams cad ni mi dmigs pa las gzhan ma yin te /
translated: All reasons are not different from non-apprehension.

original: mi dmigs pa gcig tu gtan tshigs yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa gcig tu gtan tshigs yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that non-apprehension is the one and only logical argument.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: mi dmigs pa dang lhan cig nyid yin pas na'o //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa dang lhan cig nyid yin pas na'o //
translated: Because it is the very same as non-apprehension.

original: 'bras bu la sogs pa mi dmigs pa dang gcig yin pa nyid ci ltar zhe na /
analyzed: 'bras bu la sogs pa mi dmigs pa dang gcig yin pa nyid ci ltar zhe na /
translated: How can non-apprehension of effect, etc. be the very same thing?

original: brjod pa ni 'gal te 'bras bu zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: brjod pa ni 'gal te 'bras bu zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The reply is: ‚ÄúContradictory effect, etc.‚Äù

original: me ma yin dang shing ma yin dang 'gal ba dang / me dang shing dag gis 'bras bu dang / khyab bya gang yin pa de sbyar ba gang yin pa der ni ste 'gal ba'i 'bras bu dang khyab bya dmigs par ni 'bras bu dang rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs dag kyang 'du ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: me ma yin dang shing ma yin dang 'gal ba dang / me dang shing dag gis 'bras bu dang / khyab bya gang yin pa de sbyar ba gang yin pa der ni ste 'gal ba'i 'bras bu dang khyab bya dmigs par ni 'bras bu dang rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs dag kyang 'du ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The effect and the pervaded that are contradictory and not-fire and not-fuel are the same as the effect and the pervaded that are fire and fuel. The application of the argument is as follows: ‚ÄúWhere there is the apprehension of the effect and the pervaded that are contradictory, there is the apprehension of the effect and the pervaded that are fire and fuel.‚Äù Because the effect and nature-evidence are included in the effect and pervaded that are contradictory.

original: gang gi phyir de lta yin pa des na gtan tshigs rnam pa gsum ka yang mi dmigs pa de nyid kyis rab tu dbye ba yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de lta yin pa des na gtan tshigs rnam pa gsum ka yang mi dmigs pa de nyid kyis rab tu dbye ba yin no //
translated: Since that is the case, all three kinds of evidence are distinguished by that very same non-apprehension.

original: gtan tshigs thams cad ces bya ba rnam par 'grel ba ni mi dmigs gcig pu zhes bya ba'o //üîΩgcig nyid kyis @238a * //
analyzed: gtan tshigs thams cad ces bya ba rnam par 'grel ba ni mi dmigs gcig pu zhes bya ba'o // gcig nyid kyis @238a * //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúall reasons‚Äù is explained by the phrase ‚Äúnon-observation alone.‚Äù

original: zhes bya ba rnam par 'grel ba ni 'bras bu dang zhes bya ba'o //üîΩ'gal 'bras zhes bya ba rnam par 'grel ba ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba rnam par 'grel ba ni 'bras bu dang zhes bya ba'o // 'gal 'bras zhes bya ba rnam par 'grel ba ni /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúby one alone‚Äù is explained by the phrase ‚Äúeffect.‚Äù

original: de la zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúcontradictory effect‚Äù is explained by the phrase ‚Äúin that regard.‚Äù

original: de ni zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu dang rang bzhin dag mi dmigs par 'du ba ni'o //
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu dang rang bzhin dag mi dmigs par 'du ba ni'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthat‚Äù refers to the effect and nature that are not observed.

original: ci ltar mi rung zhe na /üîΩde bdag ces bya ba'o//üîΩgal te gtan tshigs 'brel pa dang rjes su mthun par rtogs na de'i tshe de'i bdag nyid dang de las byung bas na rang bzhin dang 'bras bu dag kho na gtan tshigs su 'gyur gyi gzhan ni ma yin no //
analyzed: ci ltar mi rung zhe na / de bdag ces bya ba'o// gal te gtan tshigs 'brel pa dang rjes su mthun par rtogs na de'i tshe de'i bdag nyid dang de las byung bas na rang bzhin dang 'bras bu dag kho na gtan tshigs su 'gyur gyi gzhan ni ma yin no //
translated: Why is it not tenable?üîΩThe phrase ‚Äúthat is its nature‚Äù refers to the effect.üîΩIf a reason is understood to be related to the property of the thesis, then the reason is only nature and effect, because it is the same nature or it arises from it.

original: bsgrub par bya ba gang la sgrub par byed pa gang zhig dngos su 'brel pa de la ltos te tha dad pa yin la /
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba gang la sgrub par byed pa gang zhig dngos su 'brel pa de la ltos te tha dad pa yin la /
translated: The property of the thesis is different in relation to that which is directly related to the proof.

original: rgyu dang khyab par byed pa la yang 'bras bu la sogs pa dngos su 'brel pa yin te /
analyzed: rgyu dang khyab par byed pa la yang 'bras bu la sogs pa dngos su 'brel pa yin te /
translated: And the cause and the pervader are directly related to the effect, etc.

original: des na de la ltos pa kho nas de dag tha dad pa yin no //
analyzed: des na de la ltos pa kho nas de dag tha dad pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, they are different only in dependence on that.

original: me ma yin pa dang / shing ma yin pa bkag par ni gang yang 'brel pa ma yin te /
analyzed: me ma yin pa dang / shing ma yin pa bkag par ni gang yang 'brel pa ma yin te /
translated: But the negation of non-fire and non-tree is not related to anything.

original: des na ci ltar de la ltos te mi dmigs pa'i rang bzhin nyid yin //
analyzed: des na ci ltar de la ltos te mi dmigs pa'i rang bzhin nyid yin //
translated: So how can it be non-apprehension in dependence on that?

original: gzhan gyis bsams pas brgyud pa ston pa ni /
analyzed: gzhan gyis bsams pas brgyud pa ston pa ni /
translated: The following shows the transmission of the opponent's thought:

original: mi rtag pa nyid dam zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid dam zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Is impermanence?

original: gzhan gyi lugs las gzhan gyi lugs khyad par can du ston pa ni /
analyzed: gzhan gyi lugs las gzhan gyi lugs khyad par can du ston pa ni /
translated: The following shows the opponent's system to be distinctive from other systems:

original: de la zhes bya ba ni me la sogs pa la'o //
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba ni me la sogs pa la'o //
translated: In that refers to fire, etc.

original: ci ltar srid pa ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci ltar srid pa ma yin zhe na /
translated: How is it impossible?

original: 'bras bus ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'bras bus ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: By the effect, etc.

original: dngos su ni zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dngos su ni zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Directly means

original: gang gis mi dmigs pa nyid du 'gyur pa grang ba la sogs pa nyid la ni du ba la sogs pa dngos su byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gis mi dmigs pa nyid du 'gyur pa grang ba la sogs pa nyid la ni du ba la sogs pa dngos su byed pa ma yin no //
translated: that smoke, etc. are not directly produced by cold, etc. by which they would be non-apprehended.

original: des na brgyud nas zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu du ba las rjes su dpag ba'i me 'gal ba dmigs pa'i rang bzhin gyis grang ba'i reg pa'i rang bzhin mi dmigs par rjes su dpag pas grang ba med pa'i tha snyad rjes su dpog pa'o //
analyzed: des na brgyud nas zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu du ba las rjes su dpag ba'i me 'gal ba dmigs pa'i rang bzhin gyis grang ba'i reg pa'i rang bzhin mi dmigs par rjes su dpag pas grang ba med pa'i tha snyad rjes su dpog pa'o //
translated: Therefore, ‚Äúindirectly‚Äù means that the inference of the absence of cold is inferred from the non-apprehension of the nature of cold, which is incompatible with the fire inferred from the effect, smoke.

original: gal te 'gal ba'i 'bras bu dmigs pa zhes sgra gcig gis bstan pa'i phyir 'di gtan tshigs gcig kho na ma yin nam des na ci ltar rjes su dpag pas rjes su dpog pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: gal te 'gal ba'i 'bras bu dmigs pa zhes sgra gcig gis bstan pa'i phyir 'di gtan tshigs gcig kho na ma yin nam des na ci ltar rjes su dpag pas rjes su dpog pa yin zhe na /
translated: If it is only one reason, because it is indicated by the single word ‚Äúapprehension of an effect that is incompatible,‚Äù then how is it an inference of an inference?

original: de la zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba ste /
translated: In response, ƒÄryadeva says,

original: de ltar gnas pa na gnyis sam zhes bya ba gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: de ltar gnas pa na gnyis sam zhes bya ba gtan tshigs so //
translated: ‚ÄúWhen it is like this, either two or one.‚Äù

original: gcig gis zhes bya ba ni 'gal ba'i 'bras bu dmigs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras so //
analyzed: gcig gis zhes bya ba ni 'gal ba'i 'bras bu dmigs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras so //
translated: ‚ÄúOne‚Äù refers to the word ‚Äúapprehension of an effect that is incompatible.‚Äù

original: 'di ltar 'di na grang ba'i reg pa med de me yod ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'i sbyor bar me nyid dang du ba nyid @238b rang gi bsgrub par bya ba la ltos te /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'di na grang ba'i reg pa med de me yod ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'i sbyor bar me nyid dang du ba nyid @238b rang gi bsgrub par bya ba la ltos te /
translated: In this way, the application is ‚ÄúHere there is no cold touch because there is fire.‚Äù Fire and smoke are the reasons in relation to their own probandum.

original: gtan tshigs yin pa'o //
analyzed: gtan tshigs yin pa'o //
translated: The reason is:

original: gsum zhes bya ba ni du ba dang me dang snang ba mi dmigs pa ste gsum mo //
analyzed: gsum zhes bya ba ni du ba dang me dang snang ba mi dmigs pa ste gsum mo //
translated: ‚ÄúThree‚Äù refers to smoke, fire, and the non-apprehension of light.

original: 'di dag kyang sgra gcig gis bstan kyang de zhes bya ba 'bras bu la sogs pa'i rang bzhin ma gtogs pa mi dmigs pa tsam ma yin la /
analyzed: 'di dag kyang sgra gcig gis bstan kyang de zhes bya ba 'bras bu la sogs pa'i rang bzhin ma gtogs pa mi dmigs pa tsam ma yin la /
translated: Although these are indicated by one word, the meaning is that it is not merely the non-apprehension of anything other than the nature of the effect, etc.,

original: gcig nyid kyang ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gcig nyid kyang ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: and it is not a unity.

original: gal te sgra gcig gis brjod par bya ba yin pa'i phyir na /
analyzed: gal te sgra gcig gis brjod par bya ba yin pa'i phyir na /
translated: If it is to be expressed by one word,

original: ci ltar gcig ma yin zhe na gang du zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ci ltar gcig ma yin zhe na gang du zhes bya ba'o //
translated: how is it not a unity?

original: gzhan du zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gcig tu 'gyur pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan du zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gcig tu 'gyur pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúElsewhere‚Äù means that it would have a single nature.

original: de ste yin dang cir 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de ste yin dang cir 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If it is so, what is the problem?

original: de ltar yin dang zhes bya ba ste ;
analyzed: de ltar yin dang zhes bya ba ste ;
translated: ‚ÄúIf it is so‚Äù means

original: sgra'i dbang gis gzhan du gyur na'o //
analyzed: sgra'i dbang gis gzhan du gyur na'o //
translated: if it becomes different by the power of words.

original: gnyis sam zhes bya ba'i rnam par 'grel ba ni /
analyzed: gnyis sam zhes bya ba'i rnam par 'grel ba ni /
translated: The explanation of the phrase ‚Äútwo or more‚Äù is

original: 'di ni zhes bya ba nas 'gal ba dmigs pa yin la zhes bya ba'i bar ro //
analyzed: 'di ni zhes bya ba nas 'gal ba dmigs pa yin la zhes bya ba'i bar ro //
translated: from ‚Äúthis‚Äù up to ‚Äúthe apprehension of contradiction.‚Äù

original: 'di nyid rang bzhin mi dmigs pa yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i mthar thug pas ni gsum zhes bya ba rnam par 'grel pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di nyid rang bzhin mi dmigs pa yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i mthar thug pas ni gsum zhes bya ba rnam par 'grel pa yin no //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúbecause it is not perceived by nature‚Äù is the final part of the sentence, and it explains the word ‚Äúthree.‚Äù

original: gal te 'bras bu dang rang bzhin dag gzhan gyis mi dmigs ba'i nang du 'du bar brjod pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te 'bras bu dang rang bzhin dag gzhan gyis mi dmigs ba'i nang du 'du bar brjod pa ma yin nam /
translated: But aren‚Äôt the effect and the nature included in the nonperception of another?

original: grub pa'i mtha' las kyang de dag nyid tha dad par bstan par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' las kyang de dag nyid tha dad par bstan par bya ba yin no //
translated: And in the treatise, they are taught as distinct.

original: des na me yod de du ba yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des na me yod de du ba yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: So, ‚ÄúThere is fire because there is smoke.‚ÄùüîΩ‚ÄúThis is a tree because it is a ≈õi·πÉ≈õapƒÅ.‚Äù

original: 'di ni shing yin te shad yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar bstan par 'os pa las 'di la grang ba'i reg ba med do zhes bya ba la sogs pa nye bar bkod pas ci bya zhe na /
analyzed: 'di ni shing yin te shad yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar bstan par 'os pa las 'di la grang ba'i reg ba med do zhes bya ba la sogs pa nye bar bkod pas ci bya zhe na /
translated: But here, the opponent has adduced the argument, ‚ÄúIt is not cold to the touch.‚Äù

original: bden mod kyi 'on kyang thams cad du rjes su dpag pas rjes su dpog pa la sgra gcig gis brjod par bya ba nyid kyi tha mi dad par mi 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'i don du 'di gsungs par zad do //
analyzed: bden mod kyi 'on kyang thams cad du rjes su dpag pas rjes su dpog pa la sgra gcig gis brjod par bya ba nyid kyi tha mi dad par mi 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'i don du 'di gsungs par zad do //
translated: This is true, but the point of the passage is to show that in all cases, when an inference is inferred, the two are not distinct in being expressed by the same word.

original: sgra'i dbang gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa rnam par 'grel pa ni /
analyzed: sgra'i dbang gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa rnam par 'grel pa ni /
translated: The commentary on ‚Äúby the power of sound‚Äù and so on is:

original: gsum po rnams zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gsum po rnams zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚Äúthe three.‚Äù

original: 'gal ba'i 'bras bu dmigs pa zhes brjod btsam gyis ni 'bras bu dang rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs mi dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'gal ba'i 'bras bu dmigs pa zhes brjod btsam gyis ni 'bras bu dang rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs mi dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúthe observation of a contradictory effect‚Äù is not just the observation of an effect and a natural reason.

original: gal te gtan tshigs rnams tha dad yin na ci ltar gcig gis sgras brjod par bya ba nyid yin zhe na 'di ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te gtan tshigs rnams tha dad yin na ci ltar gcig gis sgras brjod par bya ba nyid yin zhe na 'di ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If the reasons are different, how can they be expressed by one sound?

original: mjug sdud pa ni de'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mjug sdud pa ni de'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The conclusion is ‚ÄúTherefore.‚Äù

original: gzhan sel ba'i yul can nyid kyis na /
analyzed: gzhan sel ba'i yul can nyid kyis na /
translated: Since the object of exclusion is the same,

original: gtan tshigs thams cad mi dmigs pa yin no zhes @239a * //
analyzed: gtan tshigs thams cad mi dmigs pa yin no zhes @239a * //
translated: all reasons are non-observations.

original: dogs pa bcu ba ni 'on te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dogs pa bcu ba ni 'on te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The tenth doubt is ‚ÄúBut if . . .‚Äù

original: lan ni ma yin te zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: lan ni ma yin te zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The response is ‚ÄúNo, because . . . .‚Äù

original: gang gis de tha mi dad pas tha dad pa med par 'gyur ba rnam par gcod pa kho na ni gtan tshigs kyi yul ma yin gyi /
analyzed: gang gis de tha mi dad pas tha dad pa med par 'gyur ba rnam par gcod pa kho na ni gtan tshigs kyi yul ma yin gyi /
translated: The object of a reason is not just the exclusion of what is other, because if it were not different from that, it would not be different.

original: 'on kyang rgyu la sogs pa yang yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang rgyu la sogs pa yang yin no //
translated: However, it is also a cause and so forth.

original: des na de tha dad pa kho nas tha dad pa yin no //
analyzed: des na de tha dad pa kho nas tha dad pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is different just because it is different.

original: bstan bcos mdzad pas kyang yul gyi dbye ba gtan tshigs kyi dbye ba'i rgyu mtshan yin no zhes ston ba ni de ltar yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: bstan bcos mdzad pas kyang yul gyi dbye ba gtan tshigs kyi dbye ba'i rgyu mtshan yin no zhes ston ba ni de ltar yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The author of the treatise also states that the difference in the reason is due to the difference in the object, saying, ‚ÄúIn that way, too.‚Äù

original: phyogs kyi mi dmigs pa 'dis ni dngos po las yang dngos po'i che khas ma blangs pa'i dgag bsgrub par byed pa yin la /
analyzed: phyogs kyi mi dmigs pa 'dis ni dngos po las yang dngos po'i che khas ma blangs pa'i dgag bsgrub par byed pa yin la /
translated: This non-observation of the object by the reason proves the negation of the existence of one thing from another,

original: snga ma 'bras bu dang rang bzhin dag gis ni rgyu la sogs pa'i rang bzhin ma yin pa sgrub par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: snga ma 'bras bu dang rang bzhin dag gis ni rgyu la sogs pa'i rang bzhin ma yin pa sgrub par byed pa yin no //
translated: while the previous two, effect and nature, prove the non-nature of cause and so forth.

original: des na dgag pa dang don gzhan dang gzhan ma yin pa bsgrub pa yul gyi dbye ba tha dad pas gtan tshigs tha dad pa yin no //
analyzed: des na dgag pa dang don gzhan dang gzhan ma yin pa bsgrub pa yul gyi dbye ba tha dad pas gtan tshigs tha dad pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, negation and the proof of identity and difference of object are different reasons.

original: 'on te zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu la sogs pas gtan tshigs rgyu la sogs pa'i rang bzhin sgrub par byed pa yin yang /
analyzed: 'on te zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu la sogs pas gtan tshigs rgyu la sogs pa'i rang bzhin sgrub par byed pa yin yang /
translated: ‚Äú However‚Äù means that although the reason proves the nature of the cause and so forth by way of effect and so forth,

original: don dam par na rnam par gcod pa lhur byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: don dam par na rnam par gcod pa lhur byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'o //
translated: because in the ultimate sense, the exclusion of other is the principal factor.

original: rang rig pa'i zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs kyis ni me la sogs pa rang rig ba'i rang bzhin kho na sgrub par byed pa yin no zhes ci ste mi brjod /
analyzed: rang rig pa'i zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs kyis ni me la sogs pa rang rig ba'i rang bzhin kho na sgrub par byed pa yin no zhes ci ste mi brjod /
translated: Why not say that the reasonings such as that of effect prove only the self-awareness which is the nature of fire, etc.?

original: me grub pa na ni don dam par rang rig pa kho na grub pa yin te /
analyzed: me grub pa na ni don dam par rang rig pa kho na grub pa yin te /
translated: When fire is established, it is only self-awareness that is ultimately established,

original: phyi rol gyi me med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi me med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no external fire.

original: de bas na rigs pa thams cad ni rang rig pa lhur gyur ba yin pa'i phyir rang rig ba kho na brjod par rigs so //
analyzed: de bas na rigs pa thams cad ni rang rig pa lhur gyur ba yin pa'i phyir rang rig ba kho na brjod par rigs so //
translated: Therefore, since all reasonings are directed toward self-awareness, it is only self-awareness that should be stated.

original: 'on te tha snyad la ltos pas de skad mi brjod na /
analyzed: 'on te tha snyad la ltos pas de skad mi brjod na /
translated: But if that is not stated because it depends on convention,

original: de'i tshe 'brel pa dang rjes su mthun ba kho nar sgrub par byed pa rnam par dbye bar rigs so //
analyzed: de'i tshe 'brel pa dang rjes su mthun ba kho nar sgrub par byed pa rnam par dbye bar rigs so //
translated: then it is only proper to distinguish the proof as being in accordance with the connection.

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni mi dmigs pa rnams rang bzhin mi dmigs pa'i nang du 'du ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni mi dmigs pa rnams rang bzhin mi dmigs pa'i nang du 'du ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because, the non-apprehensions are included in the non-apprehension of nature.

original: 'gal bas khyab pa dmigs pa ci lta ba zhig yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'gal bas khyab pa dmigs pa ci lta ba zhig yin zhe na /
translated: What is the pervasion by contradiction that is observed?

original: ltos pa dang zhes bya ba dang 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ltos pa dang zhes bya ba dang 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚Äú In dependence‚Äù and ‚Äúin this way.‚Äù

original: ci'i phyir gdon mi za ba ma yin zhes na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir gdon mi za ba ma yin zhes na /
translated: Why is it not necessarily so?

original: rgyu gzhan de yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rgyu gzhan de yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚Äú That other cause‚Äù and so on.

original: 'di snyam du dngos po'i rgyu yin pa de nyid 'jig byed bskyed pa'i sgo nas 'jig pa'i rgyu yin pa des na nges pa yin no zhes dogs pa ni /
analyzed: 'di snyam du dngos po'i rgyu yin pa de nyid 'jig byed bskyed pa'i sgo nas 'jig pa'i rgyu yin pa des na nges pa yin no zhes dogs pa ni /
translated: If you think that the very cause of an entity is the cause of its destruction, because it generates the destruction, then it is certain.

original: 'on te zhes bya ba'o//
analyzed: 'on te zhes bya ba'o//
translated: ‚Äú But if‚Äù and so on.

original: @239b lan ni dngos po'i zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: @239b lan ni dngos po'i zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The reply is ‚ÄúThe nature of an entity‚Äù and so on.

original: dogs pa ni 'dir zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dogs pa ni 'dir zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The doubt is ‚ÄúHere‚Äù and so on.

original: lan ni de ni zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: lan ni de ni zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The reply is ‚ÄúThat‚Äù and so on.

original: dngos po'i rang bzhin rnam pa gzhan yin pa'i phyir na dngos po'i rang bzhin lan 'debs so zhes bya ba 'di mi rigs so //
analyzed: dngos po'i rang bzhin rnam pa gzhan yin pa'i phyir na dngos po'i rang bzhin lan 'debs so zhes bya ba 'di mi rigs so //
translated: Since the nature of an entity is of a different kind, it is not tenable to reply that the nature of an entity is the cause of its destruction.

analyzed: ci ltar dngos po'i rang bzhin de lta ma yin zhe na 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
translated: How is the nature of an entity not so? ‚Äú In this way‚Äù and so on.

original: dngos po'i bdag nyid grub par gyur na /
analyzed: dngos po'i bdag nyid grub par gyur na /
translated: If the nature of an entity were established,

original: bdag la phan 'dogs bar byed ba gang zhig yin te /
analyzed: bdag la phan 'dogs bar byed ba gang zhig yin te /
translated: What is it that benefits the self?

original: 'ga' yang ma yin no //
analyzed: 'ga' yang ma yin no //
translated: Nothing at all.

original: 'on te bdag la phan 'dogs par byed pa ma yin na /
analyzed: 'on te bdag la phan 'dogs par byed pa ma yin na /
translated: But if it does not benefit the self,

original: de'i tshe grub pa zin ba des ltos par bya ba gang zhig yod de ci yang med do //
analyzed: de'i tshe grub pa zin ba des ltos par bya ba gang zhig yod de ci yang med do //
translated: then what is it that is established? There is nothing at all.

original: 'chad pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'chad pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The explanation is this: ‚ÄúIf‚Äù means ‚Äúif it were the case that.

original: de lta na yang zhes bya ba ni gzhan yin par gyur na yang de'i 'jig pa'i rgyu ma yin no zhes bya ba 'jig pa'i rgyu de grub pa de dang 'brel par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de lta na yang zhes bya ba ni gzhan yin par gyur na yang de'i 'jig pa'i rgyu ma yin no zhes bya ba 'jig pa'i rgyu de grub pa de dang 'brel par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚Äù ‚ÄúEven though‚Äù means ‚Äúeven though it were different, it would not be the cause of its destruction.‚Äù The cause of its destruction would not be related to that which is established.

original: 'on te grub pa la yang khyad par gang yin pa de byed pa des na de 'jig pa'i rgyu yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te grub pa la yang khyad par gang yin pa de byed pa des na de 'jig pa'i rgyu yin no zhe na /
translated: But if it is the case that it produces a difference in what is already established, then it is the cause of its destruction.

original: lan ni de lta yin dang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lan ni de lta yin dang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The response to that is ‚ÄúIf that were so.

original: de las gzhan zhes bya ba ni ma grub pa'o //
analyzed: de las gzhan zhes bya ba ni ma grub pa'o //
translated: ‚Äù ‚ÄúDifferent from that‚Äù means ‚Äúnot established.‚Äù

original: phyogs dang po'i dogs pa bsu nas sun 'byin pa ni /
analyzed: phyogs dang po'i dogs pa bsu nas sun 'byin pa ni /
translated: The refutation of the first possibility is this:

original: gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIf‚Äù means ‚Äúif it were the case that.üîΩ‚Äù

original: snga ma bzhin du zhes bya ba ni bdag la phan 'dogs par byed pa gang zhes bya ba des bstan pa'o//
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du zhes bya ba ni bdag la phan 'dogs par byed pa gang zhes bya ba des bstan pa'o//
translated: ‚ÄúAs before‚Äù refers to ‚Äúwhatever benefits itself.‚Äù

original: gal te zhes bya bas ni phyogs gnyis pa dogs pa bsu ba'o //üîΩde'i bdag nyid ces bya ba ni grub pa'i bdag nyid kyi khyad par ro //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya bas ni phyogs gnyis pa dogs pa bsu ba'o // de'i bdag nyid ces bya ba ni grub pa'i bdag nyid kyi khyad par ro //
translated: ‚ÄúIf‚Äù introduces the second position.üîΩ‚ÄúIts own nature‚Äù is the particular nature of the established thing.

original: de'i bdag nyid las zhes bya ba grub pa'i bdag nyid las tha dad pa'o //
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid las zhes bya ba grub pa'i bdag nyid las tha dad pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúFrom its own nature‚Äù is different from the nature of the established thing.

original: de'i zhes bya ba grub pa'i phan 'dogs par byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i zhes bya ba grub pa'i phan 'dogs par byed pa ma yin te /
translated: ‚ÄúIt‚Äù is not the established thing that benefits itself.

original: 'jig par byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'jig par byed pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not the established thing that destroys itself.

original: 'o na khyad par de tha dad pa dang tha mi dad par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na khyad par de tha dad pa dang tha mi dad par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: ‚ÄúBut then that difference would be different or not different from it.‚Äù

original: gnyi gar smra ba zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gnyi gar smra ba zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is the position of the SƒÅ·πÉkhya.

original: de las gzhan dang zhes bya ba ni dus gzhan du mi gnas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de las gzhan dang zhes bya ba ni dus gzhan du mi gnas par 'gyur ro //
translated: ‚ÄúFrom that‚Äù means it would not endure at another time.

original: dus kyi cha kun zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dus kyi cha kun zhes bya ba ni /
translated: ‚ÄúAll parts of time‚Äù means

original: gal te skad cig gcig kho na la dus kyi cha thams cad khyab pa /
analyzed: gal te skad cig gcig kho na la dus kyi cha thams cad khyab pa /
translated: if all parts of time are pervaded by a single moment,

original: 'bras bu thams cad kyi sgrub byed du gyur pa'i dngos po rtogs pa yin na de'i tshe skad cig gnyis pa la rang nyid kho na 'jig pa'i rgyu ci zhig byas te /
analyzed: 'bras bu thams cad kyi sgrub byed du gyur pa'i dngos po rtogs pa yin na de'i tshe skad cig gnyis pa la rang nyid kho na 'jig pa'i rgyu ci zhig byas te /
translated: If it is the realization of a thing that is the cause of all effects, then at the second moment, what does it do to cause its own destruction?

original: ci yang byar med do //
analyzed: ci yang byar med do //
translated: Nothing at all!

original: ci dang 'dra bar don med ce na /
analyzed: ci dang 'dra bar don med ce na /
translated: In what way is it purposeless?

original: chus khyer ba la ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: chus khyer ba la ces bya ba'o //
translated: It is like a raft.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /üîΩrags @240a * //
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na / rags @240a * //
translated: Why is it like a raft?

original: 'dzugs pa ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'dzugs pa ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Because it is a means of crossing over.

original: 'di gang las she na /
analyzed: 'di gang las she na /
translated: What is it a means of crossing over?

original: gang gi phyir chu mi 'gog par zhes bya ba'o //üîΩmi 'gog kyang rags 'dzugs so zhe na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir chu mi 'gog par zhes bya ba'o // mi 'gog kyang rags 'dzugs so zhe na /
translated: It is a means of crossing over the ocean of existence.üîΩIf it is a means of crossing over, then it is not purposeless.üîΩIf it is a means of crossing over, then it is not purposeless.üîΩIf it is a means of crossing over, then it is not purposeless.
